column2: If you could change anything about the sales or design centre process  what would it be?
The location was inconvenient.
The time for delivery.  I know you gave 10,0000 bonus at the design centre,  great Job, but next time if you add the appliances too will beperfect ??.
Extra bedroom in first floor ,finished carage with shelves and closed kitchen

We have mixed reviews for the builder. On the one hand, we were very disappointed with the inflexibility of construction. We did not have the option to choose the specific lot with the specific model we wanted - that made it very difficult as there was a specific lot I was after which did not have the model I wanted. We have purchased from a competing builder and they were very flexible with this kind of thing - that was our reference point. The thing that bothered us the most though was they were unwilling to add a bathroom in the basement (or even a rough-in) when that is a standard that all builders we spoke to offer. On the other hand, we were exceptionally grateful when, after we were informed that the closing was delayed, we were allowed to make changes at the design center. We understand that the builder did not have to accept our changes, but did so anyway and we really appreciated that.  So while the staff and the process was great, the inflexibility (particularly with the rough-in bathroom) was what we did not like. I am also wondering why we were not called for a Frame Check Walk-Through.

I would not subject anyone to Henrietta at the Design Center.  We found her to be difficult with regard to communication, rude and unable to fatham that we required technical explanation for some of the details she was attempting to explain.  The experience with Henrietta was not pleasant.  Kim Knuth, on the other hand, was wonderful.
When the salesman was asked questions they would get defensive.  I asked about cracked basements and they got defensive.

Everything has been great. If something went wrong we greatly appreciated staff going above and beyond to rectify it. We had the tile we picked for our main floor become discontinued...we went in and picked out another plus a different backsplash as it no longer matched the new tile. Staff were able to allow us an upgraded tile as we could not find another we liked in the standard selection.
Get the house in time ( no delays)
Tamarack staff were exceptional! Muskoka representative came across stressed.

Our overall experience with Tamarack has been good, but the unavailability of appointments at the design centre has caused a delay in our house construction and has been a source of major disappointment for us. We have had to wait 4-6 weeks for each appointment and even then we had one appointment rescheduled on multiple occasions by Tamarack. Although our designer was extremely professional, helpful and knowledgeable, she appeared exhausted and we found the whole design process very disorganized compared to other builders such as Urbandale and Minto. This has affected our closing date (we have not had a framing inspection and we could not complete certain parts of this survey) and has caused us to question if we would recommend Tamarack to our friends and family. We would highly recommend that you hire another design consultant during busy periods.

Too many options at the design centre...why can't the tiny options bundled together or included in the purchase price ?

The sales person from Stittsville sales center, Valerie, is awsome. Because of her I ended up owning a Tamarack home. 

I visited other sals centres as well, but they were not friendly with me at all.
No comments.
allow more time at the design centre
Everything was perfect, very well organized

Sales: We would appreciate if the agent that recommended to us Tamarack Cardinal Creek was recognized by your company. He is with Remax, Greg Hamre. Thank you.
Design centre: It was often hard to get a staff member on the line and sometimes, it is better to explain ourselves over the phone. 
Other than that, super!
nothing at all. So far it's been great.

I would give the option to buyers to put a rough in washroom as standard in basement. But overall Jaqui is a amazing sales person and great to have in any company and Tamarack is Lucky to have her and good for the buyers too she is very helpful.

better show room, mark-up way to i for the up grade, don't appreciate to pay twice some material already paid in purchase price
more UN-satisfaction to be submitted soon

Worked with Louise and she was fantastic! She was able to accommodate us before Christmas she was flexible and available almost like part of our family.
PART 3    was answered 5(could not skip that part) because they bought a model home N/A
Obnoxiously high costs and markup on upgrades on simple things like plumbing and potlights.
More time during the review and selection process would have been nice.

Sales Centre:  would be nice to have a sales rep accompany customer into the model homes to explain what are standard, upgrades and able to ask questions on the spot.   It is overwhelming to remember all questions when returning to the sales office. 

Design Center: More affordable items for upgrades,  nice upgraded are too expensive.

Home: hired a home inspector who flagged life threating issues in the home.  1.)  Door from garage to home wouldn't close shut. Causing concern that carbon monoxide would leak into the house due to car parked in the garage. 2.) gas pipe in the back yard was too short (was below the deck , not above the deck and was from the door as the other surrounding homes).  Gas Pipe was too close to the patio door and was advised to not open the door until the pipe fitted to proper size as gas may leak into the house.  Was unable to open the window and doors until this issue was resolved.    
The above wouldn't have been detected without spending $400-$500 for home inspection and attention to these dangerous issues should be properly inspected prior to possession of home.    They still have small deficiencies that are pending. 


Note for CEO:  prices to hang TV over the fireplace was too expensive ($500)  plus wiring and only cost a under $200 to do afterwards.   Little consideration to buyer with pricing would be appreciated as we are spending a lot to purchase a home.   Would have liked a second sink in the second washroom but wanted a lot of money to add the second sink. 
Overall, very happy.
upgrades are overpriced, and feel some items eg. crown moulding should be standard.
NOTHING
Be able to offer some to the things that tamarack wouldn't do- cover back porch, stone number, pot lights on exterior second level, picket doors

1. Make separate show home without any upgrades, which has only standard feature, easy to identify how home will look like.
2. At design Center, not lot of options in standard feature, need to add more, mostly in cabinet.
3. Home owner should give entry to home, one time in a month before 3 months of closing, to see progress.
* There was a limited selection of bathroom and kitchen plumbing fixtures.  Would like to see far more options available.

1. Instructions on survey not to hit "previous button" here since you lose all your comments and have to do it over!!
2. The capability of your sales team other than Jackie! SO I gave low scores in the first survey section.
The general feel the sales resources give is one of being bothered by clients coming in to the model homes and at times were even eating and so you feel like you are intruding on them. Their typical answer to almost any question was "I will have to get Jackie to answer that". You almost lost us initially, but we knew you were good so we came back 2 or 3 times...and then that magical day we got to talk to Jackie...and we did the deal then and there! Jackie is your STAR and she represents TAMARACK as it should be and she knows all the details. Once we bought the house, we brought friends in to see the model since they are looking too...and the typical sales force was there and our friends felt such a negative attitude they left and think we are nuts to buy from TAMARCK with such disrespectful sales force....they did not get to meet Jackie...we may bring them back some other time.
My impression is that there is lots of time when hosting a model home to be studying the product, options, packages, etc... and they should know everything they can about what they are selling..... and maybe you should test them biweekly and give them prizes or gift cards for improving their skills...they do not seem motivated to learn more...and we have been talking to them for 8 months now...Last weekend I even had to tell them that the AC unit in the basement of the model home was creating a pool of water on the basement floor....there were no clients in the home at the time but they did not even check...
I know this will make your sales resources upset, but as a senior leader in INVISTA, I think you need to know the truth or you can not change things and I am a pretty credible resource for this, with no reason other than to try and help you succeed. I think you are an excellent builder. And I have been upfront and honest with Jackie, Carolyn, Mike, Steve and Pierre. I look forward to moving in to our new house!
it will be good if we had more time in design center, we felt we run out of time. we had excellent time but people working there were very busy it seems their plate were full. thanks for asking yonas

I would have appreciated having a better package of documents advising us of our upgrade choices in advance of our meeting with the design consultant.  A friend showed me their "upgrade book" from Mattamy which came with pictures and detailed explanations of each upgrade. It saves time at the design appointment and helps the customer to be better informed. I probably would have gone with more upgrades if I had a picture of what the "standard" looked like.

We wish it was made more clear that we had the option to choose a security system from concept rather than having to buy a security system from Alliance.  We do not regret going with Alliance for security, but the options were not clear until I spoke with the rep from Concept after already committing to a security system with Alliance.

Harding representative did not provide me the information I requested regarding the ERV upgrade.  My e-mail went unanswered.  We decided not to go ahead with the upgrade due to the lack of willingness to provide information by Harding.  It would have been good if the upgrades list contained a bit more details regarding upgrades like this such as the model of the ERV being offered and what was meant by "Ultima Control".

Tank less water heater rental through Cricket Energy requires signing a contract for 10 years without having much details regarding how to terminate the contract or what it would cost to buy the water heater outright from them after 1, 2, or 3 years of renting.  Direct Energy provided that information outright when we rented our current water heater.   We are awaiting a representative from Cricket energy to contact us to get some clarifications prior to signing any such long term contracts.

Aside from the above, we would change nothing else.  We were impressed particularly with the help we got from Kim Knuth.  She was very helpful to us during the design center process and both of us felt she took our taste and liking into consideration and helped us make the best selections for us.  As the current owners of a new build from another builder, we can't help but compare the design center experience which was night and day thanks to Kim.
Wish we had bought sooner so all the options would have been available. Otherwise, very satisfied so far.
More time for the design centre process. I felt rushed.
Everything would be less expensive!
Introduce a design software that could let clients have a better idea of the design of their home

Subcontractor Concept Homes wasn't easy to deal with. We had simple questions regarding installation of central vac, potlights, and a conduit and they didn't get back to us for days for an appointment. They also have terrible hours of operation and don't give clients much choice. In the end we didn't end up getting anything with them because of their lack of service.

During the sales process, if there is an available options list (those options only available during the sales process) that would be great. Due to lacking of information, we missed a few options during the sales process and when we found out it was too late. For example front door upgrade, garage door upgrade etc. And also some information provided are not accurate. I was asking if I could upgrade the window of a bedroom. The answer I got is I cannot get a larger window, and the only option for me is to add an extra window. So I took the option. However, later I found the same model on my street (Lot 46) got the upgrade. And also, until yesterday, the extra window I purchased still not yet installed even the dry-wall has already been completed. Now I am very concerning about the impact on my home overall quality.

During the design process, the ceramic price tags were wrong. At the beginning we chosen Red class for everything. However when we start the pricing, those kinds of ceramic all need pricing and the the price we received are so much different than the Red Class price listed on the price list.  This issue had caused a big chaos during our design center phase. So an accurate price list would help buyer to well budget during the design centre phase, and I also can see this could improve Tamarack design centre productivity.

An efficient system of coordination & communication between the sales office and the design centre. The design centre is far too busy to accommodate the tight construction schedules placed on the home buyer, hence delaying the closing date (as in my case).
design centre:If they can get the prices quickly for upgrade iteams would be great.
Since I bought the model home question no 2 I have no concern.  I was greeted with smiles that made me feel at home on the spot.  Congratulations.

The Sales Representative - This lady she has no manners she does not say hi in emails she does not greet. She may need Greeting Training - I was called Kido a couple of times by her. I am young but its not professional. She needs to treat me with respect.

I would have liked the stairs to the deck on the opposite side.  I have a small child and would have liked the her not to run into stairs as soon as she stepped outside.  I didn't realize this until right before he plan reading.  I wish there had been more flexibility.  I was told it was too late and this had to be covered in structural meeting.
The stairs and deck has not been installed yet.  I was also told that it was easy to switch, so I could do it myself after closing.  I dont understand why this request couldnt have been accomodated.

The whole process of choosing interiors of the house at the design centre seems not long enough to let you choose the best available choice. Only Christine seemed to know about all the upgrades and available choices.
I would like to have some snack to share / normally the presentation is prolonged and need something to eat

They need to improve their dealings with the site super and make it more accommodating for homeowners to view their homes.  Time slots  that makes sense to the homeowner (we work) - Tamarack is  not flexible at all 9am- 2pm slots    and that is it.
Completely satisfied. Excellent selection and knowledge from staff

A few times a different points there was less than a direct answer given to some questions that we asked and felt a little deceived or at least not fully informed and therefore taken by surprise for some costs.

The Process was seemless and very well handled.  Although this was not our first time around building a home through a builder the process was very enjoyable with no surprises.  Tamarack has been very informative and a pleasure to do business with.
n/a
allow the "bonus" money to come off the purchase price...the Tamarack standards are beautify enough!!
able to visit home more during construction
That they have the right information and if they say something is to be in the home and promise to take care of the client then they should’ve.

As far as the design center is concerned, when I first went there to take a look on my own to prepare myself for my initial meeting, I felt overwhelmed and that things were disorganized.  The staff were amazing and really walked me through the entire process, when we had our final meeting we were happy with our choices and did not second guess our design decisions.  This was a seamless process with excellent customer service. Thank you
More free offers, have a model house available so we can see, we brought the Bristol but had to drive to Kingston to see the model house.

i loved the customer service experience I had with Tamarack. The only thing I would of preferred is more of a simpler pricing list for the design center. the catalogue that is provided is long, confusing and we did not utilize it at all.

2 items:
Having the sales office open on Fridays (could be closed on Mondays). 

It would be great if the design centre made appointments in the evenings. We had to take time off from work.

We felt that some of the interactions with the sales representative at the Jackson Trails site were not completely genuine, therefore it was hard to feel comfortable at times.  Unfortunately, since there was only only one sales representative for the Jackson Trails site, there weren't any other options at the time of signing the purchase agreement. So far, the sales/signing of the agreement has been our least favourite part of our new home purchase.
No comments

The design  prices are a bit high.  We bought 5 homes from diff builders and we did not want to pay 4,000 extra upgrade to put in A/C   Tamarack should at least finish the house to allow electrical copper lines to go in.  Putting an A/C costs 2,000.

Because I was the first to meet with the design center (of my development), the representative was not adequately prepared with the information regarding upgrades and standard options. This lead to confusion and poorly executed quotes for upgraded items.
I wish my backsplash wasn't on back order. As I am not as happy with what I had to choose instead.
nothing

- give more standard options
- i should be able to go to the sales centre and ask about the granite countertop in the main bath to the sales centre and should be able to find out what level of upgrade it is. should not have to bounce between sales centre and design centre
- also, sales centre of community i bought in is somewhat helpful after the purchase, but say you go to sales centre in another community (post purchase) just to look at the model homes - and you ask them question about the designs done therein, they are far far far from helpful. they just tell us to go and enquire in design centre

The Muskoka kitchen modification pricing was a bit obscure and riddled with errors and double charges. Unfortunately many of our inquires directed to Muskoka were ignored to the point that we eventually gave up and had to move on.

Kim and Mandy from the design center were extremely knowledgeable and helpful, a pleasure to deal with. I can't praise Daryl enough for his help and attention to detail.

I think it would be so much more efficient and effective if all prices for upgrades were available through the design centre.  For example, the solid surfaces were not priced (by square foot) so no idea which ones were more/less expensive.  Same with the backsplash.   Full disclosure pricing would be helpful in the design process.

It would also be beneficial if there were pictures of full rooms/homes with some of the upgrades (especially flooring and cabinets).  It is hard to imagine an entire floor or full kitchen when looking at a small sample.
Thé cost of upgrade are  not explained, when questions asked to mme champagne very poor feedback, when problems with partners concept and Mondeau no help at all
Both centres were fine and the representives are kind and friendly.  i would not change a think.

It would be great if the design centre had preset design color packages put together. They have really good suggestions. 

The sales centre process is pretty good as is.
More time to make design decisions.

I found the process of researching kitchen sinks and faucets upgrades online on and then sending options to Tamarak for availability and pricing very frustrating. I do not live in the Kingston area so could not access the plumbing contract store locally. (The staff at the store who normally work with Tamarak clients were not available on the 2days that we were in the area purchasing our home.) It might have been easier to have been suppiled with a list of available sinks and faucets upgrades and then asked to choose from those.
Nothing, seems to work great to me!
None

Informing the sales staff that ALL traffic headed to Laporte Nursery will be coming through the development.  This could easily be 1000 cars ao any spring Saturday.  Not at all hapy about that as I had to find it out from Nursery staff.  I was told this would not be a permanent  situation and it better not be as I do not want to be living on a commercial throughfare.  (That is why I purchased in a RESIDENTIAL development. ) It was almost enough for me to pull out of the deal and I am sure current buyers a d prospective ones are still not being informed of this situation.   That should have been disclosed from the beginning.  GET LAPORTES NURSERY BACK TO HAVING THEIR OWN DEDICATED ENTRANCE ASAP!!

The design center employees are extremely busy, they are rushed off their feet, I would expect they will all have nervous breakdowns!!!  This makes (through no fault of their own) a very unpleasant experience at the design centre.  It creates a very stressful atmosphere.  The appointment times are too short.  We found Kim very pleasant and helpful but she just didn't have a second to spare.  
We found dealing with Muskoka frustrating because of their incorrect knowledge of the building code and to tell you the truth  -  we've just got our fingers crossed, hoping we are going to get what we think we are getting.
Had to go to work.

I am delighted with my Tamarack Home and the almost $60K in upgrades.  This clearly generates a very generous profit margin for Tamarack.  No regrets there.

Further, your records will confirm that my referral Blair Hurd has already purchased in Findlay Creek.  So as you can see I am a center of influence in my professional life and as such a valuable source of Tamarack business.  

But my referrals have come to an abrupt halt resulting which will result in a few less sales for Tamarack.  And I'd genuinely prefer to reverse that decision.

I am not happy.

There were two instances whereby I required clarification or decisions from Head Office at which point Tamarack fell into a deafening silence.  

I am a Senior Financial Planner at Investors Group and a former Partner at Doyle Salewski Inc..  I provide as well as expect a level of professionalism and I cannot accept being treated in this fashion.

So to Chris and Scott, your product is sound but my Tamarack experience remains unsatisfactory.  I have been left to feel it's Tamarack's way or 'the highway'.  

So is Tamarack responsive to its Pre-Closing Surveys?  

And in all cases to be clear, I am genuinely looking forward to taking possession of my Tamarack Home and for that I thank you.

Respectfully in your hands,

Gerald W. (Gerry)  Doyle
613.723.7200
More interest in the purchaser at the sales centre I went to them re concerns and did not receive any response. The design process went well again no response to emails sent.

I would recommend that Tamarack's design centre become more aware that not all buyers will be residents of Ottawa when they purchase their home. This only applies of course if Tamarack wants to sell homes to all potential buyers from across Canada and elsewhere. I initially got reticence about my design centre meetings as mine had to be held by phone and not in person. I don't even want to guess where I'd be if my sales person, Deborah, had not continually intervened to make things happen.

To see the model homes.  It would be nice if Somebody answered the phone not a good option for reception it would be nice if they picked up and conveyed the message I found this inconvenient.  They contact me whenever.    The communication through email is good. The sales centre I bought from Meadows was very good.  I was referred to go to Orleans to see model and they were not welcoming at all at this other centre. When you fist walk in they ask are you buying from Orleans or Barhavaen Centre. Meadow and Orleans huge difference. Instead of Orleans entertaining my ideas and questions she more or less was busy enough to tell me she did not have enough time it was rushing and brief.
Basic choices at the design centre (specifically cabinetry) could be upgraded slightly.  The basic choices are VERY limited.

Sales rep demeanor was not friendly.  It took time to get her to be responsive to our concerns -- tendency was to say 'No, it's not possible' before checking with management.  

customer service experience was not friendly - improvement is needed.
nothing.
nothing
A little more time for the design process; more straightforward on closing date process i.e. realistic dates & better communication about reason for constant delays.

I would STRONGLY advise Tamarack to hire more personnel in the Design Office to accommodate clients schedules. I always felt pressured to hurry in selecting my upgrades and discuss my concerns and present my questions. Overall it was very stressful and I felt I was taking up time from the Design Consultant because she seemed overwhelmed and very tense and rushed at all times. She was very knowledgeable although Tamarack do not provide them with all the information and pricing for the upgrades. So the client is told on many occasions to wait a few days until certain prices comes in from who knows where!  I would ensure clients deal with ONLY one Design consultant who is trained in all aspects of the purchase of the upgrades, material and finishings of a home instead of having to contact and meet so many consultants and workers at the Design Center or by telephone and emails. It becomes overwhelming for clients who have personal and professional schedules to go through this complicated process. 

 I would provide more actual upgrade materials to view at the Design Center, ex: pedestal sinks, faucets, fireplace options... I would not show clients upgrades that are not available at the Cardinal Creek location ex: wood flooring that is in the Design Center but is off limit for those clients.  

 I would plan quiet space for discussions between the Design Consultant and her clients; the noise level becomes a real headache for the client and the consultant as well, when you are trying to concentrate especially at the final sign off meeting. The Design of the Center itself is very confusing and does not help the client orient herself in the chaos of the multiple choices scattered all over the Design Center. Clients walk/run from one area to another,  back and forth  at every visit. It is very chaotic in there and time consuming, very inefficient!

I would hire new Sales personnel at the Cardinal Creek Village location. I have experienced a major mistake from the SR at the Cardinal location where I had made a deposit on the Eton model; 1 month later I was informed the wrong model, a Foxcroft had been built instead!  I had to change models and or location!! Later I chose the Chelsea at an extra cost and Tamarack DID NOT compensate me for their major mistake! Tamarack never provided an excuse either. Nothing. I am still very annoyed by that lack of professionalism and cowardness, as well as improper customer service in regards to that mistake that cost me in the end. On top of that,  the dry wall on the  Chelsea  I purchased was installed without proper communication from the Sales representative so my decisions on electrical outlets and speakers were not considered. Thanks to Debbie, she managed to waive the additional expenses that I would have had to incur.  I very much appreciated her efforts in assisting me, after all I had been thorough. 

Thank you I hope my comments will make a difference  in the way Tamarack interacts with the clients who give them a lot of money. I still feel very angry by the way I was treated in the major error that was made in the mix up of the Eton model I had previously chosen which turned out to be a Foxcroft... That mistake should have been acknowledge by Tamarack and I SHOULD have been financially compensated for their major mistake. To this day I have not heard from them... 

Christiane Gamache

Just one thing at the design centre: either add an extra visit to the 3 or get more accomplished at the first appt, ie: get flooring picked/priced and kitchen cupboards minimum.  We made 3 or 4 extra visits on our own and took many digital pictures so we could study at home.  Our final visit was basically our 2nd with our associate and things were not yet at a finalized state...an additional visit should be encorporated in the process.  Otherwise were very happy with the selections and the service.
It's perfect
design centre appointment was promised to be November and we did not have an appointment until January.  Keep your promises.
Also initially became aware of Tamarack by newspaper.

One of the question was:
During the walk-through inspection of your home during construction...
So far, there was no such inspection (perhaps it will happen closer to the date the house will be finished).
I would not change anything at all. Service was perfect could not have asked for anything better.
I would allow owners access to their homes in advance to the initial house inspection in order to prepare all of their questions.

The software used by the design centre is way to disorganized. It should be structured so each upgrade it listed by room but it is instead listed by what ever pricing was first typed in.  We are extremely concerns this will perhaps cause missteps on the upgrades.  It took us hours to review what we ordered.  You need to purchase better software for your team as this part of the process made us feel like we were doing the job since we had to jump all over the numerous documents to review.
nothing they are very helpful. ,This is our second tamarack home and we are very satisfied.

To make sure that the options offered are available and compatible with the accessories ( eg. shower stall and optional doors are compatible). 
Make sure the material at the design centre is still available at the time of choice (eg. discontinued tiles).
Educate the client as to different possibilities in regards to improvements in options selected by other clients (eg. Kitchen cupboards, floor layouts)
Nothing
Would like more email updates on next steps and timing - ie are we on track for current closing date?

1. There is a disconnect regarding product availability and upgrade selections. 
2. There are a number of standard fixtures including lighting, towel bars and toilet rolls and I’m sure others that are not mentioned in the design center and I suppose we’re stuck with those or doing the work to replace them ourselves (which isn’t our strength).
3. Even with the items where upgrades are offered, there are very little visuals of what the options might be available in the showroom, we were left to google photos of what we like and hope there was something cost effective that was similar. It felt very backward.
It was difficult to think of something to change.  I suppose the only thing I can think of would be to have some activities or space for children that come with parents to the sales centre.
You need better customer service at the design center.
I would possibly suggest the design centre to have longer hours till 9pm during the week days to accommodate work schedule of those buyers better.
that the Design centre would be closer to the site and you can do compare easily with model homes
The construction is different from the design map. I pointed that out, but I have not got any response. Frustrated!
The tile section in the deseign Center should have more categories of pricing. As well an easier way to look through them in the bins.

1. The decision on hardwood stairs was needed almost immediately after signing and before I'd had time to choose hardwood and select my other upgrades (to determine if hardwood stairs would fit in my budget).
No change
Need an extra appointment at the design.  Design center personnel needs to come better acquainted with the tax being added to the options 13 - 19 percent:
None that I can think of right now.

Difficult to remember the colours of all items chosen.
Would it be possible to have visual picture (thumbnail)?
We wish there were more time to decide on the upgrade options that were to be done the sale centre.

The design centre, the cabinet team.  they left out some of the basic things.  Like the microwave.  Like the sliding microwave.  I thought they would supply guidance.  They did give us some about the island but they didn't say anything about the crown molding or the microwave.  They could use some improvement.
Show more color choices and give more help in choosing
Better choice of options at the design center, better supplier referrals.  (Was referred on supplier sheet to Boone plumbing, but they wouldn't deal with me as a Tamarack customer.
The design centre process seemed a bit rushed.
If I'm choosing not to install some fixtures or hardware I should be able to keep it since I'm paying for it.
Interactive computer program allowing you to see changes done to the interior of the home.

1. Original sale: 

Val and staff are professional and knowledgeable as to what they are responsible for and for what they need additional approval for they are quick to obtain the information.

             Change: nothing

2. Subsequent modification to agreement (B/S to walk out/ rev to std elv): 

Debi and Gary where quick to respond to the issue and where more than understanding of the situation and made very attempt to accommodate and they worked hard to resolve an awkward situation into a positive resolution. Working with Val/Carroll as well helped greatly.

              Change: nothing. Debi stepped in when she needed 

3. Design centre: 

Kim was great to work with and fully understood what we where looking for in our second purchase from Tamarack . She work diligently in vetting and explaining any requests. 

The same cannot be said for our experience with Muskoka Kitchens. this process was a total debacle. After meeting with Ewa and explaining in detail with measurements and providing appliance specifications we later where told we had to RE-explain to another consultant Gayle. Working with Gayle was a total failure, after meeting with her to explain what we said to Ewa and re-providing the same appliance information a second time we received an odd e-mail requesting for us to reply where we wanted items that we did not request. We immediately call her to clarify and to review the plan as earlier explained. Gayle could not review our file as she had lost all the information and was working from erroneous information from a another client. We had to repeat all the information over the phone and re-send the appliance specs again. We requested and received confirmation of this via e-mail. We lost faith in Gayle getting it right and we requested Kim to ensure all was correct with regards to cabinetry. Kim, not wanting any mistakes compounded or delays to occur as a result of Gayle's lack of QC,  took full control and coordinated with us vs-a-vs Muskoka. Kim ensured all was as requested and corrected many omissions afterwards (there where many)


             Change: Have Kim/Tamarack staff directly work with customer with Muskoka present. Inital 3 way meeting (tam/client/musk) then subsequent meetings (if needed) directly with Muskoka with a final wrap up 3 way meeting. 

Other trades met with: 
Concepts -- okay and responsive
Emco -- did not carry enough samples to make any kind of decision. Rep was good.
Fireplace centre: waste of time in simply trying to make appointment,  no hours outside 8-4pm and limited availability during 8-4 making appointment next to impossible. We where committed to purchase a fireplace upgrade (Napoleon) but due to this issue we decided to upgrade after rather than chase down contact. 


Frame walk-through:

Daryle Meek is largely responsible as the reason why we purchased a second home from Tamarack. If he was not the site supervisor we would likely have looked elsewhere as his ability to close on time despite issues made the difference. That being said, I was disappointed in the quality of the build that I saw on the walkthough: walls not straight and a floor that was visibly not level at a distance and was a walking hazard, chainsaw cuts though the sub-floor on and sloppy all levels. In my opinion as a former framer I would dismiss the trade responsible outright as I seriously am concerned the finished product will have considerable visible drywall issues and floor level issues on closing that will result in lengthy PDI and resolution before closing.   

               Change: The walkthough did not contain and formal process of documentation and it should. Both with listing items and sign off by parties. 

I can be reached anytime for clarification on the above 613-315-9517.

Danny Gariepy
For second appointment with design center, I found that 2.5 hours  is not enough if it is your first time to buy a new house .
I wouldn't change anything

Considering the Elderly community and the Commitment of Purchasing a new home ( to downscale), many had to sell their properties to be able to Purchase from Tamarack...  I would change the Delays in 'date of possession' for these homes as it adds a great inconvenience to the People who are without homes waiting for this 'date of possession'...
A company such as Tamarack should be better at planning these developments as not to inconvenience people in this manner. 
This greatly tarnishes the purchase experience with Tamarack.

The design Center held minimal samples for various items, ie carpet samples, paint samples, edging samples for stone countertop. We found that when we went to these places to preview our items, there were more options as standards, more importantly samples that better suited our tastes. At the point of viewing, it was also too late to change our order due to long administration and fear of a later closing date. It should be brought to the buyers attention that not all samples are available and if they don't see something then direct them to the suppliers themselves.

the design centre was not able to explain clearly the options available, introduction interview should be able to explain the next steps to be taken clearly.
last day of slection is to be for 1-2 hrs in time but rep only took 30 mins of her time to finish the last appointment,we felt pressured and the rep was in a hurry to finish the appointment as quickly as possible.
overall experince was ok but the last minute rush at the design centre is like a bad taste and hopefully goes better from here

Everything was done by hand on paper, even scheduling the design center appointments. Had to take time off of work and reschedule dentist appointments because emails were very unresponsive, and the second option was even worse. I would expect a digital calendar where it would be automated, and to be presented with multiple date options at the start, instead of just sending one, and then waiting a week to get a response to change it.

The design center consultant also did things on paper, and took a long time to answer questions, to the point where the options we have selected changed pricing levels by the time she could get us a quote. If it were not on our due diligence to keep track of the options we have selected and the pricing when we selected them, we would have been overcharged due to the fact our consultant took three weeks to get us a quote. I am surprised it cannot all be put into a database, and have the price presented real time as the client is selecting their upgrades.

By contrast, our Muskoka Cabinets representative emailed us back almost immediately and had answers prepared.

At the design center it is also a shock to realize that they don't do everything. For the potlights, Central Vac, Lan/Cable outlets, a separate appointment was necessary with Concept, and there was no visibility between them and the design center. This caused a lot of stress and last minute fixing during the final hours before the deadline to fix things that Concept misplaced/misquoted.

We also booked the first appointment available with each, and it was still a time crunch in the end.

The customer care representative we were told about after signing the contract never once contacted us about the status/schedule of our build. We had to contact her the day after our frame check to voice our concerns officially, and to this day it is still the only form of contact we have.

Lastly, not one person was able to properly describe why I could not have a centered sink in my Cambridge Ensuite. The Meadows Cambridge model home has a centered sink. The sales center there said that it is an older model, but the blueprints he produced stated the sink cannot be centered. Is there revision control on the blueprints? Seems like they can be changed, replaced, and not be able to pull up the old ones. During the frame check they confirmed that it is definitely possible to center the sink. Seems to be a disconnect between the people actually building the homes, and the people selling. A disconnect which cost us about a grand to put in jack and jill sinks.

In summary, I would only recommend Tamarack Homes to other people if they did not care to upgrade anything. The sales center was nice, but the design center experience was the worst experience we have had, when comparing to other friends that have built new homes. One area I can say to improve upon is to computerize the design center experience. And I would have loved to have one appointment where I had both my design center representative and concept in the same room, so there is no question as to what was selected/what is possible.
It would be great if the design centre could develop an app or something to show you what your home would like like with the options you choose.
Design center must prepare the final pricing faster so that the customer can check the pricing and make changes as she/he needs.

Nothing, you have an amazing team !  Louise, Darlene and Lisa. The team at the design centre is wonderful too.  

Louise's help, friendliness, honesty and flexibility; a major factor in us deciding on tamarack over other builders.
nothing significantly
Would not change anything process went very smoothly
The sales agent was very rude when I brought my realtor in.

issues regarding the shower in the ensuite was not dealt with properly and efficiently. We only received a response after the date of our signing. We were told it would cost us an extra $1000 to remove the plastic. The response we received from Tamarack was rude (essentially, accusing us of lying) and came extremely late in the process (after we agreed on our upgrades based on our design). We did not feel that we were properly treated. My understanding is that this was response came directly from HQ, not the design team. The design team was wonderful.
Less wait. It tooks 1.5 years to get the house.

Some of the pricing for upgrades at design centre was too high.
We did some structural changes as well and the pricing was also a bit high on those.
more info about upgrades in model home.

We would like to have large touch-screen in Design Center where customers could see interior of entire floor or house with all chosen materials and colors put together. This will speed up design/upgrade process and make overall design selections clear for clients and staff. Providing customers with final printout(s) will help greatly as well.

Our experience from start to finish was excellent, the only disappointments we had were in: 1) not being able to make some structural changes that we thought were reasonable but turned out to be architecturally impossible 2) the over pricing of upgrades
It was very well presented I would change nothing!

I was very disappointed to see that there was no room for negotiations whatsoever. Every other home that I have purchased, the builder has allowed some leeway or has thrown in something as a sign of good will, and that is aside of the bonuses offered. In speaking with your staff, I was told that Tamarack does not budge at all on the prices. I have never experienced this before. To offer something is definately a way to have repeat customers or referrals but to stand rigid on no negotiating at all, is not a sign of customer appreciation. To have something modified slightly by way o few inches and to have to pay for it is something that left me a bit disappointed.

- Add wood samples to the sales centre so people can make an informed decision prior to committing to upgrading the staircase. This would provide a clearer picture of the look and feel of what you are buying
- Update the design centre with computer syste

More proactive communication should happen. I am not seeing that. For example, by Feb 23rd Tamarack had to notify me of my firm date with a proper written notice. I did not got anything but i followed up with customer care and they said everything is firm on Feb 26th. After that i received a call in march First week by Sales saying they are sorry but construction is delayed. It is very frustrating when builder does this. I recommended Tamarack to 3 of my friends after i bought my first home but it seems i made a mistake which needs to be rectified. I don't want them to go through same experience like me. Very frustrating!!!!!

Design center experience has to step into this century and adopt some technology.  We're asked to make upgrade selections resulting in thousands of dollars without really knowing what the results will look like.  I'm amazed that Tamarack wouldn't have computer software available to make selections and see a preview of what things will look like.   We were told to visit model homes in all your locations to better get a mental idea of what to expect.   This isn't an efficient technique and it's not very accurate unless we were to make the same selections as the models (which we didn't).  It's not fair to ask the buyer to roll the dice on thousands of dollars of upgrades.
I had an exceptional experience.  I can't say anything bad about it.  If it ain't broke don't fix it.
none major changes

Having options to have meetings outside of business hours or on the weekends would have helped us. We found it really hard to take time off work for meetings. The design centre has weekend availability but it would book up quickly.
It should be mandatory that the salesperson tell the buyer that they cannot put up a fence for a year BEFORE THEY SIGN THE PURCHASE AGREEMENT.

Purchase process - Sales centre staff were welcoming and cheerful.
Deb D was not great to deal with for the agreement. She was pushy, belittling at times, condescending, told me I was stupid, called me a liar, gave us improper information. She ruined the entire process for us, and we almost walked away from the process as a result. We realize these are harsh comments, but feel we needed to pass this along.  You might want to send in a "secret shopper" to assess her performance yourself.  We have heard similar stories from others in the community as well.

Design centre - would have been helpful to have a website (We understand options change, but really not difficult to update) or even a digital version of the price catalog. For non standard tile, would have been nice to have even a vague range of what the upgrade cost would be.  To help buyers better estimate upgrade costs, you might also want to consider sharing the costs of the various upgrades in the model homes (so if you like something, you have a sense of what it would cost).
A digital floor plan with room and window dimensions would be nice so we can plan furniture etc. (pdf or even some sort of drawing file we could import into another program would have been amazing).

Build process - Would be nice to have approximate schedule of when things would be completed. 
In an ideal world, a weekly email update on general progress with a couple pictures would have been reassuring and very exciting. 
An email to confirm that our house will be completed on time would have also been nice.

Should have more respect for the customer / client. 
Should be client-oriented and not only profit-oriented.
Provide better client service, listen to customer needs and fullfill client demands.
Should respect deadlines and commitments.
Reduce the red-tape and bureaucracy and be more responsive to client needs.
Provide more flexibility to accomodate client requirements even if it is outside the given process and models.
The different components in the design centre, the sales centre and the alliance with the Brick, the communication between them could be a lot better.
More design options and upgrade standars items..

- More time and hands on explanations of the options during the structural design phase needed.
- Identify and label all standard vs upgrade options in the model homes.
- Make available detailed floor plans (including reverse ones) from the beginning to
design center - long delay to see a representative. took a month for my first appointment with the design center
Ill let u know when I move

100% satisfied with the sales centre experience but totally disappointed by the design centre. I would like to personally talk about it. 

Thanks.
More time

I would like to have had the option of choosing which package of upgrades I would like since I signed within about a month of the change in packages. I would have preferred the granite counter tops, upgraded lighting and smooth ceilings instead of the lump sum amount. The sales staff was adamant that nothing could be done. Also, when I viewed the house I was considering, there were many upgrades that I thought were standard. It was confusing and I felt I should not linger or return to the house to check again. As there was no models available in the city, I visited a house in Chapperal that was occupied and it was difficult to take it all in at once. When I was able to see the new models after I had committed to the house, the options sheets confused me because I thought those would apply to me. It was very disappointing to learn that I was not able to be considered for these upgrades. This was both stressful and disappointing. I felt that once the sale was made I lost value as a customer.

Sales centre was excellent Valerie and Darlene we always pleasant and cheerful and and answered a,l concerns, meeting with kitchen designer  Ewa was an extremely positive experience, very professional. We were very happy dealing with her and Muskoka.
The walk through for framing in was brief and a few minor adjustments were needed but overall very good.
The design centre was a very negative and stressful experience.   The first two times we went there to review the options we were there for 
almost  2 hours each time and no one spoke to us and there was no one to answer questions. The hardwood selections are not clearly defined.
During our first appointment, it lasted 20 minutes, we were told any questions had to be answered during our second appointment by the designer and we were slept walked through the options.  The second appointment we had to have everything chosen in order for the designer to record it.  We had done extensive home work and running around to all four ceramic showrooms to understand the tile costs, and thought that if we hadn’t we wouldn’t have been very stressful.  When I asked about fire place mantles we were referred the the fireplace centre that we found out after driving out there that they only deal with inserts. At the end of the second appointment there were still questions and pricing and was told to go back to Euro ceramic on our own time.
We spent $30,000 in upgrades and the custom pricing was all over the place and made no sense. And we questioned it. In our final appointment to sign off, again no assistNce with choices we were told by our designer the message from head office was for us to stop asking about prices.  As a result we chose standard options for our Ensuite.  We had requested to have a $5.50 sq ft tile priced and the tub deck alone came back at $4000.  Not to mention how crazy the floor and shower were.  In the main bath shower for a glass border the price was $110 in the Ensuite shower where there is less tile double the price for the same tile. The kitchen backsplash at $15.00 per sq foot was $1200 when we questioned these costs we told the builder had to make a profit.  None of this exaggerated and the process finished a few months ago so we are now calm about how frustrating the design centre process is. It was the polar opposite of the sales centre where we have always been professionally treated.  At the design centre we would walk in sit down and wait because no one was at reception and would have to greet the receptionist when she came back to the desk because she would not look at us.

The cost of upgrades is shocking.  Clearly explaining how they came to that sales number for the upgrades.  You think to yourself, why is this so high compared to normal market price.  This was something that concerned me.

Exact pricing calculations were not explained. For the taxes, (which are fairly substantial), we were only given a number; no explanation. The receptionist told us different tax rates were used for various price brackets, or something...  We ended up just signing the contract because we were tired and fed up. However, it was frustrating to be handed a contract, asked to sign off on a huge amount of money, without anyone with knowledge of the financial details to answer our questions. Other than that, the rest of the process was quite enjoyable.
It would have been very helpful to have seen our model,the Oriole.

The sale and design process were good, it would be nice if the sales team up front had more information regarding cost of upgrades as it would have provided me with better insight as to what I could have purchased, knowing up front what upgrades I wanted for the most part.

The design center experience.
Giving customers more cost reasonable options.
Being more competitive with the base features of the home in comparison to other builders
nothing..We had excellent experiences with both..However, the design centre is VERY, VERY, backed up thus is took us several weeks to get in.  That being said...Kim Knuth was EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!!!!!
N/A

On Friday April 5th we choice our kitchen selection  2 tone color and on Sunday April 7th we changed our mind and emailed advising we decided to change the island color.      No sure, if the person was on vacation or holiday but they tried to make the changes however final decision maker Debbie Champagne would not authorize our change.  This had left a sour taste in our mouth and are very disappointed.   We tried escalate in an email everyone from Sales Staff to décor coordinator tried to help with our issue but was denied.   We purchased to homes from Tamarack and we are disappointed with this issue.

Yes, if I could, it would be to change the manager i dealt with at the sales office.  He was unable to modify any of my requests regarding my dwelling (although he claimed he was authorized to do so), i.e. replacing the front glass door to a solid door, replacing the tankless hot water heater with a storage tank, etc.
More on what to expect during the construction. A more clear picture in regards to the upgrades and costs vrs the standards.
Nothing, I think its perfect!!!!

I can't think of anything right now.  Sorry.
I had a good experience during the all process and hope to keep it that way.
Thank you!

Selection of structural upgrades should be an exhaustive selection options list the same as your exterior colour sections procedure. Your design centre agent would be empowered if you built them a CadKey based computer design tool to more effectively convey what selection options would look like. A more direct question, progress, answer, history tracking approach to managing your client’s process, concerns, communications and issue tracking is recommended - plenty of affordable CRM products available to do that in an integrated manner with your clients. I have plenty of recommendations and proposed solutions. Happy to discuss further if desired.
Nothing

I was and am still not pleased with the external colours of my Drake. I brought this to Noella’s attention several times and she said nothing could be done. 

I questioned this since the materials had not been applied when I first expressed my concern. 

This issue has put a bit of a damper on my enthusiasm with regards to my purchase.

It would be useful to have the information in French.
Not too much opening to modifications of the design.
I would want more time to go through the design centre process.
I wouldn't change anything about it.
the furnace was never hooked up prior to moving in.  Everyone from sales team did amazing .

As far as the design centre process, the meetings are not long enough with the Muskoka designer as well as the Tamarack designer.  Also it would be nice to allow more time between the meetings for us to decide the colours & upgrade.  The 3 meetings were booked in a way that didn't follow the documentation we received (# of weeks).  After I asked they did allow me more time.
As for the sale, the sales rep. did put my name on her calendar for a specific closing date & when I showed up for signature, the contract had a different date.  She ended up changing the date on the contract back to the date we agreed on, so it turned out ok.  But now, I just received a Delay notice from Tamarack saying they won't be able to deliver my house on the closing date stated in the contract.  I am very disappointed in Tamarack because they don't respect the closing date.  My current house is sold, & I will need to move out of my house most likely before taking possession of the new one.  I will be homeless & will probably need to put all my belongings in storage.  Most likely Tamarack will deliver a 2nd Delay notice.  This is very stressful for us the customer, selling our house & not being able to move into the new house because Tamarack don't honor the closing date.  Compensation is ridiculous & certainly not enough for the stress of being homeless + all the dollars spent on accomodation, meals & storage.  Very disappointed with Tamarack.
none
It would be nice to be able to view some of our options online so we didn't have to keep going back to the design center and have to juggle between their working hours and ours.

Our only hiccup in the process was the excessive price increase in cabinetry finishes right before our deadline to select them.  We also found that communication with the design centre was slow in that, when urgent decisions were to be made, we were only contacted by e-mail instead of trying to reach us by phone as well.  It slowed things down.

be sure designers know what type of structural changes can be made especially in the kitchen and ensure that the changes meet building codes and sound building practices.

kitchen designs with structural changes should be done first before customer is asked to sign off the structural component in the purchase agreement contract.
the choices we have to make before going in, not enough options. The choices made for the neighborhood. Someone pays for $700,000 should have the right to choose what they want on the exterior.
Nothing. All is good.

Communication between agents -  they contacts 2 times several times for the same information because they didnt communicate between themselves that things were completed.  Doesnt give me confidence in the facts that situations were taken care of.

One Saturday morning I was trying to reach the design centre by phone as I had forgotten some important documents there after my last visit.  Although the design centre was open as it was after 9 a.m. I could not reach the receptionist directly.  I had the option of leaving a voicemail for one of the designers or leaving it on the general mailbox.  I called several times over the course of 3 hours and was not able to speak to a "live" person.  Neither was my voicemail returned by the receptionist.  It was very frustrating.  I ended up going in to the centre in person.  It would be nice for the receptionist to actually answer the phone and have real-time communication when she is present.

Perhaps have more help when just browsing. I felt that I could not ask any questions when I did not have an actual appointment.  I also felt a bit rushed when I met the designer - it is as if not enough time is scheduled even though I was very prepared.  Designer was amazing.  Loved the Muskoka rep as well.

I normally would like to give suggestions here however, I believe you have it bang on. One thing I would strongly suggest is you should ensure that your Roger's guy and electrician have the plan from the sound place....concept design I believe it's called. During the framing walk through I noticed a plug and internet outlet that were supposed to be beside each other were not. Anyone that was installing it should have realized they should be next to each other. (Hopefully this is fixed for my final walkthrough). I would like to note also that for my framing walkthrough, I would have gave the guy (sorry I forgot his name) a 10. He was great, the only problem was that he was new to Tamarack and I really wanted to speak with our Forman. We brought up several concerns at the walkthrough and never heard back. It would be nice to be given updates on our concerns.

Better communication via e-mail to get answers especially after the walk through, a quicker reply on questions. More time to allow changes after the walk through. More inspections/walk through for cutomers who wish. 2 upgrades that are on my list have yet to be done and don't know if they willl...They have been added to my final price but have not been done. A pot light in the main level shower and a reenforced electrical outlet for future ceiling fan in living room. I requested both before the drywall was installed. 
On a positive side I really enjoyed "working" with Joy and Mandy (who seemed to enjoy spending my money a little too much, haha!!!)
The cost of all the upgrades are exaggerated (design phase). I would make them more realistic to standards of someone purchasing their products.

Post sale process was rough for us. We bought an early occupancy with the pseudo promise of a nearly firm close date of November... as long as we kept on track of our design choice timelines. We did our end of our agreement. Met all timelines... even in the midst of a third pregnancy and the loss of our father. 

However, we ended up getting bumped back into March!!! Not ok when we bought this new build with the expectation to move in and settled before baby #3 arrives in February. 

Now I am pregnant, expecting baby #3, living out of boxes (because I really can't pack with a newborn in tow) and move/settle with a 1 month, 4 year old and 5 year old. 

Very disappointed with the lack of urgency on our early occupancy close.

Pricing was difficult to figure out. Everyone's time is valuable and we didn't feel like we could ask for pricing for a lot of things due to time constraints, we had to limit our choices to 1 or 2 options. We may have gone with different options (tiles) if we new right away how much it would have cost without waiting a few days for a quote.    Also some things in the catalogue need more explanation. Consider adding more information online, perhaps an FAQ.
none, all meetings were professional and ready.
Match the promotions with tartans

I likely would have inquired about options/upgrades that needed to be bought at the sales centre (ex.  changing the front door).  We would have made an appointment with the pluming supplier in order to see more upgrade sections.

Our sales and design process was very smooth and all the Staff we dealt with was very knowledgeable and helpful with our design choices.
Valerie Taller and Kim Knuth made this experience very exciting and we were able to enjoy every step of it.
very good as it is
Nothing.
Nothing.  Both were great.
Window well was dented in. Also, drywall was up prior to my meeting, so, I couldn't really review.

A larger sales or design centre. The tile section should be better displayed and grouped by style, colour, etc. Design centre should also display standard lighting packages as this has a large impact on the design. Items unavailable to customize our home to our needs. Such as cold storage, stairs on patio with walkout,and hinge door stoppers.

The Design centre process can be stream lined with bar codes and scanners to give the buyer pricing/print out of choices. The sales centre could also have an application to enter your choices within your home. Similar to the kitchen design. This gives the buyer more confidence in their selections.
Overall the business is good.  Some of the things didn't seem fair.  When you are taking something out and just replacing it with something else, to charge so much, didn't seem fair.
We were not able to visit a model home prior to purchasing.

Nothing - was fantastic throughout. Special props to Deborah Denison - who worked closely with us from beginning to end. She was especially attentive to us as first time home buyers, and provided honest feedback to our questions. I'd recommend her, and Tamarack, to anyone looking to buy.
Nothing at all.
Everything went smoothly at both centres, it may not be feasible but having both centres together would be very convenient.

Have more options for paint colours. It's too expensive to change colour even slightly from standards. Colours make houses unique so they all don't look the same. Selection staff can assist clients who have a hard time choosing.
nothing
Have more standard modern features

I would change the way things were handled when we were told one thing with the sales rep then Concepts advised us differently. Eventually we had to fix things on our own when all it took was a simple phone call from the sales rep and not 12 emails that were exchanged.

No idea, 
Regarding color  it should have given us more options without upgrades. 
Hardwood also without upgrades.

water heater should be optional, monthly fee is too expensive and buy-out price of $4000+ is absurd for a $1400 unit.  The sales team is exceptional, and design team is very knowledgeable. The percentage of mark up on upgrades puts a sour note on a great sales and design team.

It would be great to have a web-based "account" set up where you could log in and track everything to do with your new home. From the model choice to upgrades selected, the ever fluctuating cost, electronic documents, pictures and sample images of flooring, siding and everything else you have chosen, etc. One could make selections (or at least have a general idea) at their leisure in the comfort of their home before actually visiting the design centre.
I would change the standard options at the design centre as most are outdated.  A more reasonable price for upgrades would be appreciated as we found out many prices where double in price.

- sufficient time during design centre appointment for decision making
- there would be less hussles if we could deal with one party (the design center) in stead of going to various suppliers to complete the process (e.g. kitchen design from Muskoka, Potlight&alarm from Concept home, more selection of flooring and plumbing, etc)
- selection of hardwood flooring for the Meadows was limited. We could only choose Mirage products which does not provide enough variety.
- It would be more helpful if we could have more than one appointment with our kitchen designer.
We are very happy with the people we met and the process you have.

First, we should note that we are about 7 weeks away from closing so our comments only relate to what we have expereinced so far.  Overall, the experience has not been too bad.  There were some challenges as well as positives.  

On the down-side, our first experience with the Design Centre was far from pleasant.  When we first arrived there, we were admonished by the Receptionist for showing up without an appointment, despite guidance from the sale staff to do so given the tight timeline we had to view and then select upgrades with the designer. It was only after we nearly walked out with the thought of cancelling the sale that the receptionist quickly changed her tone.  Not the best first impression.  She did try a little harder later on.

Perhaps the one item that bothers us most is the limited Customer Care support.  While were pleased to receive a nice Welcome Letter from Tamarack that talked about the very special purchase we had made and the commitment by the Customer Care Representative to provide us regular feedback on our construction, we feel somewhat let down by this promise since noone has proactively tried to contact us and provide updates.  Nor have they, in particular the Customer Care Representative, been quick to reply to any of our emails or in some cases not yet.  As we currently live out of province, we, more than most other customers, rely on the Customer Care support for updates and accomodations where possible.  We haven't been exceptionally well served here.  In fact, we are still waiting for feedback on the construction process and help with establishing a pre-delivery inspection date.  Leaves us wondering how important the 'Care' is in Customer Care.  As for our Sales Rep, Noella Francoeur and Designer, Kim Knuth, both have been very helpful.  We appreciate their commitment.

We have worked diligently with our designer and the sales staff to make decisions in a quick and orderly way to allow Tamarck as much time to get on with construction.  We have been patient clients, but feel the sentiment has not necessarily been returned in kind as promised.  We are hopeful this changes and that the house will be completed on time and with the care and professionalism Tamarack prides itself upon.  We believe in Tamarack, but we need Tamarack to believe in us to truly make this a positive experience!

Kind regards,    

Rick and Linda Pitre

Clearing plans with city before releasing units for sale.

Having most upgrades not factor into the savings of not installing the standard - for example, why would I have to pay full price for granite when Tamarack is saving the cost/labor of the laminate installation. We would have purchased more in upgrades from Tamarack if they were less expensive then we could get elsewhere.

A better way to visualize what our design choices would look like in the finished product.

We were quite happy overall.
Jacqueline was great, and Tera has been fantastic for any follow ups, having taken over the sales position in Greenwood Park.  The sales process was good.
Mike runs a pretty tight ship, and we've been impressed with his efficiency and responsiveness.
Selections were somewhat of a struggle, Carolyn wasn't as organized as everyone else we encountered, but we got through.  We're very excited to see the finished product.
Jim and Julie Stenhouse
Black window frames from the outside and more upgrade bonus

Finished basement should come with all houses. :)
Can't wait to move in!!

I had a great  experience with the sales staff and the Design centre. What at team approach indeed. The only thing I was disappointed in was the option of the style of the house that became the regular style and I was not told that at the onset and was unable to get what I wanted. I am happy with the home in general and have been back to see the progress since. The contractor (project engineer) was very helpful and accommodating to us. Thank you Tamarack for such a wonderful experience.

Nothing the sales and design center staff have been amazing. We could not have asked for a better experience from Deborah in chaperal and Kim in the design center. The are the reason tamarack has a great reputation

It is very stressful to buy a house, especially when it is your first house. Having a lot of pressure to sign off for the house is somewhat difficult to manage. I would have appreciated less pressure at the sales centre.

I was very pleased with my experience at the design center. I would not change anything. I had good feedback and was able to visit the design center many times to choose all my samples.

Quail Home at Cardinal Creek

1. Be more flexible with the client for the design, for example, we wanted a niche in the shower (to put shampoo and soap)... Your answer: we don't do that. We would like to have some pocket doors: Your Answer: No we don't do that... We would like to have a rough in for a future fireplace (gas insert): No we can't do that... and the list goes on... We were clearly told and explained that this was not a "Custom Home"... 
2. When it comes to push back the delivery date... be more "human" about the communication... and not send it 2 days before Christmas... A pre formatted letter was sent to us pushing back our delivery date from April 11, 2019 to May 31rst... without a mention about how sorry you were or we understand how much problems this can cause... I have sent you letter about this very very unfortunate situation... Please refer to my file if you would like to read it... and by the way... we received an acknowledgement of this letter that we sent you weeks after us sending it... which is totally unacceptable... in these days of instant messaging... 
3. Be more organized with a better communication between contractors and management... for example: we were told that our home was delayed because of a building permit... while our home was already build and had a roof on it... 

Feel free to contact us regarding this experience.
Be more aware of the electrical, cable and bell outlet are situated otherwise every was perfect up to now.

So far we like dealing with the complete team at Tamarack. It has been an easy process.Your construction staff Vic , the exceptionel sales person Noella, Kim at the design center everybody are nice and easy to deal with. I would not change any thing,the chemistry seems to be pretty good.
Fair upgrade prices, that would make me buy tamarack again.  Not to be forgotten for the structural.  Not sure if we received the right prices.

Would have been useful to have an on-site model of the home we were interested in.  However, full marks to the staff for arranging a viewing of an occupied model at another location. That sealed the deal.
Perhaps have your salesperson walk through the model unit with potential customers.

Ensure the sales center has the most recent catalogue for updates to hand over so clients have time to review prior to meeting with design centre. Ensure the design center gives the client the appropriate catalogue pertaining to the appropriate unit purchased. Ensure all upgrades are costed out and none left with 0.00 dollars. Ensure the designers are informed on upgrades (ie: upgrade offered for walk in shower enclosure and pivot style doors in lieu of sliders). Our frame walk thru is scheduled for next week so some questions have been left unanswered.

Standardize the colour of the dots on all products so that you can easily identify which products are standard and what level of upgrades other products are.  They were not consistent.  As well, we found some of the upgrades to cupboard materials and paint options confusing until explained by the representative.
We would recommend a virtual tour to assist the selection process in the Design Center; that way all home buyers can get a *better* idea how their house it's going to look like.

Valerie and Margaret are a very  kind and professional sales person but it would be better for the company to have a bilingual staff specially in the design centre. In addition, I'm upset with the lady who is charge of the head office because instead of beeing helpful, she judged me by writing that I'm anxious when I told her that I like to change the type of my tiles just 2 days after having submitted my request...

The group at the sales centre are so convivial it was always a joy to visit.  I learned there was a watercolour group in our development which I will join - if it had been possible I would like to have sat and had some tea and chatted but my son was always waiting in the car.

The biggest problem we have had was that we were only given a day of notice to get a home inspector. We called every home inspector in the Ottawa area and they were all booked. We were not able to get an inspector for the day of our walk through. Our sales rep said that this was not her fault, that it was head office calling that late. As a customer, it does not matter whose fault it is. It matters that as the customer we receive adequate time to find a home inspector for us. We were also told that we would not be given more than a week warning of when we will need a home inspector for our final home inspection. This is not acceptable. You cannot just tell a home inspector that you will need their services at some point during a certain week, they need ample time to schedule the appointment, not last minute as Tamarack informs their customers.  Other than this everything else has been satisfactory.

"The sales process was excellent.  Louise and Darlene were wonderful to deal with; returned phone calls/emails promptly; explained things very clearly etc.  We received pricing for our structual upgrades promptly.

We were less impressed with our design centre experience.  I had spent a lot of time at the design centre before our appointments (and appreciated that I was able to do so) which I think helped tremendously.  We appreciated the options catalogue for our model - this took a lot of guesswork out of the process and I wish other builders would adopt this approach.  It really sets Tamarack apart, in my opinion.  

We were disappointed at the lack of selection, particularly for standard bathroom wall tiles and kitchen backsplash tiles.  We visited many tile suppliers on our own.  We asked for pricing for several tiles, and waited a long time for this information (we only received it a couple of days before our final appointment).  Had we received this information earlier, we could have asked for pricing on alternate tiles.  In addition, some of the pricing we received made us reconsider our other selections so in the end we felt very rushed.

Some of the upgrade pricing we received made absolutely no sense.  Tiles that had the same per foot square price as standard tiles came back with wildly different prices.  We paid $900 to tile 2 walls of a shower in a tile that cost $6 per square foot (in addition to the $3200 charge to have a tiled shower!).  If we questioned the cost of an upgrade, we were told 'that's the price'.
