We wanted to upgrade part (not all) of our bannister in oak - we were quoted a price that was more than replacing the entire railing in maple.  It made absolutely no sense.  Railing upgrade pricing did not take account of the fact that we replaced part of the railing with a half wall.  We eventually grew frustrated and decided to do some of our upgrades after closing.

The alarm system pre-wire was also not a pleasant experience.  Tamarack required us to use one supplier.  We wanted to use Concept Homes who was doing our potlights and central vac but were told we could not.  We did not care for the alarm system rep at all - her 'sales technique' was total fear mongering (in fact, she gives a fairly negative impression of the area that you're moving into which probably isn't Tamarack's intention).  She also did not offer a pre-wire option only - you had to purchase the system through them and have it monitored with them (at a rate which is higher than what we pay currently).  As a result, we did not get a pre-wire done and will have to do it after we close, which is inconvenient.

Ewa at Muskoka kitchens was a dream to deal with - she was definitely the highlight of our design centre experience.  The communication between the design centre and Muskoka could definitely be better - we often received stuff from Ewa because the design centre hadn't forwarded it to us."
When doing upgrades process, it was trouble to have to go to the specific store since the centre did not have the sample.
The designer should manage custom items instead of sending to a different providers to get the pricing.

I would not change a thing! We are very pleased with the professionalism that we have recieved from Deborah (Chaperal) and Kim (Sales Centre).  They both have been very kind and helpful with any concerns or questions that we have had.  Please ensure that this message gets relayed to the president and owner of the company because these two ladies should be recognized for their hard work and dedication!

re:Walk thru. That has NOT taken place. Personel were pleasant BUT ....I'm perplexed by what is written and not done. I was to receive a letter re: start of construction ~ not rec'd. I asked about landscaping... sales person couldn't find/have design plan. Told to look at what is out there on existing homes.At the  !st mtg. w/ design person which started late,she gave me 10 min. warning that she  had to stop exactly @ 12 noon as she had to go home to walk her dog.At exactly 12 she said ... I've got to go! ( In my professional career you don't 'shut down' until the CLIENT is satisfied w/the outcome.) During the mtg.I chose cabinet colour and flooring... from that point on all selections had vered to  very brown tones.  I felt rushed! I went back on my own, reviewed and  re-did the majority of my selections changing my focus to more of a cream based theme. Given the 45 days from purchase signing to seal the up-grades et al I had been given an initial date at about day 90 I specifically ashed if that was too late ..No BUT I did get an earlier appt. when Chantel made a change to someone else. I believe I was assigne a 'point person'  who was to make contact and keep me  abreast of developments. That has not  happened! I drive by the site and nothing appears to have has taken place in the last 3 weeks. I have concerns about  the time line and my occupancy date??? This is my 6th new home purchase and I've found it to be a very 'bumpy ride'! Bottom line ... CHANGE = improve the communication.

The design centre experience was fine but considering the overall cost of the home I believe that the buyer should be provided with small sample of hardwood chosen and carpet in the same way counter top sample are.

For the Sales Process -- if someone wants to buy a lot in a new release and wants to put money down on it, we were irritated with the first come first serve basis on release day.  We ended up waiting in the cold (February release) all day in line with one other person to purchase a lot that we could have showed up at 4 or 5pm to buy the same lot.  A little irritating especially if you are a serious buyer.  We were also led to believe that there was going to be a huge waiting line; we think you should change this method where serious buyers can pre-purchase a waiting line place with a downpayment or something of that nature...

For the Design Center Process -- we kept asking if the upgrades we were getting were 'normal' (similar to other people); we were asking not to curb our choices but so we could be ready to expect delays (which we had because of permit issues with the city) or with the inspection building process (for example, in our pre-drywall we found that the standard counter was being built where we had completely upgraded the kitchen) -- 

In both cases we don't know if it was to 'keep the sale' -- but to quote a movie - the model home 'had us at Hello' -- we were totally committed to  buying and upgrading our version of the home and just couldn't understand why the sales and design staff still seemed wary of our intentions...  a little odd
More time to make selections should be provided, given that you can spend a significant amount of the time between second and final apt. waiting to get quotes.

Process is good. Price for upgrades is way too high. In some instances, the profit margin on upgrades were in the range of 30 to 50%. The consumer will do much more upgrades is the margins were more reasonable, anywhere between 10-20% instead.

1. More model displays. 
2. Software to play with fixtures, cabinets, flooring, doors etc
3. More detail overview of area and property at sales centre. Details for first time new home buyers.

My wife and I waived our conditions for the purchase of the house on the 6th of March and during that time Jacqui stated that we had until the 24th to finalize our selections for the design centre. This seemed like an adequate amount of time to have 3 appoinments to pick our selections. The Design Centre Rep was unprepared on 2 out of the 2 appointments. During the first appointment Carolyn stated that her printer was broken and the ceiling of the basement which had all of the design options was being worked on so we could not go down there. My wife and I were upset because she could have called us prior to the appoint and rescheduled for a better time when she and the centre were ready. We were there for less than an hour. We arranged for a babysitter to watch our 2 kids during this time. At the beginning of the second appointment she advised that since we are so far behind we will have to schedule a third appointment which would push back our close date. She explained that it is not her fault becuase after we pick our cabinets, counter tops, adn related items, she will have to send them to a third party and that would up to a week to get back to her. This made me fraustraed because we could have picked these items at the inital meeting simply by bringing some of the sample upstairs or by reschedling for a day or two later. This would have given the third party more time. This was unacceptable since my wife and I had already sold our house based on the close date agreed upon with Jacqui. At the same time another customer arrived and Carolyn asked my wife and I to go in the basement and look around. I felt that she may have double booked herself further indicating her unpreparedness. Because of what Carolyn said about our close date, I told her that we must pick all our selections today in order to meet the close date. This was not ideal for us because my wife was 6 months pregnant at the time and we ended up spending 3+ hours at the design centre. The overall design centre experience was very rushed and very frustrating.

I suggest to have a colored photocopier/scanner at the design center, all documents were photocopied in black and white, bad ink, legal size paper instead of letter size, it will be good to have a colored copy on the spot when you sign any document. The basement slope is not good, I discovered this issue when the contractor finished the basement and was raining, when trying to inform the site manager he argued with me that I can't be on site, too late now. some details that you can see when picking up the staff for the house for example a new toilet paper roll doesn't fit in the roll holder, just discover last 2 weeks when the ambient temperature went up that the front door paint is sticky and can easily be scratched. ....
A guaranteed possession date.  A more clear understanding about costs not available at beginning such as extras and structural changes and taxes.

A suggestion is to provide an e-mail outlining the components (e.g., types of discussions and decisions) of each design centre meeting.  At times it wasn't as systematic as my personality would have liked!
customer has right
N/A
Take more time

Your designers at the Design Centre would benefit greatly from having an application that brings together all selections made with your suppliers (Mondeau, Conceptt Home Theatre, etc.). Having to retype everything is a waste of their time, and takes time away from their clients (you don't get to see too many people using white-out these days, but your designers have to use it quite a bit!)  Like Justin Trudeau would say: This is 2016!!!  I would push further by Tamarack making available to purchasers an on-line catalogue (showing upgrade items with prices and photos) so we can make a first draft of selections before we meet the deisgner for the first time.  I did that myself on an Excel spreadhseet using your paper catalogue but this would be more efficient for all with an on-line catalogue. I would love to be part of your User Acceptance Testing should you decide to go ahead with such an on-line catalogue. ;-)

Everything was great.  All representatives were very knowledge, accomodating, considerate and kind.  Everything about this experience has been very satisfying and I was a little scared.....being the first time doing this on my own.  I felt I wasn't alone, others understood my concerns and took the time to reassure me and to provide valuable advice........which I greatly apprciated.  I would highly recommend your company to anyone and my brother works for another company and even he was impressed.  The only thing I would change is to give the buyer more time when they go in for upgrade selection.  I could have used much more time here but....other than that it was great.
need more time at the design centres

The overall experience has been great! Everyone has been extremely pleasant and helpful when I had questions. I would definitely recommend Tamarack to all my friends and family. I did have a bit of a hard time getting in contact with one of the suppliers however it was over the Christmas holidays which was understandable. As a first time home buyer I am extremely happy with my home purchase and I feel very confident in the builder. The whole process has been very smooth and exciting!
Nothing

The sales and design center were OK.  The only issue was that we didn't have choice for the date/time (1pm or 1:30pm) for the inspection and because of that neither my wife nor I were able to attend.  We personally think that this is an important step in the process and having been denied any kind of date/time change wasn't really professional.  A little flexibility should be allowed.
Provie a bit more time to review the rich upgrade selections.

It would be nice if the design bonus has the prices of the upgrades instead of always having to price it and come back and calculate it.  If everything was stream lined and if we can just pick what upgrades we would like and sign the upgrade papers afterwards.  Instead of multiple visits to the design center.  I personally think the design process is confusing and would greatly improve if a price list of upgrades were available readily like the other builders.

Our friend referred us but we are still not able to get the referral bonus which is a minus.
Because I was working within a budget, nothing.

Sales Centre: I would not change much. Everything is well laid out and properly indicated. The team at the sales office for the Meadows is very knowledgeable about Tamaracks homes, products being offered and options for potential buyers. We have worked with Deb and Mike in the past and enjoyed working with them again, and hopefully in the near future!

Design Centre: The Layout of the centre (on St. Laurent) was on the best. I have to yet to visit the new location. Materials for each individual neighbourhood was not properly distinguished in the centre. Perhaps having dedicated areas for each build site with finishes that are not common to all would be better. We found it very confusing since everything was mixed together.

With the design center a lot of prices were posted or in the database. However some of the updates did require time. Plus with Muskoka, the process gets lengthy waiting for quote. If the price quote of all the major upgrades are in house the process would be more faster

The sales process went well, but the design process was difficult.  I think the staff should be able to assist more with interior selections.  Most buyers are not educated in design and would benefit from a proffessional opinion.  The standards, upgades and availabilities should be organised better to avoid confusion and dissappointment.  We had to change our selections multiple times because one item was not available.

Also,I think there should be a Muskoka representative in Kingston or Tamarak should consider using a Kingston company.  We were unable to travel to Ottawa and this made the kitchen process much more difficult than it should have been.
Wouldn’t change anything specific.

Increase number of design consultants to avoid backlog.  The delay with the design centre forced a push back of our closing date.  Because of this we felt rushed to make our design centre choices to avoid further delaying of our closing date.
Change layout of design centre.  We found it very difficult to navigate through all the different choices especially standard vs upgrade.
To have access to upgrade prices before purchasing the house.

do another walk through when fixes are done after first frame check
I am very disappointed that my lot 34P did not meet my expectation when it come to ceiling

Sales:

The sales representatives were not thoroughly knowledgeable and because of that we currently have issues with our contract. They gave us a lot of mixed information.
Nothing, it was great! The sales team were fantastic!
I am extremely happy with the service from the sales and design centre.

The Sales at FC are amazing won't change anything about it, best team in Ottawa, I have been to other builders and they don't even come close to the level of welcome and hospitality.
Design center could be more responsive, maybe it was a bad luck that they were on extended vacations during my design time, and answers kept bouncing from different people, and I had to keep a list of what is answered and what not cause my requests were either lost or misunderstood.
Also I found it difficult that I have to sign of on all structural changes with no knowledge of how much my design center upgrades would cost, so I went ahead with a lot of construction changes then got shy with my budget when I discovered the prices for the DC upgrades and had to cut corners on what to upgrade.
All in all it was a very positive experience and I already recommended Tamarack to 2 of my friends who are buying homes :)
Thanks.

Nothing. You and your staff are doing an excellent job. Keep up the good work! But please keep on top of it. Do not become complacent. As a developer you have a great name and reputation. Your entire team must constantly strive to maintain and improve your reputation. 
What buyers like us really appreciate is (1) honesty, and (2) transparency. So far this has been the case in our dealings with Tamarack Homes. Please keep it up.
Thank you.
Vern and Ginette Phillips.
I hope I can win a survey.  Thank you

I would ask for the "standards" to be more in keeping with "standard" expectations.  NOBODY uses some of the standards that are on offer.  They are so outdated, ie. toilet roll holder wall insert.  
I would have expected the cost of the granite counter to include the cut out for the sink. How could anyone buy a counter without cutting for the sink?  Some of these charges seem over the top.
nothing

Wish there was an interactive tool (like a computer program or app) where you could select items from the design centre and see how they would actually look in the home. 

Also wish we knew that a fan and thermostat were not provided with the fireplace, and that the option to get this was not even available.

Overall, everything has been fantastic though!
Ensure that the prices listed on the option catalogue should not be subjected to change after signing the purchase agreement. More than 3 meeting's at the design centre.
A little more guidance when making design selections.  We were left to ourselves and would have appreciated a little bit more input and suggestions.

We have done everything wihin a few days in Kingston and mainly communicated at distance.  I would say that having all selections correcly priced and available on a list prior to sit with design ofice and after we did our section would have helped.  Also, understanding what is standard and what is not could be more explicit; probably victim of lack of time here.  In general, the staff was amazing and the quality of the work is there.

We found both centres to be very accommodating in answering our questions.
Have dealt with Noella Francoeur, Joy Kerr and Joyce Newman whom all went the extra mile to help with our questions.
The main item that we were disappointed in was that we asked all these people as well as Paul the foreman that had us visit the house at the stud stage to have an air vent in the Kitchen somewhere which was refused.  The Basement Family Room plan shows an air vent near the window - there is none in our house.  There is only one vent in the whole room at one end.  The room is about 21" long and we believe this is not enough.  Would not want Tamarack to have to come in later to put in an air duct because it is too cold.  We would appreciate that this problem be corrected before any carpet be installed in that room and of course before we move in.  Please respond to this concern.
You have been in this business long enough to know what works and what doesn't, therefore, please keep up the good work in building this great little community of Cardinal Creek Village.  It has been a pleasure.  Thank you, Michel and Diane Seguin
I can't answer that because the upgrades were already done for this house.

The design centre process felt as though we were an inconvenience when we were communicating by email.  I think the design centre may be understaffed - we were mostly dealing with the same person as during our first purchase, but the experience was different.  When we purchased as Tamarack 5 years ago, the process was seamless and we very much felt welcome.  This time, I hesitated to reach out, because I knew our questions would be returned with passive-aggressive or minimizing responses.  When there in person though, it was a very welcoming and an enjoyable experience.
Wine & cheese will be nice :)
More options in the design center.  Easier than going to each vendor to view more samples.

...that our builder, Tamarack had met the first closing date. As seniors, it is very upsetting to have to move our belongings twice and costly as well. Otherwise, it has been a great experience so far. Thanks to Joy , Noella and Mandy at the design center!

The sales team was extremely knowledgeable and hard working as was the decorating center staff.
It was a challege to get our decorating centre meeting dates. We did not have a blue print meeting but that is alright. When we had initial appointment booked to do the purchase, we had to wait to the point of almost not being able to keep the appointment.
A neighbourhood block party / meet your neighbour bar-b-que was hosted by the sales team. This was a great event and much appreciated.

Also, seems like the options had double and almost changed completely in the design center from the time I had started to the end of the process. No need for that many appointments. It is difficult for me to take time off work. Also, the staff in the design center could be more knowledgeable. Sometimes I couldn't get straight answers to my upgrade questions.

mantain what you have valerie is a great person and works very hard and takes her job very seriously...i hope to work with your team again and special thanks to mandy mason at the design center great to work with her attention to details and a wonderful personality...thanks robert palarchio...

I don't know yet

we felt like we were making huge decisions without a lot of time to do so. I would recommend having the design centre process start much earlier, allowing people more time to go in and see what their options are.

It would be more efficient if the design centre representative could accompany with us when we chose our color and patterns. That was a very time-consuming process as we know nothing about those products, like standard/upgrade, price,etc. For every piece we chose, for example the color and pattern of the kitchen carbinet, I have to go downstairs to ask somebody if this combination is standard or not,as the design centre located in 2nd floor and people works in 1st floor.and because the matrix is so complex it hard to understand without helper.Design center workers are good, they are knowledagable, however they were too busy to help us, I kept bugging them during chosen, we spent 5 hours to choose colors just for the kitchen area.

The current process let us choose first then go pricing them and if we think the price is too high then we have to go choose something else and then go pricing again. Budget is always a concern for us so this process is very time consuming.
I have no suggestion at this time.

Looking at our house as it is coming along, we now realize there are certain upgrades that we just didn't think of adding to our new build (such as extra outdoor outlets/plugs, lights etc). This isn't so much a complaint as it is admission that we missed a few things and would probably have welcomed some additional suggestions on useful/popular upgrades that other home owners like to include. Had anything like this been suggested by the design centre or sales centre, we probably would have added a few things to our list. Would suggest a cheat-sheet of "useful but often overlooked" upgrades might be helpful during the process.

-A bit more time to review the attachments to the addendum to the purchase agreement, e.g., able to take home the documents before signing, would have helped prepare potential questions. Overall though, Noella and her team were super. Mandy Mason at the Design Centre was also very helpful. 

-There should have been more than one consultation given for the initial kitchen cabinet design. I had one visit to discuss the cabinet design and was expected to review a draft layout of the kitchen cabinets and give approval after the first visit. I was also expected to communicate any changes by phone or email. However, it is sometimes difficult to explain design changes on the phone or email. The Muskoka rep was sometimes unavailable; would respond after some time; would miss my emails with information requested. This has caused some delay on my color and design selection. I had to request a couple more meetings. I thought that the follow-up meetings should have been offered in the first place like what Tamarack Design does.
Everything has been good so far.
Nothing that I can think of.
Excellent service by Mrs. Mendy Mason and big thank you to her.
More time with design consultant.
More flexibility to modify townhouse floorplan (merge two options together).
Nothing, it was pretty much what I expected.

Clearer answers on what some of the upgrades meant.  We had a heck of a time getting any information regarding the AC units avalable.  It was not until the date that we had to sign off on our upgrades that we got a clear response.  I contacted the design centre, and our sales rep, and they both told me to call the AC supplier directly, who were also unable to help.  I do not think this is the way it should be done.

Nothing, design centre process was excellent! Both Ewa and Christine were excellent!!!
Perhaps having a list available of most commonly chosen co ours and upgrades for the community
The list they provide you about the upgrade is very long and over-whelming. The 1st meeting is very over-whelming, should be one more meeting. They should have the visualization on an IPad.

We were very impressed with the sales team. They offered excellent customer service and had always demonstrated professionalism towards their customers.  However, our experiences with the design centre process were atrocious. Our consultant was aggressive and unprofessional towards her clients. Her customer service skills need major development; she failed to follow-up on her customers' needs.

There was very little ability to carry out any minor changes to the home. There should be a way to increase on the option package. If the option desired is not on the list there should be a process to have it added for the current sale and then for future sales, it's only a way to make more money for you. 

Any items that are removed from the standard package such as mantels or bathroom accessories should get a credit. This is extremely disappointing that there is no credit given; we should not have to pay for something that Tamarack will actually be getting a credit for. When you spend the type of money on a home that we have and get treated with a "take it or leave it" attitude by the head office it makes us feel frustrated. 

On top of that, the quality of workmanship on the front of our townhomes is terrible. I have sent in pictures to Carla for action and we have been told by Charlie that the siding people will be back in to address the issues. But it is truly a sad state when I can drive by and see from my car 4 deficiencies that the trades shouldn't have allowed themselves. Add to that, a home 3 doors down has an overhang over the garage that is completely crooked. The front pad/pavers don't line up at all and are not graded the same left to right- this is when there is no other grading really done yet, so no match of grade required. Add to that, the colour of the pavers; all of the current Warmstone homes being finished and the row on Vivera are getting red pavers with no regard to the colour of the home. Red accents don't work with all colour schemes. From what we've seen on the outside we are concerned about the total quality of our home.
Everything was great other than when we went with the dark brown trim, nobody pointed out that other details of the outside of the house wouldn't match.
Nothing it was a great experience.

The experience was great, we were a little overwhelmed at first and although the structural changes that had to be selected right away were explained to us, we missed things like the front door.  After the fact we were thinking of maybe changing the front door design but it was too late.  It would have been nice if different door options were shown to us prior to the very quick structural design deadline.
I cannot think of anything.
We have been very pleased with the whole process so far as well as all the wonderful and helpful staff we have encountered.

Mike should be the sales rep, he is the reason we purchased a Tamarack Home.  When we have visited the sales center Mike always greets us and asks us how we are doing.  He should be the face of that Office.

Clearly indicate when, based on an accelerated construction schedule for inventory homes, a pre-drywall inspection would occur and pre-drywall design changes had to be complete.

When we signed the purchase agreement, framing was complete or nearly complete but drywall had not been installed. We purchased the home with the understanding we'd receive a pre-drywall inspection to evaluate the home's construction and better consider pre-drywall modifications (e.g., additional lights/switches, gas/water lines, etc). We were advised that the decision-making process with regard to modifications/upgrades/design choices was accelerated because the home was already under construction--accelerated, not negated.

However, it wasn't until we had our first design centre meeting that we were informed that drywalling was complete, meaning we couldn't make any design changes without being charged for drywall repairs. Despite this oversight, we still had to repeatedly argue that Tamarack had failed to advise us that drywall installation was imminent, and that design changes and a pre-drywall inspection had to be complete. And based on this oversight on Tamarack's part, it was insulting that we were to be charged drywall repairs for the design choices we desired. Furthermore, the fact that it was then impossible to perform a pre-drywall inspection made matters worse.

This situation was not handled well at all. Our design choices were consequently rushed and compromised, and the value from inspecting the infrastructure of one's home before drywall is installed was lost forever without any compensation or consideration.
Would get some additional upgrades
nothing

WOULD BE BETTER TO EXPLAIN EVERY SINGLE DETAIL WHAT WILL HAPPEN AFTER PURCHASE AND ABOUT THE NEIGHBOURHOOD AND THE NEXT EVENTS AND SO ON.
THANKS
Longer time to select my selection at design centre
More drop in availability to consult with a designer for the design centre process outside of the set appointments.
- Absolutley Nothing, the experience has been exceptional

the kitchen has to be big size for most the new home 
every backyard homes  has to be a wall to make it private backyard for the family to set make a BBQ. it has to be with the price of the home.
perhaps larger samples of paint colours or current choice examples in model homes

We bought a quick-inventory home and we wanted the quickest possible closing, immediately after finalizing the deal we were prepared and ready to pick our design centre selections. Meanwhile, two weeks were wasted before appointments were made. Therefore, the term quick-inventory is rather disappointing.

1) Our home is a reverse model. In our design and selection process we were always provided with floor plans that were for the regular model. We did receive a reverse plan in the sales agreement, but these plans were not used in the review selection and marking process (frame check was also done with non-reverse plan). Process Change- Use reverse floor plans with mark-up additions where required.

2) From the electrical provider we were sent to, in the selection of the pot lights, cable, Bell, additional outlets, positioning for these items on the diagrams we received was not accurate. Mandy, from the Design Center, recreated all of the electrical-lighting floor plans on her system (on reverse plan) and did a perfect job on the positioning of our additions, with very clear notes on alterations. Process Change- Have Design Center create electrical diagrams.

3) In the acceptance sign-off to the provider of our quartz countertops, the sales agent was extremely busy during our 1 pm scheduled appointment with about 3 or 4 other customers. We had about 5 minutes in our scheduled appointment to ask any questions regarding our two counter tops (of which we had major concerns with gouges on one slab). The following day I revisited the company. The same agent was very pleasant and took all the time I needed to answer all of my questions. Process Change- Receive dedicated time in our scheduled appointment.

We are very happy to be owners of our new Tamarack home.
Please provide significantly more clarity on the timeline of events, and key check in dates.

This has been a wonderful experience and has surpassed the overall quality of service and sales experience that we had received compared to other builders that we had dealt with in the past. I will recommend Tamarack to my family and friends. The only minor change that I would have made for myself would have been to request to see a visual of the new tub style that was going to be installed in the en-suite of our master bedroom. I was informed that our home would not have the large roman soaker tub which was displayed in the model homes but instead would have a different, more modern tub style. Looking back, I should have asked to see a visual of this tub to calm my curiosity.
Orientation session. Provide catalogue for review prior to meeting with designer. Ensure all pricing is reviewed.

Clearly indicate any changes since purchasing to standard design options so that the client has the opportunity to upgrade (ex. the standard fireplaces were changed without being told) Luckily we were able to change them after noticing the difference at the model homes.

An online a la carte option sheet would be a great idea! When upgrading numerous items it becomes difficult to keep track of all the changes. A system with pictures and descriptions that you could input would allow the client to be better prepared for design appointments and save a lot of time on both ends. Just a thought!

Overall - Very Satisfied Customer so far! We can't wait to move in!

We were very happy with our experience. Some comments but again, not complaints just feedback. Later hours at design Centre. The Maskoka kitchen digital renderings were very helpful. I wish we could see digital renderings from Tamarack with all of our colour choices and house options. Would help us see what we are selecting and how it looks.

1. A more welcoming sales center attitude. Sales reps and managers should be rotated across community sales centers to diversify sales styles. This is the first point of contact, and could be a deal maker or deal breaker.
2. Increased clarity on structural/sales center design decisions vs. design center decisions. We were not made aware of front door selection during sales stage.
3. Design center selection sheet was quite unreadable. Bundles should be made clearer, and pictures would be significantly helpful in budgeting upgrades.

The $10K sales incentive is deceiving ... It's in fact a $8,849.56 rebate + HST ... not a $10K deduction on your bottom line before taxes.
So it's basically "false advertisement". You should change that. I already pointed this out to our Sales person when we signed
the purchase agreement. I know it's written in the purchase agreement but the way Tamarack advertise its $10K incentive is wrong.
Nothing it was overal a good experience
We would have liked to have had the home layout online with the ability to have design selections online to allow us to visualize options and selections

The design center kept adding my boyfriend name on every sheet (the color selection, the kitchen upgrades sheet,etc)regardless of my wishes to remove his name since I am the house purchaser.I believe his name was added because both our names were on the information card and was entered to the system this way. The sales office removed his name at the time of buying the house but not the design center.It was not until i refused to sign the amendment to the agreement of purchase that the design center removed his name.  I have asked the design center to reprint the rest of the design center sheets with only my name on it but i was told this can not be done since i have already signed and the only sheet that matters is the amendment.I was  told that i could sign the amendment first then get his name removed after. If I have not refused to sign the amendment with his name on it, I believe that his name would show on it as well and it would be too late to remove it like the other design center sheets.

That the design centre would be more accommodating.  We did not get to choose much to make the house our own.  For example, we couldn't have a back splash in our kitchen.  We requested a couple light in the house and a light for the fridge.  We got the one for the fridge but not the other lights.  In general, she was not very accommodating.

For design center, the first orientation good. But it is not necessary be done by the designer. Julie ( the receptionist ) did this job very good. In that case, the designer will have more time for 2nd and 3rd appointment.

Sales center was excellent. Louise Weegar was extremely helpful and in all our experience (homes, rental properties & condos we have purchased) have never had someone that has helped us every step of the way. We would purchase another Tamarack home if she would be our sales person!

Design center was very complex, especially compared to Tartan which does everything in one place. The 1st appt for intro was useless and a waste of time. Verydisappointing to get there and find out that you then have to book 3 other appts for kitchen, alarm system, wiring etc. Standard selections are very nice, kitchen cabinetry is too complex and should be simplified. Kim Knuth was our representative and she was excellent

to make  a tour at my new home before the closing date.

make appointments later on in the day. we both work 9-5 so had to book off work for our design centre appointments.

nothig the experience so far has been nothing but the best thank you

Deign Center should be able to define individual price and other options of our choice.  I understand that because of insurance we are not allowed to enter the new structure.  Some customers are more knowledeable than others and should be allowed supervised access during the build.

A visual aid such as a program to see your design choices automatically layed out in your home.  Will take the guessing out of whether it will look good or not as it will justify the small sample sizes
The design centre would be better laid out with respect to upgrades being better defined and more visible.  Also, the tile should be easier to browse through.

ie. second laundry room hookup in basement. With Mattamy options like this were available if paid for. 
Very rigid structure with no flex at Tamarack.
Nothing that I can think of; so far, the purchase has been as good or better than anticipated.

Everybody was professional and helpful.  Noella is very friendly and its always a pleasure to visit her and her team.  Kim was very knowledgeable and had great ideas.  The team at the design centre was always very welcoming and always made time to answer questions.  We dealt with 3 dif girls at the design centre and they were all very good.  It was a pleasure going to every meeting.  I can see you have put some thought and time in the entire buying experience for your customers and it was a great experience.  I have recommended Tamarack to all my friends.

Just to have much more communication for first time homebuyers to fully understand the process and not feel so left in the dark as well as to have the opportunity to visit the home while the design choices are being installed to ensure it is the correct colors, counters and all choices etc...

We would have appreciated an extra staff member present in the design center for clients that are simply browsing with questions about upgrades and standard features. We went 3 times following our home purchase but were unable to ask questions as the design agents were with other clients and there was no one else available. Mandy Mason was assigned to us and is amazing! Knowledgeable and professional!

During the sales stage (1st meeting)...there should be NOTHING to be discussed with regards to upgrades. Upgrades SHOULD be discussed during the design stage. During the design stage, they asked everything that we wanted, inside and out,  but she doesn't know what is standard or not.  To be more specific, she showed us a shower style in the showroom that we are supposed to get, asked us the type and size of tiles, etc.. but that was the opposite of the shower that we are getting. We were carried over for a long period of time... time went on and then they told us we are not getting what we wanted until it was too late to make such changes.  ***Is it true that before papers were signed during the sales process, materials for the house were already bought and customers can no longer make any changes?***  In closing, we are not happy with our future house because we did not get what we wanted.
Having to deal with the brick for the appliances

I believe more time should be allocated during the design centre process.  I felt that there wasn't enough time with the design centre rep for us to ask all our questions and go through each step and/or room.

date of moving in

I would recommend more transparency in the initial buying phase regarding what comes standard and upgrades.  Providing the home buyer with a list of what constitutes an upgrade and the price associated it with it.  This would help give the home buyer a better of idea of what the final price will be on the home they are purchasing.

Customer service reception at design centre needs a lot of improvement.

We would have appreciated being told in advance that our design centre bonus would have HST applied to it. Some of the sales center staff were unfriendly, condescending and we dreaded having to go there.  The design center process was ok; we were very disappointed with the offerings.  We chose Tamarack because we believed the standards were a class above other builders.  This is not the case.  At least 20K in upgrades on top of the purchase price is required to make the house somewhat modern.  The kitchen options were so poor that had we visited the design center prior to the purchase, we would not own a Tamarack home. All is well. I would like to suggest you one thing that they were not able to explain about the upgrades like extra window in the basement, brick in the front in triangle area . Optional upgrade list is very important for customer. Overall experience with tamarack is amazing ??????????

More time should be provided to single home buyers at design centre, all items like tiles should be properly laid out. There should be standard and upgrades separately visible for comparison. She is pro in her field but home buyers are not. It would be nice if the rates are displayed with the upgrades to make quick decisions.

Tera and Carolyn and every vendor and supplier from tackaberry to Muskoka to grants were just awesome.  Building the house while we lived in San Francisco was made incredibly easy and we felt like we had an advocate working for us.   Terrific staff and terrific builder. Need more transperancy on custom upgrade pricing. Granite extension for kitchen island seems to be overpriced. Sales representative should highlight differences between model home and actual home clearly so that customers can make informed decisions.

Be more receptive to client needs. Prices are totally exaggerated. Builder shows absolutely no flexibility for very simple things. Builder is not at all responsible for the environment. 

I don't know a single person who is happy after going through the design centre. Sometimes you simply want them not to install something because they changed the specs and they will not even make an effort to please the client and listen to their needs.

The design centre staff was very caring and tried their best to accommodate us and listen to our needs but it felt like the decidion was made based on the mood if the guy at head office.

The 2 biggest issues we had during our home buying experience were during the design selection phase (the young lady working in this department seemed very unprepared and made numerous mistakes during this process). Communication between the sale centre and the progress of the home being build.  We requested to know if our home was going to be delayed or not. I was not happy with increasing the house price and decreasing the design centre bounce at the same time. If I had the chance to make any change, I will stick to the price of the house and/or the bounce for the design centre.
I am ok with the sales and the process.  I was a bit surprise of fast the upgrades can add up.  I enjoyed the overall process and I will be better prepared for my next purchase.

1. The design  center process needs to be more structured, so the customer can be more aware of timing for all designs to be chosen and more time to select choices/change choices at the last appointment and review the documents to ensure they are accurate and complete.
2. There should be a one-page docuemnt with the full cycle of the process from signing the CAPS to the movein date with approximate timelines.
Not understanding how a gas line can be offered for a dryer and not a stove when the gas line runs 3feet from the stove location to the hot water tank upstairs in the gallery townhomes.
There was a lack of communication during the walk through, the builder did not note any deficiencies - if something is discontinued be up to date with material (decor).

I would like to have more time to make my choices, design centre should be more organized and have clearer labeling so clients are able to compare quality and prices with less confusion . Both processes have been exceptional!  The communication and professionalism we have encountered by all your staff has been outstanding and they have all be very courteous and friendly!  This journey has been a most enjoyable one!  Can't think of anything we would change at this point!

it would be nice to have the structural and design changes to happen together as they often go hand in hand.  It was a pain having to go back to the model homes to make a structural change based on the design finishes we wanted

During the design centre appointment, we were rushed to make our decisions. It took a month to schedule an appointment (they were completely booked). When I called to reschedule the first appointment due to family emergency, I was told that if I did reschedule my closing date could no longer be guaranteed because the Tamarack head office hadn't notified the design centre of our closing date until very late in the process. At the design centre, there were no prices on many of the tiles. We had to wait for our selection to be priced. This took quite a long time, and, in the end, we settled for an upgraded kitchen backsplash that we didn't really like for over $1300, simply because it took too long to get the quotations and we had run out of time. We were pressured to sign the agreement the night of our third appointment (before the 45 day period had expired), but we insisted on taking it home for our review. We were again told that, if we took longer than a day to return the agreement, our closing date would be in jeopardy, even though we were only on day 41. When we read it over, we found a mistake in the selection of the kitchen backsplash. 
Our sales representative has been very friendly and has answered many of our questions. However, we have been waiting on a response from issues highlighted by our building inspector for over two weeks.
We wouldn't change a thing. The whole process was very smooth.
Nothing, everything is fine.

I wish there were model homes of all the types of home Tamarack is selling. But because of their reputation I bought one without seing a model of our choice.



Good job Tamarack!

To be honest the process was very efficient and well organized.

The only thing I would recommend is to be clear since the start of the process about what your home does include and what you have to pay for (outside of the upgrades).

Being a first time home owner, there were many things I didn't know, and I only found out along the way that weren't included as part of the sale price of the house (i.e. the AC unit).  I know that if you ask, the girls at Woodhaven will provide the proper answer, but maybe you can create a check list of what the sales price of the house includes.  A basic standard listing showing all items included as part of the base sale price.  I would do this before the sale of the house.

I know the idea is to sell a home, but all upgrades should be made clear at the start, for example, if you state that hardwood floors are standard throughout the first floor, then make it clear that that means the lightest stain of wood.  Any other stain will cost more.

It might just be that I was a 'rookie' when buying my home, but it definitely does help to have all info. upfront to make a decision.

Don't get me wrong, I love what we have done with our home and how things are coming along, and I am currently recommending Tamarack homes to everyone I know!!

But I just wanted to let you know what upfront info. I would have liked to see.

Thanks,
Jason
More time to be provided at the Design Center. My time was very limited and provided only two weeks to complete the whole process.

The sales center provided inaccurate information on three separate occasions - with respect to the island overhang in our kitchen, the vapour barrier for the garage, the location of the electrical box in the basement, and the type of lighting (e.g. we were not informed that the pot lights were not LED bulbs). As such, this significantly effected our experience with Tamarack at the design center and caused additional (and unnecessary) stress throughout the process. Moreover, because of these inaccuracies, I would not recommend Tamarack to my friends and family going forward.

"Getting quotes from design specialist, which seemed independent / disconnected from Sales Centre. Had many, many quotes (for design upgrades) over days, which could and should have been consolidated and expedited. Have better communication between Design Centre and Sales Centre.

Everything went very smoothly and everyone was very supportive. A question i do have however surrounds the bonus for That we provided upon initial purchase. I would improve the Sales Center experience.  I felt, as the customer, (I could be wrong, but this is how I felt) that we were really valued when we were deciding on which Builder to go for, but once we made up our mind on Tamarack and put the deposit, we did not feel greatly valued after that. The design center experience was really awesome though! Our design consultant really went out of her way to give us quality service. We had an issue with the lot allocation and it was given away while we still had a signed contract and Tamarack still had out deposit cheque. Prices of upgrades readily available instead of checking every time. Maybe online.

Considering that closing date is not there yet, and that I got the house after it was finished, I guess there is not much to say.

We currently live north of Montreal (about 2hrs away). I would have appreciated a few photos during construction sent to me, both for a time line of progress and to see how the house was being built. We should not have to pay to remove items that we have not installed yet.  Example, delete a microwave shelf in order to have an OTR microwave, cabinets haven't been built yet. The sales staff (Deb and Michael) were absolutely phenomenal for over a year of us searching for our home.  They made the experience fun, wonderful, and not stressful at all.  I would give them raises.
That not everything is an upgrade. Gets very expensive if you have upgrade the smallest things where the company could have done it

Seating in the sales office for more than two people.  Although we were comfortable there wasn't room for any others of our family who were involved.  Perhaps the sales desk could be moved back another foot or two to allow customers some more room.  A minor point but you did ask.  Thank you for asking our opinion.
Nothing

If you want answer, better to have a single window model and to continue dealing with sales rep throughout the process.  Debbie Champagne and headquarters employees do not return call and are disconnected from owners' files
Disappointed that we were asked to push the firm closing date back, as this has added the stress that the house may not be ready on time and we have sold our present house.

Sales Centre - Things discussed about our new house were not always properly noted in the paperwork or were forgotten about completely.  Sometimes, we have been told one thing only to have the information change the next time we are at the sales centre discussing our house.  It's can be very confusing.  It makes you feel like you need to write everything down or tape the conversations to make sure you're getting the information correct.  Definitely not enough time to sit and go over the blueprints and not enough information on what to look for on the blueprints.  It's easy to miss things if you don't know what you're looking for or at.
Design Centre:  Choices of standard tiles for the kitchen backsplash are extremely poor.  Notices need to be posted when pricing has changed for upgraded items.  We priced out an upgraded tile that was listed in the binder at a certain price and then found out the next week that the binder price was incorrect and the item had gone up considerably to the point that we could no longer afford it.  It's very disappointing and discouraging.  My wife was near tears a few times when we couldn't find a kitchen backsplash that we liked or that we could afford
However, everyone at the design centre is very nice and very helpful
Possibly consider extending evening hours beyond 7:00 p.m. or be open every day of the week until 7:00 p.m.

When you chose an upgrade should be reimbursed for the standard option..........greedy not to do otherwise.....Muskoka does it.

Unhappy about the additional cost added to granite purchases.  Should be able to get pricing on different models at Emerald.

Cupboards should be available at Grant's tile so you don't have to carry them back and forth.
The sales representative did a great job!
We loved Deb and Mike, they treated us very well.  I think Tamarack should have a few more model homes for viewing.

We did feel at times that, because we were trying to keep our budget low, we didn't always receive as much attention from some of the reps/employees as we would have if we were looking to spend more.  There were a few instances throughout the process where we were a bit blindsided by things that almost made us walk away from working with Tamarack all together but had already invested so much time and it wouldn't be feasible to choose another builder with what little time we had left (we are from out of town and were in town to purchase a house).  We understand that many builders have similar upgrade costs and some of Tamarack's were reasonable (such as upgrading from Oak to Maple flooring) but many were very unreasonable (for example, staggering tile, adding pot lights, etc..)  We are aware that these things take more time, and in some instances more material, but it does not require much, if any, more time/work on the company's end so any overhead costs shouldn't apply, in our opinion. We walked away with the upgrades that were most important to us, but would have been happy to do more and pay more for the house if we felt the costs were appropriate.  Although we know we will be happy with the house, we did feel that the costs of some items were dissuading us from upgrading.
In addition, we found it very difficult to choose our options from such small templates (the 2x4 inch paint swatch, in particular).  This made our process quite lengthy.  If there were larger samples of products, it would be easier and if there was someway to have computer software to be able to see a rough idea of how cupboards/flooring/paint look together - and lighting locations - it would have made the job way easier.
Perhaps a better process to buy the house instead of standing in line before the houses went for sale.

Given we did not have many option because of the City of Ottawa had pre-approved our plans, I would have liked to have made some minor design changes that we were not allowed to do. While I understand why, its still disappointing.
Structural meeting
Would have a determined closing date at the time of signing not TBA
Give more time frame
More flexible hour and fewer options.
A bit more clarity on date ranges - we were uncertain when the actual design process would start, so nervously followed up a couple times.
more otions and clearer price ranges
Not much to change
The design centre should be more open to the need of clients. Software that can help to visualize choices will be helpful at the design centre.
It would have been better to have more notice prior to the inspection
Initial timing presented by Design Centre was not sufficient or consistent with written timelines.  However, this was addressed once feedback was provided through sales and customer service reps

Design Center:  would recommend shorter meeting times with extra appointments.  To have move appointments available on Saturdays.  Some people are not available to leave during the week-days due to work.  It would be great to open Décor Center on the weekend. 

Painting:  Lots for spots, cracks and strikes on wall.  Metal  piece exposed on the ceiling and needs be replaced.  Rush job on the painting all around the house.

Sales Rep:  Needs to be more knowledgeable as we had questions that took along time to receive answers (month or so) and most times with no answer or would tell us to discuss with the décor center who would then direct us to the construction office. 


Frame Walk-through:   We didn't realize what the purpose of the appointment was until we had left as we did not received an explanation. 

We are previous owners of Tamarack homes and purchased through your company again given the great home and service experience received.  Our first home experience was  a lot better from start to finish.  We had repairs completed right away.     Not happy that trades services not working  over the winter as we have issues that we would like to fix.   Example hole in garage that is leaking cold air  into the house that would be nice to have it fixed now.   We have covered the hole with tape etc.  Our heating bill has been affected due to cold entering into our home.

Too many upgrades that should be standard. Incentive of upgrade should be increased or higher. We would have liked to have a choice of hardwood floors instead of carpets without additional fee on 2nd floor.

It would have been nice if the builder would have been more flexible. We understand we bought the home at drywall but all things considered removing things like the prefab so we didn't have to do it after we close would have saved us time later. We really had the master bathroom high up on our priority list but with the added costs of removal of the prefab we were unable to do things before we close. With a baby, it just makes the process that much more difficult after the fact.

There was a lot of miscommunication between the kitchen design and design center; a few times they told us it was the other who would take care of certain design aspects.  As well, we emailed the designed numerous changes and they hadn't been changed in the file prior to our visit.  All of the old choices were displayed upon entering the design center instead of the newly emailee choices which easily added 30-40 minutes on the design process.  However, the consultant was extremely patient with us and very knowledgable.  More consultants are definitely needed for this bulk of volume.
I would have the Pres & Vice Pres & other Top guys to get off their seats and come out & meet us the Buyers.
Design center shall be more capable of offering alternatives to meet the customer satisfactory

The lady with the design she needs to be nicer and not rush when figuring things out.  I felt I was taking too much time and she was bored with my time with her.  You might want to switch people around so they are not bored and maybe switch your standard selections up a bit.  Give the designer more ideas to think about and help with the design.

The design centre I would provide a coat hanger for people.  Maybe coffee or water dispenser.  The rep had her own coffee.  We never had a chance to look at a model home.  The design centre should have had more samples to choose from.  Maybe 3d model software would help in the design centre to see what the choices would look like rather then jus the samples.  It would make the process quicker.  In Kingston, we had to stop at a completely different to get the safety gear.  Also the safety boots were too big.  They didn't have a size for women and they could have been a tripping hazard.  I managed but they should have something for women.
Communication with the design centre, some communication problems.  Some of the samples weren't there and we had to go to Westborough.  There was a miscommunication with the grout colour.  Also discrepancy with shower tile.  We caught a mistake with colour.  A good idea for the design to emphasize to the customer to make notes to compare with the design centre sheets so that the home owner can double check things like we did and catch mistakes before they happen and get put in the house.

Would like to have had a heads up when it was design time instead of being told "here are the 3 dates". The fact the consultations need to be during regular business hours also made it difficult as this means taking a number of hours off work. Being open on Saturdays isn't sufficient.

Would recommend design and Muskoka HAVE to be at the same time, back to back. We had conflicting schedule the first time but it got resolved.

Overall, great experience. Kudos to all the staff.

Our sales centre experience went very well. 

Our design centre experience was quite negative. As requested during our first appointment, we returned to the design centre and completed our selections on our own time. We spent over 10 hours selecting our choices. We were ready for our second appointment with our designer! She was quite negative to our selections, and was not knowledgible on any of the products we had questions about. 

During one of our visits at the sales centre, our sales person told us we could remove the 'Tamarack' brick from the exterior of our home once we arrived at the design centre stage. Once we arrived at the design centre, our designer told us this was not possible. We had to return to the sales centre, where steps were taken to grant our request.

We would not recommend this designer to anyone!
No, nothing to add.

There were issues working with the company Concept Homes.  I did not find they were helpful nor did they respond in a timely fashion in order to complete my selections in time.  

Also after the framing walk-through, it would be nice to get a list of the deficiencies identified and when they were remediated.  I have not see this yet.
There was a pricing options, a lot of them did have enough of a price range on them.

*More follow ups
*Make sure contactor had most recent updated agreement with full list of updates from either Ottawa office or design centre. Such information should not be provided by client directly and this request will only rise concerns to clients to worry more.
I wouldn't change anything; the sales and design centre processes were great!
The design centre is understaffed. The process to choose options felt rushed and was not as enjoyable as it could have been.
I don't want to change anything.
I think maybe the communication between sales centre, and design centre could improve.

The sales process was very fluid and linear, however the design centre process could have better communication, especially in terms of having to contact our own sub-contractors for our upgrades in the home.

If we could change anything about the sales or design centre it would be, to maybe provide frequent non-generic updates of the construction. 
Also, if a home is on the boarder of becoming an inventory home, the purchaser should/must be made fully aware of that, to avoid limitations to their construction.

The problem does not lie in the sales or design process.The problem appears to me that it is in the revised architectural plans (as per agreement with the sales & design center). Also it seems that this information is not given to Your subs (from your office) in time therefore framing wrongly and then demo all the work as per agreement plans! this happened to my unit and just can't wait for a walk through. In my opinion there is a break in communication in the framing process.

I think the upgrade price quotes process needs to improve.  Not only was my design consultant given incorrect information regarding an upgrade (which caused some unnecessary work on her and my part), but she had to submit price quote requests to head office so I only received the costs for the various tile upgrades, etc.  on my final paperwork.  It would be nice if she could have easier access to quotes and be able to provide it more readily to me so I can make choices BEFORE final paperwork.  I also had to keep checking the design consultant's work on colour sheets, etc. because even though I made a few changes in upgrades along the way, she made several errors which would have cost me money had I not caught the mistake.  Doesn't anyone else check it? 
 In addition, the design consultant could not explain how my design center upgrade bonus was applied with taxes as I could not reconcile to the numbers .  She could only say that the "spreadsheet" figures out the taxes with the upgrade bonus.  I had to trust that it was correct.

In addition to the design process, I had asked a question to my customer care representative regarding an inspection prior to drywall going up.  Apparently she gave me completely wrong information by saying that I would get one when design choices are done.  But I later found out from my design consultant that I don't get this walk through because I purchased an inventory home.  I think more care needs to be taken with regard to information being provided to customers.
Hope the design visits can be combined in as minimum appointments as possible.
N/A

Sales rep needs to be sent on a course on what is standard vs. upgrade. Valarie needs to understand that honesty is the best policy as we discovered many areas where she stretched the truth to give us the feeling that our needs were being addressed
ie: 4 car driveway. We asked this questions on at least 3 occasions and were always informed that the driveway can hold 4 cars, once construction began, it was clear the only way for the driveway to allow 4 cars parked would be if they were all Smart Cars. 
Both my wife an I were disappointed with this and a few other areas. I have been been in sales for 10+ years and have never once misled a client to get the result I wanted. We would have preferred to have 'gee I'm not sure, but let me jot that down and get back to you once I have the answer'

Explain that the total quoted price does not yet include upgrades and other additional accesories such as dehumidifier, electronic/automatic garage door openers, etc.  especially for those who are buying a house in Canada for the very first time.  

This is because some houses sold in US come with appliances, so the expectations are different depending on previous experience(s).
To be honest, the entire process was thorough and excellent.
I wouldn't change anything.

We were a little bit surprised that we had to pay for some things that we wanted removed from the standard design (instead of getting credit for them) and still pay extra for some things that required much less material than the original design. Also we think that it is not fair that Tamarack charges $500 for "drywall repair" per floor (in the inventory home) when we requested pot-lights and TV conduit relocation above the fireplace. At this stage the house still is not finished and it's not like Tamarack had to re-do/fix anything.
Nothing - every aspect of the experience was exceptional. Your company has a great team of associates in Orleans.
The communication on setting up appointments were lacking - I needed to reach out to them instead of the other way around.

I would completely change the subcontractor you use for entertainment services.  We had significant difficulty in getting them to accurately depict what we wanted, and then they were completely unresponsive when we were trying to get them to correct it.  In fact, in our walkthrough, we found after having tried to get ahold of them for 2 months, that it was done incorrectly and had to get the vice-president of Tamarack involved in the resolution.  I would NEVER use Concept again.
N/A
It would be better if more tech tools are involved for idea demonstration, for example, with AutoCAD. Often times, I had difficulties to visualize the design ideas.

"Blue prints for new home models with walk-out, to include mechanical location, need to be available to reduce speculation of furnace locations and ducting.
Both sales and design centre would benefit from computer generated displays of available options.  This would reduce guessing/anxiety by providing immediate graphic representation of selections.  These programs are readily available.
Walk through inspection with site boss could be more collaborative vice confrontational.  Client observations are concerns not criticisms."

Knowing that we are limited to certain suppliers when selecting plumbing upgrades would have been nice. We feel that we were mislead on what our options were during the sales process. We were given the impression that all we had to do was provide the make/model info and we could have any _____(sink, taps, flooring etc) we liked for our home.

Please standardize and make the colour scheme denoting the level of an upgrade consistent for all products (i.e. floor tile, hardwood flooring, carpet).  The current scheme is very confusing (yellow-green, blue-red for carpet or blue, green, red for floor tile...).  Just pick one grading scheme for all products.
everythings was wonderful nothing to change Louise, Darlene and Kim made the experience of buying our 2nd tamarack both enjoyable and easy!!!
Please give me VIP on your next new development.

Include list of dates of when the different processes will take place when signing the sales agreement. Processes such as estimated dates for design centre or frame walk through so that buyers can plan around those times.
We purchased a model home therefore we didn't visit the design center.  Our inspection is scheduled for June 9th so some questions are not valid at this time.

First off, this survey does not fully reflect my experience. We had no design centre dealings at all. There should be a 'not applicable' choice.

The house we bought was listed with a realtor, through whom we 'bought' first. It had a sign in front of the house, was in their roster of listed houses. The sales person criticizes us during our officially sale meeting that we should have gone directly to the sales centre instead of going through the realtor. This was very conflicting for me and didn't sit well. Had the sign been a Tamarack sign, I would have gone to the sales centre. Why would I even think to go to the Tamarack sales centre if a house has a realtor's sign on the front lawn?!
There was no model of the home we chose.  As such many errors were made in design option we chose.  Fortunately they were corrected.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. However,one of the issues we had was that we were led to believe that the stainless steel appliances included were going to be high end quality which they are not. The other issue that came up was when we went to make electrical and plumping changes we were told our house was already dry walled and we would be charged extra. In the end our sales person and design center person went to bat for us and we weren't charged. I think there needs to be better communication within the Tamarack family so customers don't encounter these types of issues.

Sales rep, décor and office staff was great!   

Extremely disappointed with the construction rep (located at the site trailer) Mike.   He is an extremely rude person with absolutely NO respect, he is rude, loud and arrogant.   When we arrived they did not have my shoe size for the frame inspection, he didn't care and was totally rude. He was so rude to us that lost all interest to even participate  .... we just wanted to get out h*ll of there. 
We returned for our PDI and arrived on the wrong date,  Mike was extremely rude to us again however, did have the nice lady Wendy do the walk through with us.   Hard hat, safety glass and shoes are disgustingly dirty.
  Wendy is a very nice lady and professional.   Mike is giving your company a bad reputation.  Our family purchased 3 homes from Tamarack and this will be our last. I will never purchase a home because of the experience with Mike.  You need to replace him.

The layout of the design centre is less than ideal.  The standard (spec) choices are limited and in some cases, disappointing (for example cupboard hardware, stair rails, paint colours and bathroom fixtures to name a few).  There are too many upgrade levels and it's impossible to determine their cost during the active selection process.  It makes one cautious when making choices because you don't want to escalate your purchase price by $100K with a series of choices.  There was also nickel and diming on "upgrades" (for example grout colours cost extra).  However, we want to emphasize that all staff we met at the Sales Centre, the Design Centre and the Frame Inspection were excellent - cordial, courteous and professional.

Reponses or prompt responses from the sales team would be appreciated.  More time in the design centre, felt very rushed at the end.  Also I would prefer to pick my own tiles, etc from all the choices rather than have the designer choose just a few to show men and have to keep sending her back to try and find something. Also once I went back and looked at all the tiles myself, I saw something I really liked that I hadn't expected to like. My tastes or vision are not necessarily those of someone else.
Cannot really think of something right now:)
To be able to buy material ourselves as some pricing are just overwhelming

Software program for design centre so when choosing upgrades, the cost is automatically calculated (barring the custom pricing which requires a quote). Also if there was a visual, so if you chose a counter with cupboards, you could actually see exactly what it looks like.  Hard to put it all together when it's small samples. With technology I'm sure there is a program out there that Tamarack could tap into. Also, the design centre representative had an overdose amount of perfume on each and every time I went in and this made me feel sick. On the last appointment with her, I advised her of such. Afterwards she treated me with disrespect and made the remainder of our appointment unbearable. Furthermore she gossiped about it to the sales centre staff and I've been treated differently by them since that time. I understand that I had many upgrades, and quite a few changes throughout the process before I finally signed. I spent @ $50K in upgrades so it was a difficult process, which made it more challenging by the fact that I didn't get pricing on items in a timely manner, so changes had to be made later. Everything is fantastic now with the builder and construction crew. I was blown away with how fantastic Charlie was on inspection. He was extremely professional, and he appeared genuinely concerned with the process. He took the time to explain what will come next as well.
Have the same selection of Standard Hardwood for Half Moon Bay as the other developments.

I found Tamarack to be completely inflexible on upgrades that I wanted because I purchased an inventory home. It was a complete money grab to charge me $500 per floor to install potlights! 

I had no say in where the cable/internet was placed. Also, I wanted to lower the half wall in the kitchen and again the answer was NO with no consideration for what the customer wanted .. and I was wiling to pay for the change!!!  You would not use my Benjamin Moore colour when I was willing to pay for the paint upgrade... and you were charging me an ridiculous price to paint but not improve the quality of paint.  Again completely inflexible in the paint colour.  Cleary design and decor are not a priority with Tamerack.

Howerver I did find Mandy Mason and Ewa to be outstanding.  Some of the best service I have recieved by any home builder.  They were both very helpful and professional.

A change we recommentd is that the basement drawings from the architech (vents, pipes, bulkheads) are available prior to a new model being released.  Unfortunately with our basement being the first to be completed, no one new this information until the day we signed off at the design centre which meant we had several important snap decisions on lighting to make and cabinet changes.  We may have a few imperfections due to the information not being present at time of purchase and signoff at design centre.  Even at the walk through, it was noted another bulkhead was present and we had to contact the cabinet builder to make another correction at this late date to our bar. As is, the cabinet builders can't commit to a final piece to our upper cabinets until the day they install them-hope the stain will be the same once we find out if there will be room for it.
all staff contact has been ideal
For design centre to be more clear on what home they are working on

Overall was ok, but I felt that there were some definite areas needing improvement. Not having a design background we would have appreciated more feedback on our choices than 'if you like it' or 'it's your choice' etc etc. We found that we really had to push to get the answer that was helpful to make our decision. Towards the end of the process we were able to get more constructive advice.  

Also, one other area was notable at the design center. The hours are to 7PM on a given night, and for most people coming from work this leaves a small window to look around. I found it therefore unprofessional when the lights were turned off at 650PM and the staff sat in the chairs by the door with jackets on. It seemed as if we were being rushed or encouraged to leave, something I was quite surprised at. Following this experience we never returned on an evening except for specific appointments.

There is not enough time from the time you decide to buy to the time the structural appointment happens.  In our case it was the same day, so there were some structural changes we wished we could have done but did not have enough time to fully think them all though before the deadline.  It is very hard to select things from the samples or to visualise size and scope of the house without having a model home available.  It would be nice if Tamarack had some 3D software that allowed for virtual walkthoughs or as we selected options have those options show on the software so you can get a better idea of what it looks like.

Very happy with all of our experience at the sales centre. Louise and Darlene in particular have been very very helpful throughout the entire process. We probably wouldn't have bought our home if it weren't for their patience and understanding. 
Unfortunately we had a negative experience at the design centre and with Muskoka. We felt that the process was rushed and we were not well-supported throughout. It took a long time to get answers to our questions and in some cases they went unanswered completely.
