I don't think this was the fault of our salesperson in particular but more a problem with the way the process is set-up and perhaps the volume of clients at the time. We escalated part of our issues to head office (a dispute over a quote we received) and in the end we were not charged on that upgrade but we were still never given an explanation or apology. Many parts of the design process felt like a guessing game to us and it was completely the opposite of the attentive and supportive experience we'd had at the sales centre. Overall we are still very excited to see our finished home and would recommend Tamarack.
Nothing, we were really pleased with both.

We did not get 45 days for our design centre selections. One of our appointments was canceled without our knowledge. Design centre pricing was inflated compared to Boone and euro tile pricing. When we had an issue with something we had no one to talk to we where told "I can't do anything about pricing" or "that's up to head office" and no one we could call. We got the feeling it was a pass the buck mentality and when we called our customer service representative she was not helpful at all. In fact we got the impression when speaking to her in our one phone conversation that she was very busy and no time to speak to us and was in a hurry to hang up. We feel there could have been more of an effort to address the problem directly instead of just passing the buck. It ended up wasting a lot of our time and visits to Boone and euro tile. On the other hand our sales consultant Joy went over and above and helped us with any issues we had. She seemed to be the only one who was helpful enough to persue any issues. Her service was amazing and we wish the rest of the experience we had was as good as the one we had with her.
The counters in the washrooms
I will like the have the blue print at my first design centre visit. I only got it at my last appointment.

The Sales and design team were wonderful to work with thus far.  My only suggestion would be that buyers get a list of options that they get to pick/upgrade, if desired.  We missed having the opportunity to upgrade bathroom faucets as it never came up during our selections.
Happy with both.
The whole experience has been very positive for us so that we have no suggestions for improvement.

We have been given great service with our third Tamarack home in Findlay Creek. Richard, Kim and Scott have been extremely supportive and helpful. 
One suggestion: When buying from plans, whereby there are no model homes, the sales associates should discuss such things as where the bulkheads are.

Our experience started off amazing at the sales centre. The sales rep Sal and Louise were fantastic and a definage asset to Tamarack. From there unfortunately the experience slowly deteriorated. At the design centre Christine was able to resolve our issues. Although we were given an answer to our questions then signed off on the upgrade and were advised at a later date that what we selected (sink and faucet selection) could not be done. Our options that were given to us were pay more money for a combination that works or a refund. There was no compensation for the design centre rep's error. We were advised it was our error on the selection even though we specifically asked our design rep if there would be an issue with our selection. We were told our standard sink could come in a one hold setting for the upgraded faucet we selected. Granted it was not a completely horrible experience but one would expect a greater level of customer service with miss information. Once we got to the frame check inspection of our home the tamarck rep Richard was very short, abrupt and quick to dismiss our concerns. During our inspection there was what appeared to be human feces in our mudroom behind a door in a corner. We were told by the Tamarack inspector that it was animal feces. Nonetheless it was not something one would like to see when inspecting their home.
Electrical selections should not be done on the last day.  Design Centre staff need time to get quotes and see if choices are acceptable by code.
Allocate more time at the Design centre. At least twice the time currently allocated.

Ceramic quotes:

Tamarack representatives confirmed me that no additional fees (or double price) will be added to the ceramic price from any suppliers (Euro Ceramic in my case). 

I was surprised when I have received estimation: the final price was $1,600.00 higher than estimated (this example is for one room only).  

It is difficult to understand the difference in pricing because:
- Labour is already included (no matter if your ceramic is blue, green, yellow, red or black dot)
- No extra $ for layouts
- No extra $ for non-standard ceramic sizes 

I wasted two days for choosing ceramic that I have not installed because of high price (with some exceptions).
I think it is better to inform your client (before she/he goes starts to talk with suppliers reps.) that the final price for ceramic will be much higher.

1-Sales rep should be responsive to client requests and builder should direct clients to design changes based other neighbor choices e.g our Bradbury side windows are face to face with our neighbor Bradbury on one side despite that we asked for a window position change but our request was rejected by the sales person as we do not know our upcoming next door neighbor model and location of their building compared to ours.
2- The builder failed to notify us with the delay in closing according to the time frame in the contract. 
3- We were given very short notice (we have to come and see the house within 48 hours) before having the dry wall.
We’ve been so happy with our experience. Deb at Poole Creek, as well as Mandy at the design centre, were amazing to work with!

We would have liked quicker responses to our e-mails, answers to questions and requested pricing. By the time we got all of the information, we had already passed our limit date for final choices. We do not believe this was the designers fault but perhaps an influx at that time of clients or slow response time from the suppliers perhaps.

A database with a list of upgrades for the Kingston site would be nice, similar to that used by the Ottawa sites.  That would make the selection of upgrades a much easier process as more work could be done ahead of the meeting without wasting the sales rep's time.

I wanted to move the fireplace over by 4 inches in the basement.  I was told that Tamarack could not do it but could not get an answer from anyone as to why not.  The manufacturer indicated they did not see an issue.  I therefore removed the fireplace in the basement as there was no resolution to my request.

Sales woman was fantastic.  If it weren't for her we wouldn't have made the purchase.  The design centre, it was a nightmare.  They were never prepared, cancel appointments, never had anything ready.  Halfway through discussion she would just walk off for another appointment,.  We had to go to the sales lady to get things done.  We took time off and went all the way there but she would only stay with us for 15 minutes.  They took a long time to get back to us with answers and then expected us to make decision in hours rather than days.  I think the lady was retiring soon so I don't think she cared.  She would just say that we need things.  When I asked why she would raise her voice and just say we need it.  She is the reason why we graded 6 for recommending the builder.  The only reason why we would send anyone now to Tamarack is because of the sales lady.
The lighting in the design center could have better, and the showroom more professionally laid out with samples

We felt that the sales person should have had a better understanding of the community development, the property and its surroundings and the upgrade options. We would have appreciated having Tamarack working more flexibly around our busy schedules that often see both of us out of town. At the framing inspection, our expectations of the Tamarack standard were higher than what was actually achieved, example - the concrete floor in the basement is not finished to a high standard. When we addressed the issue, we were advised that the matter would be dealt with at the PDI. We now have concerns that there will be other issues during the PDI that will not be finished to a high standard that we expect of a Tamarack home.
Nothing, the staff and centre have been wonderful.  I would say that our over all experience thus far has been outstanding and we are now just waiting to be able to see our new home!

I would have liked to start the design centre process earlier.  I felt extremely rushed and having a few days to decide about a $10,000 upgrade isn't enough . 

This would have also allowed structural changes to be done while in the design process.  Many structural decisions can't be made until you know what you are doing in your kitchen for example.  We would have liked to extend the bulkheads in the kitchen or move certain walls but it wasn't until we were in the design process that those ideas occurred to us.  By then it was too late.  We bought the home in August and didn't visit the design centre until the end of November.  There's no reason for us to have felt rushed.

I would also have liked to make electrical decisions at the frame-walk stage.  It's very difficult to imagine where something should be; light fixture, television outlets, until you are in the home.  Although Daryle was extremely accommodating and ultimately had them moved for us, it would have saved everyone time if we just picked the locations while in the home (that's what Urbandale does; during the walk-through the electrician goes through the home with you and you get to pick where everything will go (keeping code restrictions in mind).
For upgrades, such as exterior package, stairs, doors, etc, photographes of the items in a house setting will be helpful.
More Handrails Samples ha ha
Great set up, Morgan was very friendly and knowledgeable!
to be allowed another week after the final meeting to add or delete items we added. We would have gotten more upgrades if we were aware of the overall cost during the process.
Have a program set up to allow us to envision what our design will look like with the colour choices, etc. Similar to a virtual interior design app.
Provide the stadars materials in design center as well as upgrated so that a client can see how it looks like not just see in pictures
I would like to see model homes with standards only

Open and honest communication with respect to delays in releasing the lot to us. Although we expressed serious interest in the lot, we were not able to secure it and therefore lock in the purchase price. Price rose by $14k from the time we initially started talking to Tamarack to the time we were finally able to purchase.  
Once the lot was released, process was great.  Having small kitchen set ups in the design centre would make it easier to make choices-hard to pick from small door sample.

Design Centre was very confusing. 
We went through numerous variations of selections,  when we finalized our selection the center lost our final selection causing us to go back and reselected our choices and constantly fixing  incorrect selections that was inputed in the builder system.
We provided a spreadsheet that was extremely simple,  we are very confused how this could happen.

Design area need focus on improvements.
I was satisfied with the process

The builder should provide quality materials for the house they are building. The design center quality for standard materials should meet the size of house, example the railings,and the hard wood. The houses are expensive enough, and one should be able to at least get the worth of the money they are paying for the house. Putting caricature railings on over half a million dollar house, It's just on fair. In other words the builder wants people to pay  for a house and still pay for most of the interior items needed for the house. The builder should also send inspectors regularly to the site to follow up with what they are doing.

Nothing in particular. My sales representative is Noella Francoeur. Noella is absolute treat to deal with. She has made the process of purchasing a new home seamless so far. I have purchased two new homes in the past (Claridge and Minto) and this easily the best experience I have had. A big credit to that has to go to Noella.

Nothing I can think of.  Perhaps more info on other options for alarm providers as we are left with no choice but this one.  Not a major issue but would appreciate more choices then one.  The staff at the Design center and Muskoka were very helpful and gave good advices.  Still happy with our decisions.  House will look great we are sure.
Regards

Gary Patry

I think we would want a bit more information on what exactly must be decided before the structural sign off, which is quite early in the process.  There were things we would have thought about that we did not realize were part of the structural changes.  By the time we got to our design centre portion, we were too late to do somethings we'd thought of.

We never had a Blue Print Meeting, hence the 0's in that section.

1. Have concerns regarding regarding changes being given proper consideration - saying 'Don't worry' to us....& then having it wrong upon inspection.
2. Most standard options aren'y that nice....so everything is an upgrade to make it half as nice as the model home.
3. The model home 'oxford' was so lavishly done that understranding the real floor plan of the kitchen was visually impossible.
4. Paying extra for coloured grout was penny pinching considering the cost of the house.
5. Having pre approved lighting packages and tiles discontinued long after finalization of Design made for a disspointing return to again make decisions.
We did receive some misinformation about the deposit at the start and rushed to the bank to get the full amount when realistically we only needed some and the rest was paid on a set schedule.

Our first sales Rep Tera was wonderful, very helpful and supportive.  Our second rep who we had to deal with at the west end of Kingston was not supportive, told us we weren't her clients although we had to sign everything with her.  After completing the structural and initial purchase with Tera, we were shocked at how poorly we were treated by the rep at the West end location.
NA- I bought a spec home so there were not much for me to add here
Design center Appointment should be longer, do not have enough time to cover everything
To better understand the whole process of buying a newly built home. The tamarack team, Jaqui and Carolyn, were very patient with us and helped us through the process and answered our many questions.
It was a very positive experience

The only issue I had was that during the frame check the foreman was not there and it was someone else.  there were deficiencies found but not discussed by the foreman but by Deborah who tried her best to explain the issue.  At that point, I think that is out of her hands and it should be the foreman dealing with errors found.  I did not get a call on the follow up of the errors found, instead it was ME calling around to get answers and to ensure that the errors were going to be fixed.  This is an area that Tamarack needs to work on. I definitely liked the idea of the frame check, however, the follow up afterwards was not ideal at all.
Can't think of anything.  Everything was perfect!

We were pressed for time during the design center process due to back-to-back vacations of all members involved (design consultant, Muskoka cabinets rep, and lighting group). Would suggest better coordination between these functions or better vacation coverage within each function.
Have the sales and design centre at the same location.

No happy with the décor consultant at all.  She did not offer any help other then agreeing with all selections we made.  She had absolutely no knowledge  about design and upgrades nor did she offer any benefit.  You are tarnishing your reputation with hiring such college design experts.  I will recommend the builder to my friends and family if they change their décor consultant or at least educate them.  This is my only disappointment.

More pictures of different styles and colour combinations in actual homes. 
Being able to have more than one walk through before closing.

We've purchased two other new homes in the past and we had heard good things about the quality of a Tamarack home.  We found the purchasing process very frustrating and disappointing.  We weren't expecting a home builder with a quality reputation, and in context of how much we were purchasing, to nickel and dime us on every single upgrade/change. There was no flexibility whatsoever considering we were spending over $150K in upgrades.  In the past, our homebuilders would ask us for a list of all of our desired upgrades/changes and they would come back with a quote considering the entire package and we could add or delete depending on our priorities.  What frustrated us the most was the lack of credits or discount on replacement upgrades for anything we deleted, including a window, backsplash, closets and some smaller items.  We also found the purchasing process with some of Tamarack's suppliers to be terrible, notably the fireplace and alarm companies.  We booked an appointment with the fireplace company (which had no evening appointments) where we had to take time off work but then the rep failed to show up, wasting our time off. In the end, no fireplace upgrade because we couldn't get any service.  The alarm company returned our call three days after she said she would - again decided against doing any business with this company.  Rogers never called us either.  To end on a good note, though, our Sales rep, Sal, was phenomenal and took the time to explain Tamarack's supplier relationship so that we weren't quite so frustrated.
Use 3D technology to enable clients the finish apparence of their house based on their selection.

I would recommend that communication between sales/design ctr/site needs to be improved. Individually, these three components acted superior to my expectations but  there is a lack of communication between these entities which resulted in mistakes that could have been prevented.
I've had a wonderful experience so far and I wouldn't change a thing. Deb in the sales center is a fantastic woman and really made this experience easy for me during a rough time.
Nothing
Staff in Design Centre is not professional and efficient.
Wished I could have made minimal changes since I purchased 6 months prior to possession

The Design Consultant was great but, I think asking someone to choose colours,etc.9 months before move in and the cement isn't even the ground is not good.
Allocate more time.
Be flexible.
Have to sign off on structural at time of sale but, asking for you to make design decisions as far as colours at that time is unrealistic.
Nothing.  Our experiences have been positive over the many years we've dealt with Deb Durie and the crew at the design center...Christine and Sherri
Worked very well for me. Thank you!

Deb and Mandy were fantastic!! Other than not having a model of the St James at the time there was nothing I would change.  So far all your staff have been a pleasure to deal with and we have enjoyed the process! Thank you! Chris and Lori

- Sales Reps - Only good things to say. Great experience. Good and accurate information. A pleasure to deal with.

Proposed change: None

****

- Follow-up post sale - Not sure who coordinates - Full marks for going through the motions: Sending us an email more than 3 months before closing to inform us that the PDI will follow in a few days was a little odd.  

Proposed change: Send PDI notice at a more relevant time. Perhaps a few weeks before the planned PDI. 

****

Kitchen cabinet coord - Poor coordination. Rep went on vacation after 1st meeting and returned the day before design firm up. No calls or email returned until day before signature meeting. 

Proposed change: Ensure staff is available when time constraint are imposed on clients (if you don't sign on this date, delivery date might be affected). Do not encourage clients to ask if they have questions and then not have anyone to answer queries. 

Cabinet measurement discrepancies – different layouts were provided. Some with conflicting room measurements. We had to go to the property and measure the space ourselves to confirm which layout used the correct dimensions. Being told "things should sort themselves out" falls a little short on expectations.  

Proposed change: Staff should be able to resolve discrepancies. Clients should not have to step-in to sort these out.

****

- Design Center - Poor coordination. Some questions remain w/o answer. Poor experience is mostly not related to the rep that assisted us.

Proposed change: Don't know. Systemic issue? Feels like this is normal design center everyday operations from what we experienced. 

- For several standard items, there is no mention of what will be installed. Some info was provided by your design specialists, some info we know is wrong, and some standard items will be a surprise as no one came back with answers. 

Proposed change: Provide clients with clear list of standard items that will be installed including manufacturer and model numbers (the upgraded items list is well defined. Need to do the same with standard items).

- Upgrades mostly perceived as money grab from a consumer perspective. Some items sold as upgrades only differ in colour and retail for the same price at local retailers.

Proposed change: For upgraded items, ensure there is an actual upgrade being offered or at least some value-added.

- When asked about where we could obtain paint colour swatches for the standard Tamarack paint colours. The answer: Unknown. No offer to find out either. After looking around town, we now know Tamarack colours are standard CIL colours and swatches are available at Home Depot or any CIL retailer. This would have been great information.

Proposed change: Don't know ?? Tamarack staff should know ??
 
- During our interaction with the design center, within the span of a few days, individual item prices on the upgrade list kept changing in Tamarack's favour, sometimes three times the posted original amount. This was somewhat ridiculous.

Proposed change: When on the last stretch with clients, prices presented should be "stable". Not fluctuating daily or hourly.

- We inquired about the difference between items on the upgrade list marked “options” and those marked “upgrade”. Staff could not explain. Still don’t know. 

Proposed change: If these words have no meaning for Tamarack, it might be a good idea not to mention them on your upgrade list.

- Questionable prices - One faucet upgrade we were considering retailed for $170 regular price at Lowes (print out provided). Tamarack offered the same item at the freshly updated price of $340!?! When we asked Tamarack staff, the explanation given: the installation needs to be factored-in... comes across lacking credibility since nothing is installed yet in the property and I figure the default faucet must have included installation.

Proposed change: Align your prices with retail or offer price match when items are offered locally with such disparity.

- Custom Shower upgrade. Between supper time on day 1 and lunch time on day 2, the price went up $2000 (no change were made to the original quote and no explanation was given as to why the sudden change) - Another odd moment. Plus the added bonus of reception staff rolling eyes when we declined this latest updated offering.

Proposed change: ?? don't know what to say ?? Last attempt at money grab??
LITTLE MORE INFORMATION & PRECISE INFO IN COMPARISON WITH MODEL HOME & REAL HOME AT SALES CENTRE

The Sales Representative needs to be aware of the cutoff dates for modifications before making promises to the buyer.  On several occassions, we requested changes.  We were told that they wouldn't be a problem and then had a follow up e-mail saying the changes were not possible.  Accuracy in the price breakdown was lacking.  We are now on our third version of the price breakdown.

I would have liked to seen more flexibility with regards to selections not offered by Tamarack. Such as kitchen and bathroom fixtures. Also, the costs of some upgrades were over the top and I personally could not rationalize them.

Better communication between the sales rep and the design center rep? There were a few small items missed,cable missing, light put in the wrong spot when we did a walk through of the house with the sales rep. When we enquired a few weeks later if this had been resolved we were told by the sales rep to contact the design center rep, not sure why we did the walk through with the sales rep if she could not ensure the changes could be made? Overall this has been an excellent experience and I have thoroughly enjoyed the process! I have absolutely no complaints and if needed would purchase with Tamarack again in the future.

We had a very positive experience.  I wouldn't change anything about the process, everything went really smoothly.  Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and extremely helpful.  

Overall we are happy and very excited to be moving into our home shortly!

None that I know of. Everyone at the Sales Centre and Design Centre are very pleasant. I would really strongly recommend Tamarack. Beautiful homes and quality, excellent (heard from previous and current owners of a Tamarack home).
No, I am satisfied

More examples in the design center
More choices of the exterior of the house
Communication of the progress of the construction can be better

Nothing...it all went quite smooth.  Darlene Louise, Ewa and Christine were all very helpful, Knowledgeable.  Only one negative.  By the time cabinets, doors, painting, installation is done there are a lot of dings and scratches, etc.
I was completely satisfied with the sales and design centre process, I would not recommend any changes.

A more integrated experience. Meaning some things were done by other sub-contractors and thus very often our questions were either not satisfactorily answered or differed to tamarack.

Also a lot of selections were no visual components. So we couldn't see what we wanted visually.

Being able to have some flexibility with the purchase price, having up to date information when purchasing the home (ie selection of outlets). Having more time to think about selections made at design center and beingg able to be aware of prices for ugrades quciker. Lost a lot of time in decision making,waiting for quotes.

The first thing we would change is the time allotted during the design process - 3 visits is NOT enough time to choose everything for a big house and get the info needed to make our choices.  1st visit(orientation) is fine but the 2nd visit requires way  more time in order to ask questions and seek out all your options.   We also only received our price list 4 days before our 3rd visit - leaving us NO time to get through it all.  I would strongly recommend a 4th and even 5th visit to finalize everything in person or at least provide customers with that option. 
Secondly, there should be a more accurate and complete listing of the standards and options available (in the catalogue and in the design center).  We shouldn't have to search the internet to find that info ourselves.  
As for the sales process, we would like more honesty and more open communication in regards to expected closing dates and delays.  A brief letter stating a 2nd closing date with no apologies right at the 120th day before closing was very insulting.  We get that sales reps are following protocol - so that being said, Tamarack's top leaders are the ones who should be more considerate of the enormous disruptions a delay in closing date has financially, physically, and emotionally on a family.  Providing accurate information earlier would be very helpful and less stressful on everyone.

The choice of standard hardwood floors is not sufficient or equal among all home communities.  The options for the Meadows Homes did not inlcude a dark floor option, while other home communities did.  I spent money upgrading my floor just to have the colour wanted-dark stain (e.g. chocolate)  Given that oak is the standard option for all of the floor options, how hard would it be to add a darker stain to the list of options?  You should offer the same standard options at all home communities.  I realize you have different suppliers for diferent communities, maybe that is the problem.   Imagine being at the design centre and seeing a 'standard floor' only to have the rep say-'that's not standard for the Meadows homes...only....home communities.'  I was not at all impressed by this. It is something I bring up when discussing Tamarack homes wth others.
Design Centre - have more illustrations that you can see for ideas.
I would have liked to have been told that eaves trough were not included also Cogeco incentive no longer available
Process is fine, but the cost of upgrades is at least 50% over one can find on their own.

Offer one or two other choices for the kitchen cabinet supplier.  Was not impressed with Muskoka service / advice, and choices.

Offer at least three choices of bathroom supplier.  Boone and the other supplier are very expensive.
C'a pris beacoup de temps pour construire ma masion depuis Avril  jusqu'a janvier
Larger and up to date granite samples as they small sample isn't a good representation of the large slabs.

The design consultation is very paper-intense and dependent on the designers notes.  It was awkward working through all the paper, 'whiting-out' errors, scribbling in margins, etc. and it led to design consultant errors on the day of signing off on the upgrades.  There should be a way to do that online, both for the customer who can then build a virtual set of upgrades and get a sense of cost, and for the designer so they can update info in real-time.

The thing I would have liked to see was more options for the basement 
(bradburry) and possibily a model house with a finish basement to give us an idea.
At the design center ( have more choices in the standards ) other than that it's  all good

We were very happy with our experiences with the sales centre staff. 
(I only indicated '5' on the questions regarding design centre appointments because we did not make any selections as our home was fully completed before purchase).

We can honestly say that we cannot think of anything we would have changed from our experience with Tamarack. Everyone has been very pleasant and helpful, not to mention very quick to get us answers to the questions we had.
Nothing for the sales center but I would include more options in the design center.

We thought the sales experience was superb, Jacqui Collier is a fantastic saleswoman and very giving of her time. 
The ability to have 2 people in the office to answer questions regarding both aspects of sales and design would be an improvement. We found that if Jacqui wasn't present there was nobody to answer any questions regarding the sales aspect.

The design Center staff was very helpful when I already bought the house. Prior to that stage, it was a long time for me to get an answer from the receptionist. I kind of thinking that Tamarack must be understaffed! 
I think buyers need their questions answered before they can decide whether they should buy a house or not!

-Option catalogue for models available for viewing at sales office
-1 standard & 1 options choices kept on file so if option is not chosen the standard choice was recorded and thus can be used.  No waisted time finding it.
-Receive a carbon copy of item
Great product and service! Keep it up.

Provide upgrades cost sheets and upgrades info and what the choices /options are right at the initial purchase stage (many people know they definitely want one thing or another at this stage) as we had errors due to picking our upgrades with decor person at a stage that was too late for the construction stage for it to be passed on in time.  Some things like bath upgrade or inserts need to be selected well before this stage.  Also it seems that there is a disconnect between the people ordering and doing the work as the offer and upgrades are not being read and acknowledged properly because I had to point out several errors that needed to be changed.  
The other thing I would change is allowing for changes that customers want to customize this homes and focus on saying Yes rather than always saying No to requests.  I got the feeling during this process that the builder felt that they cannot learn and better their drawings and homes from their customers ideas. In order to keep your finger on the pulse, you should be open to and listen to your customers changes and preferences because their beautiful home represents Tamarack and free advertising to future potential buyers and to happy customers and positive reviews. I also felt that only Dealing with the one sales representative Jacqui, seemed to be more difficult because she seems to have too much power and didn’t feel that she cares about the buyers.  Maybe she is just too busy. But we felt that whenever we asked for something, she generally would respond with a no answer and we felt as though we were a pain for her and she didn’t value our money or that we wanted a home done as we would like it so we would be happy customers. It didn’t feel like like the buyers and tamarack were on the same side with the same goals — which I think is to provide customers with a beautiful home they will love and be happy with and walk away feeling like it is a positive relationship that they would be happy to work with them and buy from tamarack again.  Not just about tamaracks bottom line.  Maybe there is not enough competition and sales are brisk and they can afford to be cavalier about their relationship with their customers, but if the climate was different and there was more competition and they didn’t own all the lots, this treatment of customers would be different or they would not get the sales.  
Further the design centre needs to be much bigger with more sample in a bright setting, not in a dark basement where none of the colours actually look like they do in proper light.  The pictures of choices of doors, fireplaces, tubs, faucet upgrades etc should be posted to view.  The design centre should also have a program and a computer where they can show their customers kitchen colours and changes immediately to assist with visualization and proper selections. Also to encourage upgrades and much more beautiful homes than the basic standards. Offer to provide lighting upgrades.  Lets face it no one wants those standard cheap lights.  offer to install customers lights by their certified electricians if a purchaser wants to upgrade, so she they move in they can be excited about their home.  It looks beautiful and a step up from the standard home builder the minute you walk in the door.  And you can say I loved dealing with Tamarack, they were so customer satisfied focused and paid attention to our wants and requests to ensure we upended up with a beautiful home and we would love to deal with them again and recommend them highly to our friend and family and acquaintances. During my house construction when I would drive by by to take a look at the various stages of construction, I cannot tell you how many future potential customers asked me about my home and experiences this far working with Tamarack.  I had to be honest.  I’ve built several new homes and I have had much better experience with other builders who were much more accommodating and easy to deal with and felt like they cared that I was going to be happy with my home.
The service was excellent. The staff is very knowledgeable.  So far, the experience with Tamarack has been excellent.
Check and follow up.
Everything was great.

In the sales office, provide accurate descriptions of what constitutes an upgrade and cost estimates. I was considering a resale of a Tamarack home and brought in pics of the resale for the sales associate to price all of the upgrades visible in the pic. About 60% of the upgrades were missed (e.g. t.v. above fireplace, outlet and cable conduit for t.v., blower for fireplace, crown molding, stained pantry door (which is not even available anymore), etc. A $15000 estimate should have been a more than $40000 estimate.

The Sales and Design experience was incredible. I have purchased over 10 homes in my life and I have never had such a positive experience. Louise Weegar and her sales team at Findlay Creek are true professionals and made buying this house a great experience. Mandy Mason at the Design Centre had excellent suggestions and certainly went the extra mile in fulfilling our needs in selecting all of our finishings and options for our home.

Honestly there is nothing I would change in the sales and design process. This has been a very positive experience and I would highly recommend Tamarack to any of my friends.

In regards to the design centre process, I think it would have been beneficial to have two short appointments with the design consultant, rather than one long appointment to make our selections. It was difficult and overwhelming to select everything during one visit of three hours. Luckily, the design consultant was very knowledgeable, helpful, and patient with us.
Ensure that selections that have been discontinued are removed from the samples available for review at the design centre.
To let us know about the front doors so we understand the standard door is glassed one. Now we have to dress it up!

More communication for those outside of the Ottawa area,  taking the time to explain the home buying/process that are first time buyer in Canada and new to the province/country.   More interaction with customers is required.

To make it easier for customers who are not sure about what upgrades they want. It would be beneficial to have a layout or a detailed list or pictures of the upgrades in the model homes so the customer can have something to compare too.

Sales - Even more customer centricity, customization ability.  Initially I was a bit irritated by the sales process.  A customer should never feel like the builder is doing them a favour. I had remind people that as a customer spending +750,000 dollars that I should have more influence and less pushback on things I wanted.   I hated hearing, we don't do that, rather than a better way of explaining to the customer.  Overall once things were signed, I felt the process improve, although it was not without bumps in the road.  Talking with friends who had been/were Tamarack customers, was that the sales process hasn't changed in a long time 10+ yeaars.  They had the same commentary.  I would say that I am ultimately happy with the people I'm dealing with and that they ultimately are great people to deal with; Deb, Mike and the rest of the team.  Way better than some of your competitors, like Minto.

Design Centre:  I love Mandy Mason and Ewa at Muskoka.  Fantastic people to deal with.  The process needs to be more high tech and the ability to get information in a timely fashion from suppliers could be improved.  It was a great dealing with Concept and Bill Bachand, but it was slow in the design centre getting information from them.  The ability to lose options in the process of finalizing them was too great and wasn't perfect.  Too close to the stage where option mistakes couldn't be fixed.  Luke Seargant at Boone was fantastic as well.  

Suggested improvements
1 - A plan provided to the customer should be exactly their elevation and layout.  I had to fix my own drawing to get my house.
2 - The design centre document needs to be done electronically so the customer can have a running total of the total cost of the house and upgrades to keep to a budget.  The process is too slow and its hard to review option costs on paper instead of a spreadsheet

Some of the upgrades (such as countertops) were exceptionally expensive.  Otherwise the selection was reasonable.  It was very helpful to have the price list for common upgrades in advance of design meetings.  However it would be worth clarifying some of the descriptions.  Overall very positive experience - this is my fourth (and hopefully final) new build and the best experience so far.
Nothing so far so good.

Deb Durie at the Sales centre was extremely knowledgable and helpful and gave us some great suggestions and ideas.
We cannot thank Mandy Mason enough for her design advice, her helpfulness and her overall great personality she is a real asset to the Tamarack team. She really went above and beyond to answer our endless requests and question.
Steve the site manager was extremely helpful and approachable. He addressed any concerns and questions that we had with the framing inspection. 
We have been really impressed by Tamarack's customer service and the dedication to providing a high quality product, and putting the customer first.
Thanks, Suneil and Anita Dham

I wouldn't change anything. 
Note: The 5 answers are because he bought a home that was already built.
A little more notice for walk through home.

I would suggest creating a spreadsheet that purchasers can use that includes pricing features as well as taxation and credit calculations.  This would be very helpful in keeping the purchaser on budget while making selections.

Some combination/package in terms of cabinetry, tiles, countertop would be helpful in narrowing down choices.

Purchasers should be given a clear option of leasing or buying installed equipment, such as water heaters.  We were not satisfied in our interaction with Reliance, the chosen supplier.
Not much Valerie surpassed all expectations and was very accommodating
can't think of anything
n/a

Electronic design visualization tools - iPad design software (e.g.) for kitchen and other design elements (floors, tile, etc.).  The addition of this software would greatly increase the design centre experience and decrease errors.  It would also increase turn around times from design / upgrades for pricing and getting the plans into the hands of the construction crew.  Tamarack should have additional suppliers for products such as countertops, plumbing, etc.  The single of option of Cambria quartz, and the extremely high markup per square foot by Tamarack is a bad representation of the market.  Other than these criticisms, working with Tamarack has been a very good experience.  We will be Tamarack cheerleaders.  Thank you.
I am happy with sales centre process and but I am not sure about design centre process. I hope they are as customer friendly as sales representative.

One reason for my low scores in some areas was partially my fault. I had the time for my appointment to review the agreement wrong and the sales rep fit me in to her busy day. In hind site it was not a good idea as I felt rushed
Nothing
Location of the design center. Perhaps a little more centrally located.
more visits to the new house

During both the design centre and sales process, we were rarely able to get answers for many of our questions. Most of the time when we asked questions we were told to call someone else, so it was difficult to track down answers to our questions.

There were not many standard options at the design centre to choose from. The standard hardwood, granite, and cabinets had few selections and they were not appealing. We were also limited in our upgrade choices for our hardwood because we could not pick from half of the hardwood choices at the design centre. We liked a hardwood at the design centre but it was from a different supplier that we could not pick from. This meant that we had to settle with a hardwood that we did not like as much and was a lot more expensive. When we went to the Tartan design centre in the past, they had more standard selections that were more appealing and their upgrades were more affordable.

The design centre scheduled our first and second appointments only one week apart. This meant that we had very little time to come up with our selections since we were supposed to have everything picked by the end of our second appointment. Since we had to rush these decisions, we ended up not liking them so we had to come in many times on our own and make decisions without the help of the consultant. The consultant also made many mistakes in our sign-off sheet so we had to keep sending her corrections.

The design centre was also very inconvenient to visit since it was mainly open during daytime work hours so we had to take time off of work to go there and they couldn't make appointments around our schedule.
no

We were very pleased with the overall process and the level of professionalism.  Many choices were available. Not much negative other than some of the prices for upgrades.  As an example, the hardwood railing that comes standard in the Quail is normally more expensive than the more modern square post for which we had to pay an option.  This is a bit deceiving but it is our choice to pay or not.

We were very impressed with the service overall so far, so no we wouldn't change anything. I want to add also that the reason we bought the house is the planning and the green space in this development. It's something that you don't see anymore. Great job Tamarack!

The pictures or mock ups of the homes online and in brochures had white brick which is somewhat misleading as the house itself does not. I would change that so it’s not misleading to others. (Eton modles and townhomes)
Having to made upgrade choices knowing eg. price of tile before sending it to make prices..for a specific model

Found the process overwhelming with many too many choices and an unclear process. There should have been better communication between the kitchen designer and the design consultant.  I asked questions of the kitchen consultant, but was told to ask the design consultant.  When I did that I was told that I should have asked the kitchen consultant and she seemed annoyed, as I was supposed to finalize my choices that day. When I received my initial e-mail on the design centre process there was supposed to be an attachment but did not receive that.  Spent days being given a runaround trying to get back to the whoever had sent me the e-mail.  The e-mail address I was given didn't work, so made several phone calls.  In the end I got through to the person I needed, only to be told that I could have just gone to the website to get the same information.  Overall found process frustrating, poorly communicated and not one I care to repeat.

The experience was not worth while and the costs are extremely jacked up, Tamarack is no match for the customer service as my previous builder. The design centre failed to return the calls and some time I do feel that your protocol is not worth as per the money we are dealing with you.
Prices have not been clear and all features are termed as upgrades while in my present home they were standard. In the nut shell I should say there is a difference between selling a $5 pizza and a half a million house, which I dont see dealing with Tamarak.

The sales experience requires change, it was difficult to obtain answers and there was high pressure to write a check before answers were forthcoming.  Everything was usually answered with "we talk about that later in the process". It often felt like things were being hidden and if we didn't ask the right question we would be left to find things out by surprise.  The attitude presented was "the homes will sell, so we don't have to cater to you".   

I would change anything with the design centre experience.

To have more pictures of the standard materials used for a particular model home.  While necessary to walk into a model home and feel good about it (because of the upgrades done to the model home) I would like to see pictures of what it would look like with the standard features.

With a clearer image of what a particular room (say the kitchen or bathrooms) would look like with standard features, it would make it simpler to make decisions about upgrading.

Thanks.

THIS IS OUR SECOND TAMMARACK HOME WITHIN 1 YEAR. SALES STAFF WERE VERY WELCOMING TO OUR SECOND PURCHASE. DUE TO THE ESTIMATED TIMELINE OF OUR SALE OF THE FIRST HOUSE AND CLOSING OF THE SECOND HOUSE WE DO NOT THINK THAT OUR PRIORITY REQUEST FOR A SOONER CLOSING DUE TO THE SALE DATE OF OUR FIRST HOUSE WAS TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION BY TAMARACK OR PROJECT MANAGER EVEN THOUGH A WRITTEN REQUEST WAS SUBMITTED MONTHS EARLIER FOR A SOONER CLOSING. BEING A SECOND TIME PURCHASER WE WOULD HAVE EXPECTED MORE OF A PRIORITY TREATMENT I THIS REGARDS. WE DO NOT BELEIVE THAT THE PROJECT MANAGER GAVE ANY EXTRA EFFORT TO MEET OUR REQUESTS. VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THIS REGARDS EXPECIALLY WHEN IT CONCERNS CUSTOMER SERVICE AND CUSTOMER SATISFACTION. IN CLOSING MY ONLY DISSATISFACTION WOULD BE IN THE LACK OF EFFORT GIVEN TO HAVE THE HOUSE COMPLETED SOONER.

The sales process went very well.  The salseperson knew we were tight for time so sent an email to the design center to schedule our first appointment ASAP.  It took us a week to get a hold of the design center and our first appointment was made for three and a half weeks after that.  Because of this month delay we've had to push back the closing date.  It would have been nice to receive some follow up from the salesperson to get us in contact with the design center quicker.  In my opinion, if the design center is so busy that it takes a month to get your first appointment more staff should be hired.

A bit more time in the design centre process would have been good.  Muskoka was very slow with our changes and drawings which put us several weeks behind in completing the rest of our selections.  We also found it difficult that we selected everything only to find out a week later that most of our counters and some of our tile had been discontinued.  Not sure how to improve that part of the process, but it would be nice.

The only thing would be to have a list within the model homes of what the upgrades are (not simply identifying that the - hardwood - is an upgrade, but which one was selected) or have it readily available at the design center. It would be nice to have that information if they are upgrades you'd like to select for your new home. But that's simply a would be nice. The staff were amazing, very knowledgeable, helpful and extremely pleasant to work with.
Everything is almost perfect.
I would like design centre can produce the customer's design in the computer, so customer can has more clear picture for their choices.
Overall our experience and process has been a positive one.

More choices of colour (peint) for the entire house.

Better communication when you send your customer to Mondeau.....we had a really bad experience with them and head office did not help (even though they gave us 500$ at the design center) it doesn't compensate the difference....Mondeau told us that our upgrades should not cost more 1500$ when in fact the quote was over 6000$!!!

However, Mandy, Ewa, Darlene and Louise  were amazing!  We met Charles (foreman) yesterday and he seems efficient  and comprehensive!
Browsing hours and having a staff member look after home buyers with questions on upgrades and such.

Nothing! 
Valerie was great at the sales center, Mandy was amazing at the design center and Carla is continuously amazing during the rest of this process.
Plumbing contractor abusive in price of upgrades

A few things.  Update templates for KINGSTON.  Every amendment or legal document has to be changed to reflect not only a different city but some legal nuances with respect to building permits and so on.  Have a Kingston template.

Provide customer with building plans to review.  Numerous issues could have been caught if they were reviewed.  After discussing intent to build large deck later, install chimney hood fan in kitchen, or other paid upgrades, it would have been obvious if actual plans were available to notice that structure was not being pre-located to support these 'owner installed' upgrades.  An earlier meeting with a Tamarack rep familiar with structural issues would have been beneficial as we were required to settle structural issues related to a fireplace before we had even discussed or settled on this interior design item.  Tamarack was supportive of making last minute amendments to address this latter item but turned down structure to support a future deck.

Tamarack and its alarm sub refused to pre-wire for an alarm system and the sub they forced us to use was, pardon the pun, sub-standard.  This issue was dealt with separately with Steve already however the customer lost out in this case as I will now be forced to install an expensive after-construction solution.

The relationship with the onsite foreman MUST be improved.  While we have been warned and advised by Tamarack that Mike is defensive and can be abrasive, its like walking on egg shells with him and it does not lead to constructive discussions or a good working relationship. The walk through I expected to be longer and more inclusive however on arrival it was rushed and focused solely on paid upgrades.  Again, if other issues were raised, first reaction was extremely defensive.  I would rather a friendly 'can't make any promises but let's look in to it' than a 'why didn't you raise this issue before?'(we didn't know it was an issue until we saw it) or 'is it in the contract?' (we thought it was!).  

The design center is looking much better now than when we started the process.  Having the majority of standards and some upgrades onhand to look at was VERY useful.  Some of the staff at Bathworks and in particular Grant's Tile were extremely unhelpful.  We have passed details to Tamarack separately.

Finally, there were strong emotions associated with the process of the initial down payment to hold a plot and closing date ( a key factor in deciding to initiate the process was a Sep closing date) and then to find out at signing that the closing date had slid a month with no notice until it was too late.  We carried on but it was almost a deal breaker and we felt like victims of a bait and switch routine.
Overall experience is very good so far.

Design Center very confusing and unorganized.
This should be revised and looked into.
We realy didn't like the Design centre experience.
Extend the hours of the office, I work evenings and weekends so it was hard coordinating times to go to the office or design centre.
No Changes.  Representatives were great.

-More knowledgeale design centre representatives
-Better organized display
-Accurate pricing for upgrades
-
More details about what will be the cost of our house including Tarion, transfer tax and an approximate amount of our lawyer's fee in order to keep peace of mind throughout the purchase period.

Engage the customer more during the initial build process. For example, companies like Mattamy will send an e-mail to the buyer when the builder permits are approved, when the shovel hits the ground, etc.

Ensure that people are fully aware, and have some time (more than the 10 day wait period) to decide on all structural upgrades, if they need the time. I felt rushed on that end of things, and did not get adequate time to make decisions.

Better streamline the design process between Muskoka and the Design Center. Personally, we found differences in pricing between the two, even though we were asking about the same product/upgrade.

Get rid of AlarmBridge as Tamarack's alarm system supplier. We have never dealt with a salesperson who would harass us so much about setting up an appointment, stand us up for the appointment, then take no responsibility for it. It's a poor reflection on the company, and the companies that Tamarack deals with.
Every thing is fine
n/a...everything exceeded my expectations!
A bit more clarity of costs associated with upgrades, how the 'design bonus' works (i.e. we were surprised to know we were being taxed on this!).

1.  More time to make decisions and review upgrades.
2.  An upgrade booklet that is actually representative of the prices and upgrade availabilities.
The services provided at sale and design centre are very good. Could not do the walk through inspection, being from Surrey, British Columbia.
Clear information of upgrade products

should give little more time to choose flooring and interior of house.may be take little samples home and come back with decisions.also we told we wanted  one extra window in basement which was not noted in structural changes.

More basic selection colours: hardwood flooring ( as it such s huge decision), paint again huge job, more basic colours should be available 
And available time in the model home for measurements etc - very limited hours to the model home, and when I asked to go for s scheduled time it was denied
Design centre - speed up the process of pricing out certain upgrades.
NA

It would have been great to know about all the structural upgrades PRIOR to signing off of them and attending the design centre. Would of been great to have more paint colour options for the walls. Lastly, we have made several requests to know the exact final purchase price of our home in order to secure our mortgage to only be told that Gowlings (Tamarack's selling lawyer) will notify our lawyer a few days before closing. Calculating the total CMHC (if applicable), HST rebates and tax consequences of the build would be helpful before closing. We would also of enjoyed having a key to the home during the build or more scheduled visits to see the building process.
To reduce the price for upgrades and add more variety.
Nothing , it was a great experience overall. As a first time home buyer the general experience is overwhelming, but tamarack helped make it enjoyable!
Customer service with Muskoka Centre wasn't fairly well when we were not really sure with our choices and needed more help outside of our appointment or

The sales and design representatives are fabulous!
The terms and conditions Re: Purchase Agreement are plentiful and regardless of what I purchaser, very few companies spend time ensuring purchasers understand their  50 page agreements.
My low rating for referring or recommending Tamarack to others is because of construction delays. This is my first time buying a new build. I was referred to Tamarack because previous owners of multiple Tamarack homes spoke highly of Tamarack delivering  all of their previous homes on-time. This coupled with my own research led me to purchase a Tamarack home. Being able to differentiate itself from other good builders, particularly with being able to deliver on time, is a huge selling feature.  In good conscious, because time is money, I am telling friends that while Tamarack is a good builder, but they cannot count on its past reputation of delivering on-time.
Choose all the upgrade of or choice
A descriptive list of next steps and dates upon purchasing the home

I think more transparency during the sales process would be better. We were pretty informed and did a few visits to the design center before signing, but this was not necessarily something that was offered, it was something our realtor recommended and organized. More transparency regarding upgrade pricing in the sales process would have also meant a faster deal for us, as it took quite a bit of effort on our side to try and price things out to remove uncertainty before signing the contract.

feedback about kitchen designs  we would give pictures and ask questions and two weeks later we would hear our answer after several emails and several calls and then when we went to the meeting about our kitchen design the consultant was not prepared even though we had sent several emails about the design we were wanting  and then we were told we have to close off or you will be delayed on your closing. if we got answers to our questions in a quicker response time we would not have been having to call and be stressed about meeting the deadline. poor communication between design centre and sales people. no central point of contact. our daughter bought a few years ago and did not have this problem. We were not told who to talk to or we had to figure it out ourselves and things would come up that design centre would say we could do eg. change our sliding door from right to left, 3 weeks later we would find out we coulnot do it after we were told we could so did not think it was a problem. same as our shower we had purchased a upgrade and a few weeks later we were told we could not get that one. This should be known at time of purchase. Definite lack of communication. We would be told to contact sales staff and we would say cant you do this with regard to the sliding door.
All upgrade options should be able to decide during the design centre. Currently some options are no longer available once passed the sales period.

The Sales Centre staff was very welcoming and helpful.  Everyone seemed very knowledgeable and excited to work for Tamarack, which definitely helped us in selecting a builder.  Valerie Taller represents Tamarack very well.  

The Design Centre process was extremely overwhelming, particularly given the tight time frame that we were afforded in order for our closing date to remain in effect (keep in mind that we did not purchase an inventory home and Tamarack selected our closing date).  In particular, we felt very rushed by our Design Consultant, who, on numerous occasions made a point of reminding us of her 'other' appointments.  Choosing colors and styles is an exciting part of purchasing a new home, which we have done on two other occasions in the past, both times with excitement.  Unfortunately, this was not the case with Tamarack's Design Centre.  On a more positive note, Sheri, from the Design Centre was very helpful and accommodating.

Scheduling the pre-delivery inspection has not been a positive experience. We were called and given one date. Efforts made to reschedule or explore a different date were met with resistance and curt responses. There should be more flexibility in this process. The reason we are able to buy an expensive Tamarack home is that my wife and I have full-time jobs. Moving into a new home has already required time away from work, at a cost to us.

Nothing.
Overall, I think all Tamarack service persons were friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Made our first home purchase a great experience so far.

I received emails several months in advance of when I was actually called into the design centre. These emails indicated that I would be notified of my design centre appointments very soon. I had contacted the design centre to ask about approximate dates of when I would be called in for my appointments because I was trying to plan other commitments around that timeframe. There were several unanswered emails and phone messages from the design centre front staff regarding this question. This was frustrating. It would be helpful if they were more responsive going forward. Being a homebuyer, it is not acceptable to have multiple messages go unanswered. 

In all other respects, my experience so far has been very good. The sales office was awesome, even with answering questions months after the purchase of the house. The design consultant and the Muskoka designer were also really knowledgeable and accommodating.

Everything is very strict. For example, I bought a unit for which choices had been made but they were not at that stage yet. I had to put a lot of pressure of have some features changed. 

No walk through of what the kitchen would look like (am not talking about cabinet door and hands), talking about lay-out of kitchen.

There was an exact replica of my unit in the next building, basically at the same stage of construction except that the choices had not been made. They could have used the options of my unit for this unit, thus allowing me to choose my options.
More communication in regard to the status.  I only received one e-mail to date saying the foundation was started.  I drove by recently and see that they are moving along quickly though.

N/A, my experience with Tamarack has been great to date! 

The people, the service has been a very pleasant experience! 

No recommendation at this time, 

Thank You!

Paolo

When you are looking to make structural or design selections, it is difficult to visualize how it will look, it would be nice to have better way to visualize the changes and how they will appear.  Some sort of 3D imaging would allow buyers the chance to visualize the changes and understand any potential unanticipated consequences.  Failing that, greater flexibility in adjusting for unanticipated consequences would be great.  When you spend $500 - $650K on a home, you want it to be the home of your dreams.

I would like to see a more accurate example of the interior finishes in the design centre (I.e, the upgraded shower in the design centre was not what was put in our ensuite bathroom - we were not advised in advance that site conditions might impact whether the shower is flush with the tub surround, like it is in the design centre. This should be clearly communicated earlier on in the process.) Also, we were very disappointed in the standard soaker tub that was installed in our ensuite bathroom. We had seen a photo of it before finalizing our decisions re: interior finishes; however, the actual tub is too narrow, and had there been an example of this particular tub in the design centre, we would never have chosen it. We discovered these issues on our framing walk-through and notified Tamarack that same day of our concerns, but by the time we got a response, we were told it was too late to switch the standard soaker tub to a different, upgraded tub. Our design centre consultant was on vacation during that time and when she returned, she immediately spoke with someone at head office to advocate on our behalf to have the issue with the shower fixed, but she was told it was too late to put in a different tub. The design centre consultant and the Muskoka Kitchen consultant we dealt with were excellent; I think it’s a matter of having more samples of standard and upgraded items in the design centre and advising customers that what they see in the design centre may not look exactly the same in their home depending on the model/site conditions. The salespeople and the foreman who did our walk-through of the framing are also excellent - very helpful and responsive to our questions and concerns.

I was a disappointed about my closing date being changed.  I also found the design centre to be very confusing and that not enough time was given to make all the choices.  I also found them to too busy to finalize my kitchen design.

I absolutely enjoyed both the sales and design centre processes. However, if I have to change one thing, i would say I'd like to have a bit more time with the designer at the design centre. I felt that both appointments with the designer weren't long enough. Given the size of our home, we had a huge list of selections and we had to make a couple of hasty choices towards the end of the appointments. We ended up having to follow up after the first appointment to make adjustments. The designer was very accommodating. However, this could have been avoided if we had just a bit more time with her initially. Overall, great experience. Thank you
The opportunity for a second inspection between frame inspection and closing to view upgrades ie: custom tiling and kitchen cabinets to ensure they are as  client requests.

Make better use of the first design centre appointment so that the buyer can start making selections.  This will give more time for selections to be solidifed and if anything needs to be priced, the buyer will have the prices before the last appointment and still be able to make changes in conjunction with their budget.  Also, it would be better to not have to wait for pricing on ugrades (unless its a special order).  If its on display at the design centre, it should already be priced.  Finally, there should be more time given between appointments (with other buyers) so as to eliminate the feeling of being rushed for the buyer.  Three hours as promised is fine, but the buyer should get to use the full three hours if necessary.  Since there is no where else to put this, I must say I was extremely pleased with Deb Durie and her sales team.  They ALL did a fantastic job and I would buy another house with them anyday!!

The sales centre did not always know who would answer questions - whether it was part of the purchase or a design centre issue.  The only point we were very (very) disapointed with is that we are downsizing into a townhouse and we were told that there was no way to get a french door instead of a patio door.  We wanted to avoid the after we purchase type of renovations.  WE are getting quartz installed in kitchen and all bathrooms after we move in as your upgrade prices were just to expensive.  Quartz through Tamarack $14,000 - purchased after is $6,000.
None.
Nothing!

When she bought the house she was not told that she would not be able to pick her brick.  It wasn't until after the sale and she asked when she would be able to pick the bring.  She does not like the brick that her house will be buit with.
Would prefer more options or selection in flooring and kitchen samples in base price .
Be allowed more visits with the designer! Having one appointment with the expert to decide everything is a lot. It should definitely be split in two visits.
Design Centre should be open some evenings.

Its the Maskoka cabinet company has made little mistakes that could have been avoided.  Hardware has been uneven but its being fixed.  Tamarack has wowed us every step of the was.  During the selection experience, the tile selection process was a bit of a pain.  They would have to keep getting quotes each time for the upgrades and that made the process very long.
Not being misinformed so many times. My sales rep was very rude.

There were a couple of things we weren't informed about.  We talked about if we could have a fireplace up and down stairs but it was never mentioned that we had to make a decision right away.  The other was adding a water line for behind the fridge,.  It was never discussed.

The process to confirm changes at design at the design center and choices is long because the consultants are busy. I feel using a web form or app would make it easier for both the customer and consultant to avoid repetitive manual work and confirmation and also to get a visual online of the choices vs. a paper form. This process needs to be updated to modern times and not be stuck in the past causing inefficiencies. Also was not too impressed with the consultant for Muskoka who was not able to provide pricing estimates on changes that I would expect others to have made in the past. It was frustrating getting the turnaround on design changes and the pricing - would have preferred to get a response quickly based on their experience.

Also if would be better to just have a single point of contact and not have to deal with multiple contractor reps.
nothing, everything was great.
Our only dislike was with the security company, we didn't feel that we were provided with good service which makes us not have any confidence in the company so we have decided to take another one.
better product.  example more exotic tiles more colors of faucets and shower. too standard for choices

Hand out with a list of things that needs to be done prior to my 1st meeting with them; appliances, select, purchase and come with dimentions.

Better hand offs between Sales and Design.  During my framing inspections, I was cought in the middle runnign between Sales and Design.  As a client of Tamarak, that should be an internal division and transparent to me.  If there is a division, then Design should be required to be present during the inspections - no exceptions.

Responsive to the items shown in the contract.  My offer specifies certain items, I raised concerns during constructions which were unanswered and now I am faced with dealing with these through Tarion and my lawyer - location of floor drain next to furnace - your contractor was using the old specs - where the furnace used to be located and not the new specs - where it is now located.  Very few builder are contientious about this item and believe it to be trivial - it is not when you live in the home and make use of the space.
-We would have liked more than 1 day's notice for our frame check
I will put the options and upgrades at the design centre. Having both at the sales and design centre is confusing.
I wish there will be more model selection when I am upgrading my next home with tamarack
nothing

Sales persons should know what they are talking about, and the decor center process should be more user-friendly. It is nice to see the materials, but if there is an option to chose everything in a tablet or an application that will save a lot of time. Decor center persons are very good with their stuff.
More time with the designer at the design centre.  I felt rushed and under pressure to make selections quickly when considering only the time provided with the assistance of the designer.

I would certainly appreciate  that, once all papers are signed and ratified by Tamarack and Design Centre, customers do not receive notes indicating that some items ( upgrades wanted by the customers )were left out and need to be paid for. It is so frustrating because it affects the customers' budget.
Tamarack and Design Centre should double check carefully and make sure that all upgrades are included in the contract and paid for.
Not have so many option in the design phase and make the standard options of higher quality.
A little more time between the initial meeting and the time to make selections would have been nice.

Would like the opportunity to see the progress of the house more often.  
 Felt like the variety of standards being offered is limited forcing you into an upgrade.
Have design centre provide sufficient time to customers according to their needs especially first time new home buyers.
Would have liked to have had te opportunity to visit the unit during the finishing stage at not just 2 weeks before closing.

When buying our home, the process was very smooth.  We initially pointed out a conceren for the instalation of a Murphy Bed in the basement of the Cambridge.  We were advised that it would fit and it would not of been added in our options if Tamarack could not install it.

The same concern was brought up during the frame check.  Our concern was acknowledged giving us the same response as before.  Adding that the Muskoka designer wouldn't of approved it, if it wouldn't fit.  A few weeks later once the walls were closed, we were informed that the Murphy Bed would not fit on the desired wall, because of the bulkhead in the basement.  With some disappointment and compromise we came to an understanding.  

I reccomend that included in the blue prints, are the ceiling hights, this including all floors of the building, including bulkheads.
N/A

Kitchen pers. a little unprepared/disorganized for our first meeting. There was no guidance as to what to choose, or select. Would have preferred for them to have a little design background. Would have like to have suggestions made as to what type of cabinets could go in place of what was offered, etc... Luckily I have my own ideas, but I still found it difficult. I can only imagine what the experience would have been like for a first time new home buyer who had never designed a kitchen before.

maybe have more time for decision making on selections, we went several times on our own, however, the rep had really great ideas which helped us to achieve our design goals.  We got the impression that reps maybe try to squeeze in many appointments in a short time, and we realize it is a long process...  Many another rep?  

You have very knowledge staff working in your ottawa design center, and everyone is always ready to help.
More communication about construction schedule and status updates.

when I did the frame  check walk through, more information could be given at that time the person present  was not responsible for the work. The design process I thought of options afterwards like features>sub floor in the basement under the carpet. I thought of it after and it was too late. It is an question of comfort and this was not suggested at the time. They may want to offer this to client - maybe people are not asking for it but it should be provided. The whole process was nice. By the way the sales lady recognized me from a previous home buying experience 37years ago. She knew exactly what I needed and within 2 hours I was signing papers.
More standard options or just more options.

For sales centre process, there should be more help from sales centre staff on possible structural options available/possible, because as homeowners it can be overwhelming when trying to think of all the possible structural changes to make (ie changing mudroom window to a door for side yard access).

You guys are not clear at all about what you get as basic options.  There are very small unclear pictures of the basic options then you have very clear high res pictures of upgrades.  I feel that this is a trick to entice customers to pay extra and upgrade.  No one, including the design rep, can show you clearly what the basic options are.

The walkthrough was fine and we picked up 4 errors.  Richard, our site sup at the time, noted all down and promised they will be corrected.  But they were not corrected and the trades continued. Had I not gone in the house on a later date, unaccompanied, these would have never been picked up and corrected.  They made silly mistakes, such as putting the dryer vent in the cupboard under the laundry sink; and installing a full wall instead of the $4,000 dollar upgraded half wall for the master en-suite.  I found out that the reasons for this is because there are any proper site supervisors for Poole Creek and they are mostly in Findlay Creek.  And Sarah Mayer nor Carla Mason could give me absolute assurance about the possession date.  So far, experience with Tamarack is quite bitter and I don`t think I would recommend anyone to you.

Nothing.  I truly feel that Tamarack is at the top of their game.  This is my second Tamarack home and my husband and I have been pleased both times!  We are looking forward to continuing the building process!  :)

We have really enjoyed our experience thus far, the only thing I would mention is that we have not been offered an inspection of our home. We were told at the sales centre and the design centre we would have the oppourtunity to walk threw our home during the framing stage,  our drywall is now complete and we still have not recieved an invitation. 

We are disappointed because we have noticed that some of the changes that we have paid for (ie; the wall againest the kitchen island ) the drawings have not been followed. We feel this could have been avoided if we had been given the chance to walk threw the home and we are now hoping that anything that needs to be rectified  will not effect our closing date. 

I look forward to hearing from your customer service rep.
613.692.2135

Thank-you in advance,
Jeney
