More Kitchen cabinets and designs to look at...In Kingston, where we are, you should be given the option to go to Ottawa to see the kitchen design center there......We did it on our own and are really happy we did. So much easier to make the decisions upon seeing the actual product instead of samples..Ewa was a fantastic help..

I think the creation of a roadmap of the all the steps and timelines would be very helpful in order to visualise the process. I find that we are always waiting to hear what is our next steps and what we should expect. Having this when we sign would better allow us to plan for visit, appointments etc and to anticipate the next steps.

I would also like to say that Darlene and Kim are fantastic. I have truly enjoyed working with them both.

Sharing my design centre experience:

Tamarack could make better use of the technology to educate customers like us. For example, the design consultants should be provided  ipads  or similar devices, which could be used to demonstrate to clients how our homes would like after the upgrades. This is the norm in the construction industry right now.
As a client, without the ability to visually see how the upgrades would look in my new house, it becomes very difficult to image and was worrisome experience for me.
Regret some of the design choices made. Really dislike some the choices. Will likely sell next year because of extreme dislikes
Both processes ran smoothly.
Maybe a little more recommendation regarding interior upgrade choices especially for people who have no experience with interior design
It was great ! I would not change a thing !
Opportunity should be given to do  the  changes to the selection. Dedign centre atleast have all standard things. Design centre appointment time and # of appointments should be increased.

Faster scheduling of design center appointments
Electronic tools to help see what my house would look like with different options

Mandy and Deb were both awesome!  They made it so easy and helped so much!
the sales and design centre were absolutely fantastic, nothing to be changed here

Maybe a little more time in the design centre as there is just so much to choose from.....or this should be mandatory for the women to complete and have a separate bar/lounge area for the guys!!  (just kidding)
need to allow more time(4-5 visits, each visit 1-2 hr) for design process.

Sales centre rep more accessible.  Make it easier to determine what are upgrades in the model home and the total cost of the upgrades in the model home.  The design centre process would be better if it included more than one selection consultation with the design rep.

The only customer service I've received is from the sales office, design centre and my on-site inspection.  
I contacted Tamarack on October 3, 2015 inquiring about my agreement of purchase and sale and asked for a review of my purchase price and offers provided.  To date, after numerous emails requests by me asking for a review and meeting, I am yet to have this completed by head office.  I have escalated my emails directly to the President and am yet to hear from him.  I have expressed my concerns of the lack of customer service after spending approx $400,000.00 on my home.  I am appalled that such a reputable builder has shown no regard for my inquiry.  I would not recommend Tamarack for these reasons and regret my decision for choosing them as my builder.  Perhaps this survey will generate a meeting.

The staff at the office and design centre were fantastic, helpful and knowledgeable. The only disappointment we had was with the quality of the construction of the unit. My husband and I are realtors and have good knowledge about homes and there are issues in the quality of the construction that were not adequately addressed .
We reached out to the office and the site superintendent to correct them. We realize that they have a tough job and  there are shortage of quality trades people available,  it is a challenge on the home construction companies but if you notice deficiencies and not fully correct them that is disappointing.
I would have liked another week before having to sign off on the design/upgrades.  The Sales office  once I committed to purchase were not as quick to respond to my emails/questions.

A chart with all of the timelines would be beneficial.

Other comments:
We experienced delays with the sales representative and design consultant where they had to consult with head office. An example of this is in our upgrade price list where it seemed that hardwood floors could be installed in the basement at no additional cost. We were informed that it was a typo, but it took several weeks to get a response. On a side note, we felt that Tamarack should have still provided us this upgrade given that it was the price we were provided.

We were fully informed by Tamarack as to what we should expect from a framing walk through. Furthermore, insulation was already on the walls and the plastic barrier on the ceiling which seems contradictory to the name of the inspection. We were informed by the design consultant that we could make tweaks to the position of lights during this walk through. We were only able to obtain small tweaks after having pushed for it.

Vic took notes during our walk through, but we did not see the final product. Vic had also mentioned that we could visit the house anytime during the build, but that we had to contact Susan to make sure that no trades would be there which would prohibit us from entering. We tried to schedule a visit, but we were informed that we can only visit the house at the pre-delivery inspection. We were also informed during our walkthrough that changes to the insulation and plywood would be made that day, but when we visited the exterior of the house 4 weeks later, the changes had not been made and siding was already starting to go up. We don't know if these problems were ever resolved.
There should be another walk through after framing, to ensure finishes being installed are what was selected. The cost of upgrades seemed high, with relation to the base purchase price of the home.

In the design center, as a builder showing the Standard items to the buyer is your responsibility.
Most of the time we only saw the pictures or alike pictures.
For example: plumbing fixtures & faucets, showers, tubs, Fire Place, Lighthing fixtures.
Not seeing the standard items; made us frustrated during the upgrading process.
Very nice people
Everything is an upgrade which is very disappointing.
More time at the design center. More time between the meetings and perhaps an additional meeting.

IMPORTANT: Basement is cracked (gap is widening and extending larger)and no mitigation measures were taken despite personal and written requests.
Quality of wood used in framing is substandard;
General workmanship during frame construction is very poor. wood frames (vertical sections, and trusses were broken/damaged at places throughout the house)
Design center activities need to be improved especially pricing of upgrades in kitchen. More clarity in providing upgrading details along with the pricing (itemized costing) thereof is required. 
design center activities need to be made relaxing less pushing.
I would prefer dealing with the same person throughout the whole process rather than having to deal with several different people
I actually do not have anything that I would change.  Both processes went effortlessly.  Very streamlined.

The electrical,cabinet and other upgrades should be coordinated by one single entity rather than three different ones. That reduces communication error.

The upgrade cost should reflect the market value more rather than being inflated.

The designer sold me a shower door that ultimately did not fit the shower stall that was the only option I was given.  It seems to me that the design centre should know what they are offering.  In the end I was given a very short amount of time to change the shower choices and I felt very pressured.  Now I am regretting the last choice that I made, which of course ended up costing me more money even though it was the fault of the design centre.  When I spoke with the site inspector when I did my framing inspection about this issue he said that he has told them a number of times not to offer the maxx kleara door with this particular shower stall because it does not fit but the design centre continues to do it.  

I am more than a little annoyed that I have to pay for their mistake - it would seem to me that they should own up to it and offer me the changes without any added cost to me.
We can only comment about the sales process as the house was already built.  It was great.  Deb Durie is really knowledgeable and easy to ask questions to.  We are looking forward to the next steps.

During the design process, my husband and I had a number of questions around custom items (e.g. rounded corner beads, mosiac tiles, etc) that were brought forwarded very early on in our discussions with the Designer.  We were very disappointed that the final costing figures were not provided until the day before our final sign off as we were forced to make last minute decisions to accommodate the Design Center as opposed to our vision for our home.

I believe that this was an isolated incident; however, I would hope that other Buyers are given at least 48 hours to review their final costs.

The blue prints should be in the same orientation of the house.  The one we got was a mirror image.  More options for colours, exterior colours, more options for electrical.  Standards are limited. Or let us to bring own
Turn around time to fix items on PDI is too long.
Nothing
Everything is perfect.

The sales process was perfect. The design process should be more hands-on, where the design coordinator spends time with the client looking at options rather than "look at all of the samples, write down anything you like and we will send you pricing." A true design process should involve understanding the clients "style" or desired outcome and helping then find options. In the end we did get this but it actually came from the sales person who used some free time to do selections with us and in 2 hours she helped us selected the entire home! We were very thankful for Jacqui's help.
to be allotted more time with a rep from the design center.
Nothing and thank you for everything.

- plan review and walk-through available before/after work day hours, or on a weekend
- complete set of granite samples available in showroom
- tile samples separated: standard vs. upgrade, wall/floor vs. backsplash
Voice messages I left were not returned.
NA

Design Center was great!

Not happy with the builder,  have owned 3 NEW build homes in the pass and this has been the worse builder to-date.   Many issues,  walls not painted, can see drywall squares on ceiling and walls,   shower makes a VERY scary noise that has been videoed by your reps (drywall needs to be removed in order to fix),  hardwood floors make ALOT of noise (can hear every step when on the first floor),  paid $7500 to upgrade wood stairs - horrible job,  construction not great at all.   A lot of issues that was noted on pre-inspection and not completed after moving in,  was advised by the inspector to not add items not completed on the pre-inspection items on the move-in sh

NOTE to Head Office:  Please call to discuss disappointment.

Very disappointed when walked into the house,  a lot of broken items,  staircase was not stained,  house was not cleaned, windows are dirty,  no remote for garage (still waiting),  wrong tiled on fireplace (hasn't been fixed),  More the 49 issues PDI.  No major items have been fixed.

Experiencing  issues with bbq gas,  hired third party to inspect gas BBQ pipe and it is not properly installed,  was informed that if the problem is not fix the gas contractor will have to put a quick release on the gas as it is  not by code.   Builder was informed,  the builder inspector said  the certified  gas person we hired was incorrect and didn't know what he was talking about. 

Builder inspect refused to document gas issue on PDI along with other items.   Not happy with the builder and would like issues fixed.

Nothing.  If anything I would have preferred to have feedback about deficiencies that were pointed out during the frame stage walk through.  I would have appreciated if someone took a couple pictures to show that those items were fixed.
nothing

We would have preferred to have been able to add a gas fireplace in the basement rec room as well as a number of pot-lights in the kitchen/dining room area, but because the framing and dry-wall had already been completed prior to our purchase we were unable to do this. More time and appointments are needed to make design choices, the design consultant should go through every inch and spec of the house, detailed spec sheet with all standard specs needed, detailed measurements needed

I had the most trouble with was understanding when we had to tell them where to put plug outlets,etc.  It was like they skipped that whole part of it.

The sales center team has been great from the very beginning.

Wonderful experience. Love our Bradbury, now just waiting to move in. Thank you!!!!

To help client. Hopefully this survey will help with Tamarack refunding money for my flat tire that I got at sales office because of a nail. I emailed the President and then I heard from Debbie that they would replace my 1 tire. During the frame check I asked the representative to replace broken frame on second floor. Nothing, staff is friendly, hours of operations are great for people who work during the day, lot of choices, and Muskoka staff is also great.

They provide nice quality homes and the design is well applied.  It is appealing and the finishing is good.  The R value is good.  The outside substrata was Styrofoam.  I was expecting it to be wood and was a bit surprised.

Everything was wonderful. I wouldn’t change anything.
I found both ladies extremely helpful. Kim is a joy to work with and so helpful and Noella was always kind and considerate of my needs.
I wish there were more sink and faucet upgrade options  available and also wish you had more trending and modern tile upgrades at the design center so i didnt habe to go source them myself

Sale and design centre was fine. It was everything else and higher management.

Nothing, it was quite relaxed and easy. Jacqui and Carolyn were knowledgeable and extremely helpful!

Nothing. 

My only real complaint is having to deal with Concept Home Theatre separately, especially since their hours are extraordinarily inconvenient.

I would like to have more information about my house standard. We purchased a townhouse from Tamarack 2.5 years ago so we assume everything should keep the same as the standard. However when we are having the Frame inspection we found the door side window changed, the ensuite tub changed(pretty small compare to the townhouse), the basement window changed. Those are all different from our townhome and we are not aware about it. I would suggest Tamarack to provide more details for the standard feature (include picture will be better).

Also, the kitchen drawings in the design center need to be update. We found the lights over breakfast island location are much less than the drawing and could not moved.

One thing I want to mention is the price for the upgrade. I think the price for the ceramic tile is ridiculous and there is no way to show us how the price has been calculated. The two tiles have the same price for the entry but $1000 different for the bathroom. Exactly the same size/style. I don't understand how could they get such difference and no one explains anything.

Our experience with Deb and Mike at the sales centre was extremely positive. They are so knowledgeable. We were very impressed with them.
Mandy Mason is incredible! She worked very hard to help us make our decisions in the short time we had. We really liked the way Mandy pulled things together; her great ideas really helped us. Every time we went in to the design centre, she had everything laid out ready for us. She has lots of patience and a lovely sense of humour which she uses very well. She is a well organized young lady. We are confident that all of our choices will be perfect for our new home because of Mandy's input. She is a treasure!
The add ons are over priced, and the idea of everything is an add on. Also the standard is very cheap quality for the price we are paying for; towards the house.
to make sure whatever they do in the model home, make sure there's a sign that says upgrade. Ending paying the upgrades and finishing upgrades, let people know in the model.

I don't think I would change anything... I had just received a promotion in a new department and going through a separation so my schedule was not as flexible but everyone I had the pleasure of dealing with were very nice, helpful, answered my questions and were flexible. Big thank yous to Noëlla Francoeur, Joy Kerr, Sarah Taggart and Amanda Batten. Oh and now I feel terrible because I do not remember the name of the person who was there during the frame inspection.  Vic... very helpful. Took the time to show me everything. Super nice guy! Thank you. When I see the bus advertising "Tamarack: Upgrade your life", that's actually how I feel. Thanks!

Closing date of construction was moved behind by one month. When originally purchasing the sales person told us the house could possibly be ready one month early, which prompted us to buy. Concern about where there should place there hydro counters, us it was wrongfully architect, this is causing us some grieve, it should have been on the other side of the complex, us our front door is on the side. clearer documentation of what is included vs not. Or more communication on what is possible. i understand you don't want to do "custom" but some wiggle room may benefit everyone!

not being able to choose an interior colour (the limited off white palette was frustrating)will create additional expense for me after possession.

Not having the ability to select my own lighting fixtures will generate additional expense. Surely Tamarack could have a supplier arrangement with a company to allow some choice!
very good experience, mandy was excellent, patient, adn gave me lots of options.

1.)  The Standard range hood fan is white.  For the money paid for the home this should be an option of white or stainless steel.

Complete clarity on pricing. When changes have been made ( by the purchaser) new prices need to be clear. There were too many surprises. Price for the upgrade cabinet and countertops could be transparent just like the contractors did. I have no idea where my money spend to so far for the upgrade cabinets and countertops. They give me a total price and refuse to give me any detail. Something like the material cost and labor cost, cost for per unit should be offered to customers in my mind. 

My family and I have bought 3 houses from tamarack and referred 1 friend to buy tamarack home in half a year. This is the third home I bought from tamarack in half a year and I would like to do the exact same upgrade I the kitchen. However, the upgrade price increased more than 20% in total. For some of them, like soft close hinge, price increased more than 100%. It is crazy big jump in half a year! I feel be cheated when I see the upgrade price list. This time is the worst buying expierence I have so far. I don’t want to refer tamarack to my friends now.

Front level staff are great but head office staff are not very friendly nor return calls or emails when questions are posed. Worse, they delayed the move in date for our home by stating that we did not submit our design requests on time. We very readily demonstrated this claim was untrue and found out that the head office was slow in providing quotes to design staff. Still, our forms were readily handed in on time. 

We would appreciate more honesty going forward.

We have some negative feelings regarding our sales experience.
Our story...

We walked into to the Tamarak (half moon bay) sales centre on a Monday and learned about lots 91 and 92 Abieti Ridge. At that time no sales associate informed us that it was possible to put a deposit down to reserve a lot. On the Wednesday, we were so excited to call and say we would like lot 91. At that time we were told another couple had put a deposit on lot 91 the night before. As we were not aware you could put a deposit down, we were very disappointed. Although we were uncertain and did not 'love' neighboring lot 92, we decided to going ahead with it.
About a month later we received a call letting us know that, for whatever reason, lot 91 was now available.  The sales associate offered to terminate our contract for lot 92 if we wanted (the more expensive) lot 91. The only catch was it would cost us thousands of dollars more than it would of, when we were initially interested in it,  around one month earlier. Furthermore, the sales team could not give us any reasonable rationale why Tamarak would not honour the lesser price. Our desire for lot 91 overroad our dislike of the convenient price increase, and we signed the papers for lot 91.

When we signed for lot 91, we did not (and still do not) understand why Tamarak would not honour the price lot 91 was when we signed for lot 92. 

Although we are very excited about our new Tamarak home, we have these negative memories regarding our sales experience.
Could not say more positive things about Mandy Mason at the design centre. She was professional yet easy going and made the experience hassle free and actually enjoyable.
Nothing so far
Make the closing date a clearer issues and

There are lot
- We can't choose our own upgrades most of them we have to go with the builder...even though we don't like some of the features that builder provided.
- We are not allowed to do minor changes
- All upgrades are expensive comparing to other builders
- The hardwood which builder gives (basic) doesn't have much option, for sure everyone should upgrade.
-Design Center timings are not convenient.
- We have to pay if we need to add anything to home, but when we remove we are not credited. for ex: we removed a full window and we didn't get credit and just to add a curtain rod we have to pay $70.
Provide more information to the client! Allow more time to the client for upgrades selections & during the walk-in process.

Structural changes should be minimized,however it gives customer the most satisfaction?Considering it involves personal preference,building code and budget. It can be more efficient by having a meeting with designer/estimator directly.

Design center rep need more knowledge about the products and cost.
Make sure that the sales centre provides the correct closing date to the clients before they put a hold on a property. Nothing to say otherwise, everything else went smoothly.
As a second home buyer with Tamarack, I am very satisfied with the services and would highly recommend them to my friends and family.

1. We did not have a blueprint meeting (hence my responses to that question).

2. I would start the design center appointments earlier, the 45 day deadline is very stressful when doing a large number of upgrades. 60 days would give more room to decide and get quotes from suppliers.

3. I would have liked to have been more informed about the possible upgrades available at the structural level. For example I did not know we could change our exterior to use stone instead of brick.  The catalog of options should be expanded.
More time (appointments) to make selections.

Very happy with every one from Tamarack. Great service and great designs equals one happy customer. Not everything went according to plan, but nothing dose. Tamarack's staff were eager to solve any problems that came alone. Sales and design staff were not pushy and did not try to sell me something I didn't want or need. Can hardly wait to get into my new home!

Questions 2 to 4 cannot be answered as our home was already built when we purchased it.  It was new and had not been lived in.  The person that had the home built did not become a resident here.  Therefore, the colours, design features, etc. were already in place when we purchased it from Tamarack.

- There should be more options available to allow the purchaser to economize when it's convenient for all parties.  For example, choosing flat (smooth) ceiling for one floor only should be an option.  Someone is already making the kitchen and bathrooms sm

We had a really difficult time with the initial sales person, Tera. She is no longer with Tamarack though. We felt that she answered our questions incorrectly, never followed up on anything, was always weeks late with responses and flat out lied to us that certain things were included or standard that weren't. Additionally, three things that we asked her to document were still incorrect when we did the walk through. Everyone else was more than helpful, including Carolyn, Jackie and Mike. It would be nice if there was a more clear timeline or schedule of all of the different meetings, what their purposes are and what we should be looking for at those meetings.

It was quite confusing at design center initially since there is not much samples you can see and choose, it would be preferable to have more samples in the design center to aid the selection process.
n/a

There were a few miscommunications early on and getting concrete answers proved to be a challenge at times. Otherwise, I would say that we have been happy in our dealings with Tamarack homes to date and are looking forward to our new home.
Having clearer info about prices that we could take home rather than making decisions without knowing costs upfront.  We had to change our minds about a few things.
The only real negative was that we are not local and purchasing while out of province.
to have knowledge able design centre staff, keep examples of color coordination, layout etc. for homes
The design centre process is broken.

I would suggest that the design centre hours be expanded. I found the process of scheduling appointments to be difficult, as the center is only open from 9am-5pm on most weekdays. Hours such as 1-9pm would work better for those people who work at 9am-5pm jobs.
Pricing consistency of the upgrades from purchase of home to Design Centre appointments.

My purchase was of a pre-designed house with no room for mods.

We have inquired about stones a long time ago and we have been  have been misinformed that this was no option. Our next door neighbour (lot 3 in HMB) who reserved his lot after we did told us that he was offered stones because he did not like any of the offered bricks!
 All the respect to my neighbour; I believe we should have been offered the same. while I remember asking about the cost of this upgrade of stones and the answer was that Tamarack does not offer stones as an option. We have asked again on July 30, the possibility to upgrade to stones and we haven't received a reply.
About the design center, Kim is excellent, she has done an unbelievable job, very through, knows what she is doing, very friendly, gave enough time to choose and helped us a lot in our choices.

That all the other merchants had to be visited seperately and there was very little communication between them and Tamarack. For example, when we chose the silgranite sink from Boone we could not match the colour to the rest of the kitchen because it was in two different locations.

Would like to keep our comments confidential and NOT forwarded to Noella please:   Noella was good up to closing of the home sale however,  was not accommodating when scheduling Electrical walk-through.  Her emails where very unpleasant when advised that we couldn't attend the scheduled Electrical walk-through and not accommodating with offering alternative dates.  We would recommend our friends/family to Tamarack but not to Noella. 
Paul (Electrical contact for walkthrough) was AMAZING,  answered all question and was very pleasant to work with. 

We would like to discuss our comments and  open to discuss with someone higher.  Phone call is welcomed.

I found that we had to do a lot of driving around to the various places to pick out different things for our new home and it seemed like the people we were dealing with had no contact with the tamarack design centre and therefore were not clear on a few things we requested.  It would be nice to simplify this by having the choices for the fireplaces, plumbing, etc., closer together as to make travelling easier for the homebuyer.  Also, it would be helpful if the people at the locations had more contact with one another.  We would often be told one thing by someone, and then another by someone else.  This was confusing to us.  We were also unable to meet with the person taking care of the choices for the fireplaces, he was too busy for us and did not return our calls.

At the design centre, different levels of prices should be more evident for exemple the stickers were not on all tiles. We found that there were hidden cost for exemple, the design of the cabinet to accomodate puck lights were expensive.

desiger at the Woodhaven she has to be more patrent when we wants to change some ideas,  few friends of me at east end were remind me few times check the agreement cos the designer will made mistakes, which she did made some.
more accommodating hours at the design center; the design center was too busy and no appointments were available.

Initially, I was placed with a new sales associate.  She later quit, so I was switched to another associate.  I found that there was quite a difference in information and recommendations made by the more experienced associate.  Purchasing a home, especially my first home, is obviously quite an undertaking and I would have appreciated being placed with someone with more expertise from the beginning.  This switch also created confusion with some of the upgrades that I had wanted resulting in selections I had discussed with the first person not being transferred over.  This was obviously frustrating, so I would have changed that about my experience.

Three meetings are hardly enough to pick up the selections.
Design center is too far from Jackson Trails.
Choices are limited. Prices not marked. You need to select first and then cost is calculated. By that time you are left with no time to change.

I'll prefer to have the plan including the whole lot, the driveway, backyard and frontyard measurements (may be on a standard lot). It will give a much better idea and can be visulaized how the house will look on a premium lot.
If I was the boss, I will promote Kim but fire Ewa(from muskuka). the rate i gave in design process :1 is for Ewa (the worst) and 10 is for Kim (the best).

"Everything went great. I purchased the home right at the deadline to make upgrades and so electrical etc had to be changed.  During the preinspection I am only concerned as to the amount of holes needed to be cut through new drywall to make so many changes throughout house to accomodate my upgrades (ie gas lines, cable and electrical add ons).  I'm not sure but I would assume almost all your buyers have upgrades so if I could change one thing it would have been to wait for a purchaser before going ahead with standards features etc.  There were too many changes to be made after standard feautures had already been finished. 
 As for sales and design centre staff... You do have a great team and they were always welcoming and knowledgeable and great to work with."
felt rushed

While sitting in the sales and décor center,  there should be informative videos while the reps are on the phone or helping others. Both the décor center and sale center need more education on what standard and what is offered as upgrades.  We spend a lot time waiting for the reps to find out answer while on the phone.  The reps should be able to answer most questions right away. 
A lot of wasted time.   
They need to be education on selection and construction.

I think the worst thing for me is that when I went to the sales office I was told that the there was only one lot left and the next phase was going to be town homes and if I wanted to buy I need to buy that lot.  (which would not have been my option since it has a hydrant and utilities) I had explained very carefully to Deb that a large backyard was very important to me and my family.  You cannot image how devastated I was to see single homes with huge backyards become available less than 3 months after I bought.  It will forever taint how I feel about this home.  I have started thinking of moving out before I moved in and the associated cost of buying an Oxford with a larger lot.  As well, I was very very sad and still am that I did not get my smooth ceilings.  It was the one thing that I really wanted and I mentioned it first to Deb at the sales center and she wrote DC beside my wish list for certain items but it was so long between purchase (april) to going to the design center (october) that I thought I had already taken care of the smooth ceiling so I was really unhappy when I saw the stiple ceiling.  It is an overwhelming process and I wish someone would have taken my wish list and forwarded it to the design center.  it was confusing doing somethings with deb and others at the design center.  Another thing was that the stairs were not fully explained to me.  I thought the quote for the post was the one newel post for (2400$) not realizing it was for all of the posts, had I known that I would have upgraded.  I found Deb super nice till I bought then when I went in after I found out about the larger lots she was not so nice. This was supposed to be the house of my dreams, we were never going to move again.  But knowing that I could have had the backyard I wanted with Tamarack is painful.  Bittersweet.
More options
nothing.  it was excellent..
Nothing
Allow for changes to be made after the last design center meeting - perhaps charge 150 as other builders do

Design center team being just as enthusiastic as Jacqui. She was the reason we bought a Tamarack home. Jacqui's presentation to us sold us the first visit. Understanding that this is sometimes a first building a home, many people arent sure what to expect or don't know what others often choose for upgrades, changes etc. 
Overall your team is amazing. You do a great job and I have sent referrals your way!
Nothing.  It was all good.
waiting in line to purchase the Lot#
Nothing!  I was absolutely thrilled with the knowledge and level of service I received from the sales office and the design centre process!

Information at sales center was misleading. "Bonus" offer was turned and construed to make it appear as though the buyers were getting something additional for signing early whereas it was part of the standard features all along. It made the company appear dishonest.

Sales process was smooth and Marg was very friendly and helpful every time we visited her, always welcoming us with a smile. We didn't have the full 45 days for the design process, as it's my perception that Tamarack didn't handle properly the post-sales service. We had to proactively visit the design center 3 months after purchasing the home to inquire about when they will contact us for our appointments. It seems that we were contacted the week after only because we raised a flag about the short timeframe for our design process. Then, when we started with the design process we had less than 45 days to complete it, and we felt the rush to provide all the information and decide on things on a shorter timeframe, due to a lack of planning.

Our meeting at Concept wasn't a good one, not too much explanation on the things that we had to decide and what comes standard with the house. Also, no chance to change almost anything as most of the electrical wiring had already been done in the house, as per the Concept advisor, which didn't seem to be true when we visited the house for the first time. Also, no chance add a conduit to run cables through the wall in the living room area, instead they wanted to charge us per each HDMI cable that was required, which does not make much sense to me, but unfortunately due to the lack of options we had to accept. We will probably have to install a conduit ourselves when the time comes, if possible at all.

Ewa from Muskoka Cabinetry was very helpful in explaining our optional upgrades and assisting us through the process, however due to the lack of proper planning for our Design phase, we also felt the rush from her side to provide appliance models in less time than what was initially agreed on.

Morgan from the Design Center did a wonderful job and had a lot of patience explaining some of the options available for our home. I still feel that some questions were left unanswered, but we guess we will deal with those things after moving into the new house.

We were told that a Project Manager from Tamarack was assigned to follow up with us during the design process and solve any questions we may have. We only received a template congratulation letter in the mail after purchasing the house, and that was the last time we heard from the Project Manager at all. We are not complaining at all, but we expected more interaction if someone is assigned for this purpose, especially being first time buyers.

When we visited the house, some TV cable outlets weren't even installed yet, so we weren't able to confirm if we are getting everything that was agreed on. We also noticed that some of the electrical installations were recently performed (and still not completed) so it doesn't make sense that Concept didn't allow us to make any modifications to the original blueprint. A couple of potlights, which we were particularly very curious to see if they were correctly placed, weren't even installed on the day of our visit. We did receive protective gear (helmets), but not boots or glasses as stated in the survey, just wanted to mention why we placed a low score on that question. And by the way, the person who joined us from Tamarack for that visit, he did a wonderful job showing us around and explaining what we were seeing, he made sure we enjoyed our visit.

I hope these comments help on improving the experience for other first time buyers, small things that can make a huge difference.
The samples were small. There should be a computer programme that allows you to see your selection in a virtual environment.

Nothing comes to mind in terms of suggestions for improvement. The initial list of upgrade options was appreciated and necessary for (pre) planning purposes, but the way in which it is formatted is somewhat confusing until the first design centre meeting.
Nothing at all, everything went smoothly.
I do not like the sales after I signed the contract. When I talk to them, it seems like I am idiotically. Anyway, it is very difficult to communicate with them.
Noella was absolutely fantastic
I would reduce the rate of the house.

Appliances to include with the house; OR increased design centre bonus to get appliances.

Great selection of standard options and availability.
Design centre experience was great.
Sales centre rep was very experienced and assisted with the purchase.

I really enjoyed going through the entire sales and design centre process, and definitely look forward to another Tamarack home!

The only thing that I'd like changed would be the addition of a timeline chart of the entire process (signing of initial agreement to closing day (and beyond). I understand that the "Playbook" outlines all these steps, but a chart would have been helpful for a visual learner like myself.

Thanks Tamarack!
Nothing

Unfortunately I was out of town due to death in the family when the sales office contacted me for the construction visit. I would had liked to do the inspection myself but was told that they couldn't wait the 3 days I was still going to be absent so the representative did it for me and assured me that everything noted on the contract had been verified and or modified. When returning to town a few days later, I was allowed to visit the interior of my house but the insulation and gypboard were already completed therefore could not verify certain options such as the reinforments for certain lights and placements of studs where I had a plug and conduit added in the kitchen for hanging a television. I did notice a few things that still have to be checked out such as the electrical boxes for the bathroom lights to be added and capped and telephone/cable outlet to be verified if there are going to be 2 of them in a certain room of if they forgot to add the 2nd outlet. Under these circumstances, it would had been nice to put off the visit a few days but understand the essence of time. I greatly appreciated the extra time and effort it took the sales representative to verify things for me and taking the time to call me to reassure me about this major step.
Nothing. Debbie @ Sales & Kim @ Design Center were absolutely amazing. So was the whole Tamarack home buying process.
I had some difficulty about being told 'yes we can' and signing to purchase...but only later to find out 'no we cant'

Sales: have the colour scheme boards available with accurate numbers before assigning to new buildings.  INCLUDE door colour on the boards.  We feel the door colour is not reflective of professional designers and makes a tasteful building look tacky and cheap. 

Design Centre: Ensure accuracy of the selections and they are recorded correctly.  Focus more on customer service.  We felt valued as customers at the sales centre but not so much at the design centre.  Want to highlight we did receive excellent customer service from Eliza and she should be recognised for this!

We would like to have more time with our design consultant. We realize that we were free to browse on own our time; however, our design consultant was so much more knowledgeable about your selection and what worked best together than we were. It would have been wonderful to have more time to use her expertise.
Make the staff be more pleasant.  The sales person.

Design Centre Process - we need more time! It's a bit overwhelming to make all of the selections in 3 meetings, especially when the initial one is more of a guided tour of the design centre.

Otherwise, loved the choices and available support!
Friendly and professional service.  Highly recommended!

Some things that I liked about Tamarack were also those that I disliked for different reasons. 

For example, the design process is very streamlined and quick. On the other hand, having such a strict approach to these appointments (offering 3 appointments), likely helps Tamarack to stay on track with their closing dates and avoids other hassles.   Thankfully we had a good idea of what we were looking for and prepared a lot outside of the three appointments. . If I could change something I think it would be that design appointments have some flex, depending on the amount of upgrades being done to the home. 

One other change I would consider making is a bit more ease to reach a design rep/centre via telephone. Some conversations are much easily expressed via phone as opposed to email but it seemed that phone lines were not answered.  If we left a message, this would be returned via email. 


All in all, we're very happy with the end result of our design choices and hope that these translate properly to the house.
open on fridays
Have an office on the west side of Ottawa to do upgrades and not have son May meetings

Nothing to this point.

Note:  Bought a house already built.  No selection or construction walk through.

A better way to check and ensure that all selections made at the design centre were correct. The purchaser having more details and matching of item numbers with the sign-off sheet.  Our only issue with this entire process were the interior doors that my family, all of three of us, feel are the wrong doors that have been installed in our home.   The people who work for Tamarack are all amazing people, the most helpful and truly lovely people to deal with.  We received several calls to deal with the situation but at this time, we have family issue back home six hours away and can't deal with this now.  We don't want to fight with anyone.
N/A

They did not give us enough options for the colors of the house. I did not know I had to pay extra if I chose a different color in a room.   The sales lady did not tell me about extra cost only after I signed and paid.

Sales process was unorganized when it came time for the lot release, I was one of many who slept outside experienced the chaos on the release date...   One or two more appointments with the designer would have been beneficial.  The length of time to complete the design process was too short and the time to receive pricing was too long.  I also wish Tamarack would consider some exceptions past the cut off time. Also, this day and age people mount their TV's above the firecplace, I was surprised during the frame walk through thatTamarack doesn't account for this with the addition of a few extra 2x4's for wall mounts, this should be standard, I am still waiting to find out if this was added to our home after notifying our sales rep.  All in all the experience was good, we look forward to moving in to our new home !

The only thing I can recommend is to have better communication and knowledge between sale, design center and Contractor. Just to make it easier when there are questions that there are better knowledge as oppose to sending you somewhere else for an answer
interactive App that would show you how everything is going to look.
Very well organized, thoughtful and warm welcoming.
Perhaps a little more time to choose

There is nothing wrong with the current process. If have to come up with new ideas, we would like to see a writing schedule for each steps after contract being signed. The schedule will tell us when we need to arrange the mortgage, each steps of working in design center, frame check etc..  That schedule will make whole process more transparent.  But the current process is working well.

That the workers are notified about what should and should not be removed according to the purchase and sales agreement of the buyer.  Lanscaping/shrubs and patio stones were removed at the front of my house that should have remained as per my sales agreement.  It was replaced with grass that I am not happy with.

1) Appointment Process: I do agree that 45 days are guidelines but it could be respected by providing second appointment within 30 days not after 40 days that what happen in my case, which would delay my closing date.
and that has cost you little extra on your interest payment.
2) Site Supervisor supposed to check the work of contractor against the design drawing.In my case, Contractor has installed the Fireplace according to sales drawing, which has resulted in rework of many people.

Thanks for considering my opinion.

Air conditioning I got caught at last minute during the frame check.  The design centre didn't tell us if we didn't take air conditioning right then that they would have to tear down one of the ceilings.  I had 48 hours to get the approval for air conditioning.  I had to pay out of pocket rather than put it on the mortgage.  It was a hassle.  In the upgrades I had to really check the billing on it due to many errors.  If I hadn't owned a home before my daughter would have been very overwhelmed.  I wasn't impressed with the design centre.  She was nice but she should know her job.  The sales people were good though
Design center we felt we were rushed. It seemed when the our appointment time was up we were rushed.
A computer program to show how the colors and designs chosen look all put together and access to it from home before the meeting.

I would not be so greedy in the markup applied at the design centre.

From crazy lot premiums, ceramic baseboards priced illogically (and when they responded their response had holes in t it and did not even have the courtesy to reply to my email pointing out their mis-calculation), to $240 for a shower light - home depot less than $100 - and it doesn't even include a switch, to Moen curtain rods marked up about 500%, etc....

I realize Tamarack is a track builder and they can do this b/c they 'can' and people will pay for it... they still need to realize that nobody forgets being gouged and they are already being paid quite well for the home itself.

Like I said... be LESS greedy and YOU will SELL MORE homes and the people who buy them from you will be much happier in the process and will make more referrals... otherwise its a short term vision and people will eventually get tired of being raked and will go elsewhere...
Be able to visit our unit once every week or two. To see how things are moving along.
I was not impressed with the way they installed the brick from outside there is a lots of cracks and dents!!

The hours at the sale centre should start earlier. Base options are inadequate. When I asked about the taxes on the upgrades I could not get a straight answer! Some of the upgrade prices were ridiculous. I wanted to upgrade to laminate in the basement since my husband has asthma and the price that was given was outrageous. And no credit was being given back for the carpet. It would be nice to be able to have an approximate final price of your house prior to purchasing it. I found that a lot of things “needed” to be upgraded and we ended up going over our budget.

There's not really anything that we would change, everyone was nice and everything went well.
But it was always really hard to schedule an apointment.
Apart from that everything was great.
NA

I would have appreciated the initial options that were available over and above elevation, lot, brick color etc. such as door styles etc. to be offered similiar to how options are presented at the design center.

Make the option catalogue more clear with regards to kitchen cabinets.  It was very misleading.  Other than that our experience was amazing. Mandy Mason at the design centre and Noella Francoeur of the sales centre were excellent and very impressive with their knowledge and customer service.

I had to deal with a few frustrations related to the design process.  I found that there were not enough choices for countertops with the colours I was choosing with cabinets, flooring, etc.  Nothing matched, and I ended up choosing things I will probably replace.  It would have been nice to be able to go to a company for more options, like we could for ceramic for example.

Also, after choosing my hardwood, I was told later that I could not have it anymore because the hardwood company had been changed for my house.  This ended up being very frustrating and ended up costing me more than 1000$ extra which was not planned because I could not find anything that matched my cabinets and other selections with the new floorings available with the new company.  I had to upgrade to get something similar to what I had originally chosen with the initial hardwoods.  

Other than that, things have been good so far.  I look forward to seeing the final product.

I was not being updated sooner about my house closing date. To this date I still have not received any response regarding this issue so I don’t know when the house can be closed and when I expect to have a frame walkthrough. Maybe it is better that someone can explain it to me.
Notification of items that are going to be discontinued

1) Clients should be better aware that structural changes cannot be made once the city has approved the plans.Clients should be more aware of what constitutes a structural change.

EXAMPLE :It was at this stage that we decided to have hardwood added to the stair step treads and have the risers and stringer painted white. 

We were told that this was a structural change because we were now changing the height of the riser. 

Even though the contractor had yet to start making the stairs we were told that this could not be done.Now we are stuck with something that will cost us about $8000.00 to change after construction. 

2) Roof vents should be upgraded by builder and standard in all homes. The plastic mushroom caps are poor quality and look low grade on these homes. Even Mattamy is using the better flute type vents.This comment has been made by several new owners that we have met .

Regards 
Mark

It is our second time building a new house, and overall we are satisfied, but the biggest take-away from our experience with Tamarack is that there isn't much flexibility.

- Having more flexibility when it comes to options such as lighting and handles would have been appreciated.  It would be nice if we could have chosen our own handles/lights and have had the builder install them. 

- Prices for upgrades are very expensive (i.e. garage door opener, under-cabinet lighting, etc.) and greatly discouraged us from choosing them.  Had the prices been reasonable, we likely would have purchased these items from you instead of from a third party.

- Having more flexibility when it comes to the closing date would have been nice.  When the house is built and waiting for the interior design, +/- a couple of days should not be the end of the world when the closing date is three months away. (Our last builder did all the interior in three weeks!)

- Throughout the buying process, Tera was amazing, very helpful, and always available.  She gave us a lot of ideas, information, personal experience which helped us in our decisions.

- The staff in general was knowledgeable and nice.

"It would have been useful to have had more time with the design consultant.

Also, our home has been sitting at a much advanced phase of construction than the home next to us however, they have an earlier closing date.  We were under the impression that changing our closing date should not be a problem but were later told that you 'do not change closing dates'.  As a result of our military relocation, we will be homeless (seemingly unnecessarily) for 6 weeks.  We are likely moving back to Kingston next summer but will likely reconsider buying building through Tamarack because of the lack of consideration and absence of a reasonable explanation."

There are a few things I want to comment.

(1) During the sale process in June 2018, one of the bonus your salesperson highlighted was a 6-month free Internet + TV package which is worth around $1000. This was printed black and white in my contract. However, now July 2019, I found out Cogeco no longer has this deal. In between, I was not informed about this change by Tamarack Homes. Anyway, I think this promotion is very misleading, which led to my disappointment.

(2) During the sale process, there was no mention that Tamarack Homes won't install eavestroughs. It's also not an option for a upgrade. I mean I put my trust in a professional builder like Tamarack, at least let me know in advance. I found out about the missing eavestroughs during a raining day when I visited the site and I saw large amount of water dripping from the roof right above my garage door. This is another not-so-pleasant surprise. As a buyer, I want transparency. Salespersons should not just focus on what the builder will build, but also what the builder won't build. 

(3) There are a few things lost during the communications, such as a missing laundry tub in the basement, a wrong sink was removed in a bathroom. These errors were quickly corrected. I just thought if there were better communications between your sales persons and site stuff, a lot of errors could be avoided. In turn, it will make both your staff and my whole home purchasing experience less stressful. Anyway, I want to say there is room for improvement.     

(4) Finally, the design of this survey. The term "Frame Check Walk-Through" is being used in the survey. What I had was a "Mechanical  Walk-Through". I figured out the two terms are probably refer to the same activity. However, it can cause some confusions to non-professionals like myself.

More sales representatives available to help at design centre.
New standard choices that are more "up to date"
New design centre location as the building is falling apart and was leaking on us during our visits.
On time construction.

More visual selections, especially for the Kitchen. Perhaps a photo album.  Show the stain samples on all the wood choices, i.e. show chocolate stain on maple, oak, cherry etc.
Perhaps have a person dedicated to only the kitchen process, with auto cad etc.
When we came in for our interiors we were booked for only one hour and we were expected to select the kitchen too, our manual said that we should get three hours?
Overall we felt very rushed.  It's a very big ticket purchase, so we expected a higher level of customer service, and we noticed as the moved farther along in the process, custom service dewindled
I don't think I would change anything.

Yes, there is a false sense of value for quotations received through the design centre. Clearly Tamarack is overcharging for even the simplest upgrade. Phone call to the President (Chris) was not even returned when he personally said he would be responsive to his clients. Very disappointed in the design center as a whole. Always changes appointments and making it difficult to see a representative during the evening. We did find Muskoka to be exceptional in contrast. With this design centre experience we would not recommend Tamarack to anyone who wishes to do any upgrades or spend good money on overpriced upgrades. Better to either not buy Tamarack or line up a bunch of contractors to do the jobs after you move in. This message should be a wake up call to the executive.
Design center should have someone on the weekend to help it out if needed
sales, design and construction should be connect each other more tighly so that we could reach any of them to address any issues related to structure, design or contruction.

More time to review choices made at the Design Centre stage. We always felt rushed at every meeting we had. We were forced to make deicisions very quickly and in a hurry.
Better information on how to deal with the different suppliers for upgrades. 
Starting this process earlier to avoid delay in construction. Our construction was on hold for 2 months whille completing this process.
Valarie, Darlene everyone got it, all good.

The process of waiting for quotes from the supplier tended to take a while and we felt a little rushed with our final decisions based on the delay of these responses.  While we understand that it is difficult to get a price list with all potential upgrades, it may have helped expedite the process.  As a result, having a list of price ranges (with available choices within those ranges) would have been beneficial.  Overall, however, the experience was terrific!

Reasonable changes should be allowed at different stages, ie, once structural  is signed off on, there is absolutely no way to revisit it- even very early in the process. They could also use a better system for tracking changes and updates so it isn't confusing to the buyer. I felt like I had to constantly go back to emails to make sure nothing was missed. Additional options added to kitchen plan as potential upgrades appears deceptive. We were told we would be able to inspect the wiring and framing at the frame check, but it was all drywalled up and we couldn't inspect anything inside the walls. We did have an issue with something being in the wrong place. Cable was supposed to be up on the wall but it was down on the floor. We have an outlet where it was supposed to be, but the cable wasn't. We asked about it and how we could handle it, but we haven't had any response from two messages, and when I tracked someone down they agreed that they remember our conversation and said they would get back to me. Our granite was supposed to be inspected, but it never was. We have 6 contacts and they chose to only call our home number while we weren't home, so they went ahead and cut the granite without our inspection. We were concerned about it as it's a big expense and we didn't get a chance to take a look. This is our third house we've built, and of the three this is our most expensive house, and we are the least satisfied with it.

Kingston Woodhaven - the design centre does not have good lighting in the room with the samples so if the room is not flooded with sunlight it is challenging to view some samples to appreciate the colours and how they match with other samples.

Nothing to change, 
The team is great

We were shocked that in 2016, the sales/design/upgrade process still relied on mountains of paperwork and selecting options through a catalogue. It was a confusing and frustrating experience. I would recommend investing in software. In this day and age, a buyer should be able to visually see a potential home and select/view any proposed options through 3D renderings on a computer. It's amazing the process hasn't changed!

Both processes were great, but we found there was sometimes a lack of consistent messaging regarding timelines depending on who we spoke to. Our sales rep would indicate one timeline, which would be contradicted by our design centre consultant.

As per completed questionnaire: Nothing: You have excellent team very knowlegable, curtious best company known by the people its keep. For us best builder in town.

the time taken between purchasing and occupancy was long, particularly for someone who wants to occupy quickly.
We bought a charleston model and love it, just wish the furnace etc were set up different to create room for even a small spare bedroom
enlarge the garage to 20*20 from 18*20
So far this has been a great experience. We have not built before but from what I have heard and witnessed through friends Tamarack is a premier builder.

He saw his floor plan on paper but, there was no model home to walkthrough of the one he purchased.  He doesn't like the layout now that he is in it.  He would recommend having a model home for each type of home.
I would add more to the standard options you have! It is so limited and not in style! You get surprises with the amount of money you spend on upgrades!

Design Center - An online selection of samples you can view before visits, and later hours on weeknights. More pricing info for self serve, may save time with the consultant onsite, as one could evaluate options and compare costs.
The choosing went well but when it came to finalizing, we had questions and in order to get an answer we had to contact the supervisor and we were concerned  that we would not be signing in time

I wish I had more time to make decisions, looking back I already know something’s I would like to change which is frustrating.  I felt rushed.
