"All structural options should be offered and explained with a reminder of the dates following which changes cannot be made even though this is in the purchase and sale agreement. All changes to model homes (upgrades) should be noted specifically for each model in lieu of the general info sheets available in each home. More time should be allocated to the structural change deadline. 
Design centre experience is great but could use more time with the designer prior to finalizing choices. 
Still a superior product with excellent personnel in place to address any and all concerns. Very impressed with how personal it is despite the number of builds. Don't lose that!"

Design Centre Process - very rushed, felt like I was being a burden when I asked questions, not very good at giving suggestions, felt that design centre rep was just trying to get through process as fast as possible,in fact seamed frustrated at some points
No issues with the design centre process other than an issue with the person we originally met with at Muskoka for the kithcen design.  This issue was communicated to Tamarack and quickly resolved.
Absolutely nothing!!! Deborah and Chrustine wee just amazing to work with!!

Tamarack should not charge for minor changes and requests, grout colour changes, asking for additional plug points, reinforcement for a ceiling fan, a few extra pot lights. We also wanted to change the orientation for the garage to get more light right at the beginning and even though it could be done at that time, it was not considered. We felt that we were nickle and dimed for small things.
On a positive note, the staff and sales people and workers have been very friendly and helpful and willing to listen and answer our questions always. we always feel welcome in your Findlay Creek sales centre and the staff there is very cheerful, friendly and helpful.
Nothing at all.
Nothing!

ABOUT THE DESIGN CENTRE - TO GET THE PRICING ON TIME SO THAT WE COULD MAKE THE SELECTIONS PROPERLY. AND ALSO TO BE ABLE TO CHANGE COUPLE OF THINGS AFTER SIGNING THE DOCUMENTS AS THERE MIGHT BE SOME LAST MINUTE CHANGES WE ALL AS BUYERS WOULD LIKE TO DO AS 'HOMES ' ARE BIG AND FOR MOST OF US ONE TIME INVESTMENT (AND NOT LIKE CARS, OR OTHER COMMODITIES ) .
Don't nickel and dime over simple chages ie: hosebib location, it's already there, house hasn't been built yet, why charge to move it??
Design: they were pretty good, maybe not having a distinction (hardwood flooring, different selections of wood for diff. developers) found that strange.

They should respond to customers when they try to contact them. I went to the office five times, I called and emailed multiple times and no one answered. Also, they delayed the closing by one month and ten days. The Sales Director emailed me saying that I had not completed the design selections. This was not true, I had completed everything but I was just waiting for the papers from Tamarack so I could sign them. My wife is pregnant and now her due date is the same as the new closing date. Now I have a new baby coming and I have to move on the same day.

Design centre is about making choices on different colors and different materials for the home.    If they had pictures of how things look together not only samples what it will look like putting all those samples together the customer would benefit from this getting the whole picture.
I would not change a thing my experience so far as been very positive.
More clarity in upgrade costs leading up to the design centre process.
Design Centre very disorganized and extreme lack of attention to detail!  Poor communication (with exception of Chantal and Sheri!) follow-up very poor.

Jacqui was very knowledgeable and took care of MOST questions. She was great until we signed the contract and then it seemed that her portion was completed and we were now in the process.... She has taken questions and emails from us since then but she has the notion that Tamarack has been VERY accommodating in rectifying problems when the customer service has definitely been lacking. We have had small issues and concerns that arose, which WE had to notice, and we ere often pointed to the next person to have to deal with  (never really smooth process). Carolyn at the design process was often not easily reached, not knowledgeable about cost and upgrades, made us feel silly for asking questions where we required assistance. There was an issues with what is available for viewing in the model home (which sold us on the specific house) and apparently was changed over the years. None of this was explained to us and were going to be charged to make OUR design like the model home. Eventually worked out but with us arguing and catching a lot of the issues ourselves. On to the walk through...I only contacted Pierre when I was told too, and he was often very unpleasant and unaccommodating. When I asked for some possible accommodations he was very cold and blunt regarding problems we had with the 9-2pm 'office hours' and his response of that's Tamaracks rules. We understand the rules that are set but the communication to a customer was poor customer service. Overall, I think Tamarack houses are incredible in terms of quality (but we are paying for it), but the building process, I do not recommend to friends. We were told from others some members (facets) of the Kingston staff were difficult to deal with, but wanted to build our own home. We were told it would be fun and exciting. We are excited to see the finished product but due to our own attentiveness to detail and questioning things as first time builders, have caught a lot of simple errors and mistakes. We feel that this is not 'our' job to have to catch these errors and that makes us not overall pleased or comfortable with this whole process. I find this all amazing because we are definitely not picky people and could not imagine how someone would react if they were dealing with some of the customer service issues we have had. I am sorry for laying this all out in a 'survey' but feel like it needed to be said. Again, we are very excited to get our finished home and know that Tamarack has an excellent reputation for their builds, however, we just wish this 'building' process didn't sour some of the experience. Thanks for reading and have a great day.
Include a graphic design of the house after you choose the upgrades to make the experience better and give better prospective of how the house will look.

I would have the design catalogue be representative of the upgrade options that are available in a particular model. Our catalogue listed several upgrades that we wanted that were apparently not available to us. Also there was a disconnect between sales and the design centre on when some upgrades had to be selected (tiled shower base) and in the end we were not able to get the particular upgrade. We were also given misinformation on one of our upgrades which caused a delay in the design process and significant frustration on our end.

Say what you do and do what you say. If the company really care about the quality and its customers' opinions, the best way is to visit the people who are living in the houses built by Tamarack. This kind of feedback may just be an red tape and will not make any difference to what the company is doing and will be doing.

A follow up of the changes/remarks made during the framing walk through.
Have the lists of upgrades at the time of sale as it could impact budget/model selection.
Nothing really, all were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.
Give us more time to think about design center upgrades and get more info

Everyone I met was professional and genuinely helpful.  I like that the Tamarack build is smaller/more community focused over other new developments.  I really enjoy nature trails and like that there is also going to be public access to the creek with pathways as part of a larger community building vision.
At the sales office we were not told about what changes could be made to the plans. We were never told that the basement bathroom could be moved.

We don't remember providing expressed permission to provide our contact information to CustomerInsight in order to survey us regarding our experience. In the future, expressed permission to share our contact information should be requested and permission granted. 

There were a few instances during structural and design phases, when dealing with multiple Tamarack representatives led to confusion and delays regarding our specifications and changes. All Tamarack reps certainly did their best to help, but really what was needed was a consistent rep who knew our needs well and/or to speak directly to those responsible for making the decision. For instance, there was quite a bit of confusion regarding structural changes to our basement, exterior colour selection and the selection of our hardwood.

Make sure the sales and design offices talk to each in coordinating schedules. For example our closing date was moved up twice because the design centre did not have any suiteable dates in their calendar for final selections. This is totally unsatisfactory. Also, the sales office gave misleading information with regards to structural changes (e.g. basement rough-in) and told us that would be done at design centre... which was incorrect.  Clearly Tamarach had an excellent sales year and I hope that they increase their capacity along with the demand. I certainly hope that the after sales service and build quality do not suffer due to the increased demand.
nothing
Flexibility regarding exterior choices

We have noticed a problem in communication between Head Office, Sales Office and Design Center.  We found out for example, that the drywall had been finished in our home before we had even made our selections even though the official go-ahead had not been given either by the Design Center or the Sales Office.  Serge took a quick tour through the house during construction and noticed this and that several other things had not been completed properly (no fireplace installed in basement, ceiling not prepared for pot lights, no additional outlets had been installed as requested.  We are a bit concerned that our home will not be properly finished or that it will be done in a manner which is unsightly.  

I also would like to comment that the mark-up for services and products is extremely high, forcing us to choose lower quality products when we could easily purchase the better ones if it were not for the ridiculous profit margin you impose.
Give more time to review documentation. Allow for time to get pre-approval for a mortgage.
more flexibility for closing date,for those who has to sell their present home

There were missed communications on available upgrade options,  mainly for structural upgrades.  Freestanding bathtub, exterior stone, kitchen bulkhead was to follow the upper cabinets, fireplace upgrade (upgraded size was communicated - however not the fact that the model had it raised above the ground).  At the framing inspection we noticed the kitchen bulkhead was not as we had requested nor was the fireplace.  Luckily we were advised the bulkhead would be corrected but unfortunately, the fireplace could not be raised above the ground like the model - it was too far along in the construction.  We are disappointed about the fireplace. Therefore, my recommendation would be to ensure sales office and design centre communicate all possible upgrades at the appropriate time, allowing buyers enough time to consider them.  Otherwise, the sales, design and construction staff have all been fantastic, knowledgeable, professional and courteous. Our experience so far has been very good.  Thank you for the opportunity to provide comments.
N/A
Better organization of samples - tiles and backslash in particular. Chose all from subs, not at design center location.

Up to this point, where we've just gone thru the sales and design stages; we were a little bit dissapointed with the fact that Tamarack has become reluctant to give us the opportunity to change the stairs (originally we wanted in wood and not in carpet) The explanation was that due to the fact that the house was a quick occupancy one, that decision was made in advance. Still don't understand why not approve the change if we were willing to pay for it. And quite honestly that change don't think would take that much of a toll in terms of timing to deliver the end product. Our point here is that there should be a little bit more flexibility on those situations. We understand the negative in the case of a structural change of the original plans, if that involves the need of government approval and has legal implications. Don't think the stairs change we were asking could be considered in that category. Another change that we would suggest is that a few items that we wanted to add to the house (regarding the fire place and bathrooms), the Design Center provided us the contacts to do the inquired on our behalf, but the quoting would only be provided to Tamarack and not us... Why is that? I do the call and the third party contacts the builder... I understand the commercial implications of that. Then, shouldn't be more logical that Tamarack takes ownership of that piece, too? You get the specs from the customer and you ask for the quoting. At the end, everything comes down to a budgeted list of yes or no choice... Just an idea.

I felt that I was nickel and dime'd on many items. This is not a cheap home and at times I felt as though I was trying to have a quick buck made on me at each turn. I'm a sales manager of a local dealership and enjoy the sales process. I run things very differently then the tamarack group evidently. There was a discrepancie over a range hood fan, conduit, and my design centre bonus ( I was under the impression this was a pre tax discount, opposed to after tax, most people would refer to that as a "rebate" not a "discount"). All in all this was a first time home buying experience for us and I'll reiterate this is in no way a starter home, and my experience thus far has me concerned over how warranty items will be addressed in the future.

At this point I would defiantly not recommend friends and family

Ryan Martin

Sales centre should have discussed upgrades before signing the purchase agreement. We were a little taken aback by the prices of upgrades. 

Didn't appreciate that some of my questions were answered with "because" at the design centre. I am not a child, I am paying for the house, I deserve an answer as to why you don't colour match paint and why I can't put wall tiles around my fireplace.
NO
nothing
Did not have enough time at the design centre. Need more time between scheduled appointments to make choices.

The Design centre should have 3D design software in order to show clients how their selections will look. Design centre staff should also be more knowledgeable with regards to pricing. More standard selections would be appreciated.
Nothing, it was perfect.
It was sufficent.

Better communication between the builder and some of the contractors.  The plans that were sent to the kitchen contractors did not match the house.  We ended up with an extra bulk head that was not in the blue prints or plans.  Our kitchen was then upgraded with that plan, and as such, we are having the stress of going through the kitchen re-design and plans after already signing off on them
Have more fixed prices available.

1.  Greater flexibility in booking design centre appointments.  Due to consultants being constantly booked,  we had significant difficulty fitting appointments into our own work schedules.

2.  Change design centre hours.  More evening and weekend hours would be appreciated, especially for those of us who tend to work extended hours from Monday-Friday (and those who live outside of the City of Ottawa).

3.  Sales centre was excellent!  Perhaps easier access to the unfinished house.

4.  Online selection platform for interior design options (colours, materials, appliances, etc.).  A virtual design centre where you could build and view a digital version of your house would  help move the entire progress along more efficiently, 

5.  More detailed explanation from design centre on the overall process for first time home buyers (it often felt like information overload with the size of the selection package presented with limited time to make final choices, book appointments with multiple stores, etc.).
Sales process was great, but I would change the design centre so that standard options are more obviously defined/organized.
Design centre consultant should allow purchaser more time to decide on available choices i.e. in their presence!

The model home is false represenation. 
They are done up to the nines.
Were not aware that many of the items were upgrades as opposed to standard.

Sales:  Transparency and honesty concerning the construction schedule is essential.  We lined up for three days ahead of lot release to get the lot of our choice and were assured at that time of being first on the street for construction start and closing.  An early September closing was critically important to us to maximize sale value of our current home and allow a door to door move.  We were assured as recently as mid February that everything was on track for a 7 March construction start.  Yet on 11 April, we were informed that due to a delay in getting building permits, closing would be delayed until Oct 7.  I suspect Tamarack was aware of this delay several months earlier but did not tell us until after all the paperwork for the sale had been finalized.  This delay ended up costing us $20,000 in the sale of our home (owing to the need to remain in our home into October).  

Upgrade Pricing.  
 1.  Several items we requested that were standard upgrades in the catalogue, especially plumbing fixtures, a corner bathtub, a shower niche, ceramic wall tile for the shower were ridiculously poverpriced.  The most outrageous of these was quoting $910 for a shower niche Mondeau had quoted at $635, and a further $400 for installation.  We have recent experience with bathroom renovations and know this pricing is completely unreasonable.  At any rate, we challenged several of the quotes and in some cases, prices were reduced substantially.  In other cases, we simply opted to do without.  Both Sales and Design Centre staff, who were all a pleasure to work with, were quite open about the fact that Tamarack margins on many categories of upgrades are very high.  Many aspects of the buying experience were very positive, but Tamarack's reputation when it comes to upgrade pricing is seriously tarnished in our view, and, unfortunately, we will share that view when asked about Tamarack.  Customers want value for money spent, and we certainly don't feel we got that in the upgrade process. 
 2.  Also please consider reviewing price credits for standard items replaced by upgrades, or at least be prepared to give a more detailed costing on upgrades. Best example of this was replacing the tiled Roman tub in the ensuite with an untiled corner tub and being charged what appears to be full price for the new tub with no credit for what Tamarack would not be installing.  Bottom line on this is you could do much more to assuage customers by providing a detailed cost quote for non-standard upgrades, including what credit is being given for the stanadard item not provided.  

The Customer Care experience has thus far been less than satisfying.  Email requests have gone unanswered in spite of asking for acknowledgment, and in at least two cases where we have spoken by phone we have found the representatives to be surprisingly cavalier (to the point of being rude), unsympathetic to our concerns, and sometimes less than helpful.  Perhaps they just have too many customers on their plates.  I don't know.  But this has been the most disappointing aspect of the buying experience by far.  

With all of that said, Noella Francoeur at the Cardinal Creek Sales office and Kim Knuth at the Design Centre have been a real pleasure to work with - caring, knowledgeable and extremely helpful in all respects.  True professionals and nice people.   We are very excited about the progress on our home and are looking forward to closing soon!

The whole process from stat to finish with our purchase and with dealing with Daryle on site cannot be faulted.  This has been a very happy experience.  I would only ask for more information about the final colour selection for the exterior that the architect has chosen.  This is not an important factor as there's no choice for the purchaser but it's nice to know in advance what they will be.
Keep up the good work.
I think the upgrades are way over priced. I would have also like to have used another Audio/Video company to run the wiring in the home.
The design centre I would have more standard options for toilets and faucets.  Everything else had a good selection.  When it comes to plumbing and lighting fixtures, it is limited.
Lower the cost of upgrades.
No Comments

Instead of charging $500 for drywall fees and to save time, let the buyers decide before drywall where outlets and caps should go.  Also, for shower as well.  Instead of automatically assuming the person wants an standard shower surround, ask them if they want tiling first before you have to let them know you have to pay $500 to drywall and remove the surround when it's not needed. Pricing of some upgrades is astronomical when compared to purchasing from current market ie flooring, hoodfans, bathroom/kitchen fixtures, baseboards & crown moldings. Others are very much aligned with current values and have a modest to reasonable markup incorporated.

There were some challenges to meet when I was living out of town and the deadlines were "rushed".  At the same time the irony was my closing date was delayed by 18 days... which is not only a gross inconvenience (as I chose the place because of the closing date) but also a financial burden as well since the bank does not budge after the 90 day guaranteed mortgage rate is passed!  So this has been a MAJOR downside to this process!

nothing. it was absolutely perfect. never had better service in our life.
they truly care and are passionate and will refer them to everyone.
thank you for a great experience.

The design centre was a nightmare. We ended up with few upgrades because of the options, and have many upgrades to do once we get the home - including 2 of our "must haves" we are told "no". If we had known, we would've bought with someone else.

But then I find out I could have changed the tub through the upgrade process and no one mentioned that. As for the design centre-answer questions in a timely manner.  Have a catalogue that is complete ie prices included and up to date.  THere are alot of options no one really knows about. ALso perhaps a relationship with a lighting supplier, and appliance supplier, would be helpful.

to have more appointments with the designer centre, and need to more visual  pictures on site to reflect the interior designs.

The first design centre appointment should be before signing the buying agreement, the design centre should explain the potential upgrade and rough costs per buyer's interests, and show buyer some most popular upgrade and costs and its added value to the new house, show buyer where to get the most information for the upgrade items.

Right from the bottom up I have no use for them at all.  I could take a hammer and ram it through the house.  Not built well.  The building code is allowing to do this.  There is too much chip board and particle board in it.  The air conditioner is too small.  We have a 2 tonne here and the hot water system is not up to snuff.  We wanted to buy our own and put them in.  They come from China and the things aren't reliable.  We wanted to buy our own that are better built but the builder kept blocking us.  They don't offer any sort of warranty or paperwork for these.
We were told that we would have room for 2 cars and there isn't.  When we look around now and comparing prices I feel the house is $30,000 more than everywhere else.

Absolutely nothing; quite honestly, the process has been very clear from the start, your design centre's doors were wide open even prior to the scheduled appointments and your staff were fantastic (I visited the design centre 4-5 times before my "official" series of appointments and the staff was extremely helpful, taking the time to answer all my questions and let me browse freely...no pressure...loved it!!).
Valerie was very helpful in making up my mind and going through the contract and steps that followed!!
I also visited a couple of your projects to get design ideas and perspective on build quality...etc. and have been impressed by the consistency of the layouts/build/quality and friendliness of your representatives!

So far, it's been an amazing experience, positive and worry free; I couldn't have asked for more, especially that it's my first house!

PS. This survey request was totally unexpected and much appreciated...talk about accountability!! Brilliant :)

Thank you so much,
Sari
When asked about approx. cost of upgrades in model homes, be honest and don't say it was half the cost of how much the upgrades would actually cost a client.
Better and quicker communication  between the sale center and design center and client to avoid delays.
It was all good and friendly and professionally handled.

At the design centre Tamarack failed to meet their timeline of 45 days to  complete design process due to understaffing. Consequently we were browbeaten into 'living' with our choices from the second meeting as we were told our house would be delayed indefinitely if we changed anything. We had assumed that we could do a slight adjustment at that last meeting. Upgrade specifications did not reach site office for over three weeks after our last meeting because again of understaffing therefore we still feel we could have made a minor change to our kitchen backsplash without delaying the construction of our house.

About the sales process, we feel that Tamarack uses a double standard when dealing with it clients. When asked about certain options for our home we were told they were not available however some people were given the opportunity to purchase said options while others were not. Also we were led to beleive that what you see in a model home can be purchased as an upgrade but later were told that some things are just decorating choices of the designer therefore we can look at them for inspiration only! When selecting our exterior package we inquired about stone and were told that there would be no stone used in Half Moon Bay now we find out that a significant number of people are indeed getting stone......also used on a model home. 

When contacting construction vice-president concerning changing an option (before excavating had even begun) we were told that construction timeline would be significantly delayed in other words we should have asked sooner. We had asked our sales rep many times before and her answer was always not possible until we found out that she did not have the last word on these matters and should have referred us to the construction vice-president in the first place.

The blue print meeting involved only the sales rep who was also involved with a couple buying a house at that time. Our blueprint does not represent the house we are purchasing, it is actually the reverse orientation and cluttered with options we did not purchase therefore it is rather difficult to show the exact positon of additionnal outlets, phone jacks, cable outlets and so on. Our freezer outlet is now sitting under the hotwater system so I guess we will have to hope that we can actually use it and not have to hire an electrician to put in a new one in a more convenient place.
A more friendly lead sales representative

The design center should give enough time between first and cabinet discussion and second appointment.  Design center better have one people follow one case. As an example, seeing as a kitchen backsplash is a standard feature that Tamarack offers, which means that the cost for the backsplash is in the purchase price of the home, it should not cost $1400 for upgraded backsplash tiles.  I should only pay the difference in material costs.  When priced out, that came to a $200.00 difference.  $1400 is the total cost of labour and material.

Because I knew in advance (at the time I signed the contract -February 2010) that I will not be in the summer of 2010 able to do any appointments with design centre, I requested my appointments to be in June 2010.

We have had a very positive experience so far with Tamarack homes.  This is our third 'new' home and by far the best experience out of all the builders so far.  We are very excited to move in to our new home and see the final touchs.  We hope the final product is as good as the service we've had so far.  

We have only one complaint which is unfortunate to have any at all. Finding out that our upgrades on our home were to be added to our final purchase price. City of Ottawa property assessments are based on the purchased value of a home and because of this it created an incentive for us to do aftermarket upgrades instead of purchasing all our upgrades at the design centre. Therefore we would have liked to have paid for those purchases seperatly from our home purchase.  As a home owner we do not feel that it is appropriate or smart to pay property taxes on an upgraded kitchen faucet for years to come.

Thank you so much for everything, looking forward to the big day!!

Stephanie and Dan Stevens.
More appointment time options in case adjustments need to be made.

We have had excellent service at the sales and design centres! The only thing I was annoyed about was a rather rude phone call I received around 7 am one morning (scared me a bit) from Christine in Customer service to book our walk through which we had been waiting six weeks to hear back about , she was not friendly and rather abrupt with answers to my questions, other than that incident we have been very pleased and are getting very excited about our move!
                               Thank you
Nothing... This was a great experience!
We never received our final Purchase Agreement after design options were added.

I think the whole experience has been very positive.  The only thinng I would have liked to have done is select a color options for the walls.  I found that during the design center process I would mention that I wanted something and was told that we would cover it later in the process and in the end we missed several things.  I blame myself as i should made better notes so as to not to forget anything but I am a little disapointed.
Larger samples at the design centre and samples thr client can take away to match with furniture, blinds, etc
NOthing.

Sales Center : Above excellent service from Joy Kerr.
She was very welcoming, friendly, professionnal, efficient, patient and paid alot of attention to all details. It showed that she has lots of experience and that she likes her job.
Design Center : Excellent service from Mandy Moore.
She really knows her stuff and had a great pleasure in sharing it with us and this always with a smile. She really helped us out with lots of our final choices.  We really appreciated her friendliness, patience and professionalism.
Frame check : Vik was amazing. He paid alot of attention to all our questions.  He was able to answer them immediately and with precision. He was very knowledgeable.

« Dislikes » : 
There were lots of very important decisions to be made at the design center. It is too bad that they do not allow us more time and that they do not provide us with an extra meeting for the representative to help us out with colours, etc. She was excellent in helping us out but she was able to do so only during the « closing meeting » (which made the meeting longer) and that by then most of our choices were already made (by ourselves). Also, would of appreciate if the long list of upgrades would have been online and showed examples (and even colour scheme - - like they did at the sale center for the outside colours).
nothing, overall it was a pleasant experience.

The process needs to be more transparent, in all aspects.  All selections for the home should be made at the same time (interior and structural changes).  In addition, more information should be provided when certain upgrades are selected.  For example, maple stairs means maple railings and newel posts at a much more significant cost relative to the actual stairs.  The cost of upgrades are significant and no credit is given for any standards that are foregone (like kitchen backsplash).  This is entirely unreasonable.

Would have been really nice to know the cost of the upgrades we were putting into our kitchen prior to making our decision.  We wanted to replicate the one in the model home so it shouldn't have been too hard to figure that out.  We ended up with a cabinets we don't really love and frankly will likely look like garbage because the standard white cabinets are hideous.
Nothing.
More design to see in actual.

I would hire a team that can be more caring has more passion and compassion.  I would also make sure my team has product knowledge . Make sure the employees explain and get involved more also suggests more products .

More communication from the builder on the time frames for construction, especially when delays occurred and the reasons for them!
Almost a whole year passed before we were even given an approximate date for the start of the house much less a completion date.
When we purchased our home in Oct. 2007, we were told that the expected completion date was the fall of 2008 which did not happen. We finally received a closing date of September 23rd in February 2009.

Noella Francoeur is nothing less than amazing,  she is friendly and professionel.  She makes a stressful major purchase an almost worry free experience.  Design Center staff are also friendly and professionel. Kim knows the inventory and provided solid choices. Ewa from Muskoka Kitchens is fantastic.  She lostened to pur needs and provided plans and ideas that will most likely meet our dreams kitchen.

Other suppliers were also very friendly and helpful with the strong exception of the Harding Fireplace Center.  reps at the showroom are unfriendly and not helpful, Tamarack sale rep was unresponsive and not eager to find us the fireplace to suit our needs.  We did the research and made choices.
I wouldn't change anything

Some upgrades were priced a lot higher than we anticipated, especially when we looked at what we thought was the cost of materials for a given upgrade.  It would have helped to have more of an explanation as to why the costs were what they were; for example, by explaining the cost of change orders, admin overhead, and whatever other reasons there were.  We were lucky to have family members involved in the residential industry who were able to explain some of this to us.

Sales centre, I hope they could provide me the correct info before my purchase, not after!!! 

For example, on April 2018, I walked in to the sales centre and ask the sales Marg that I would like to buy a town home with a white exterior brick, definitely and absolutely not RED color!!! She replied me with a positive confirm that the exterior will be package #24 with white color brick. Even before I sign my purchase agreement, I double check with her and she told me that there will be a slightly change but the exterior will be white color for sure. 

Three days ago, I dropped off at my town home and I could not believe that the exterior is RED color. Then I asked the sales Marg, she told me that she take the responsibility that offer me the wrong info. 

This is my first home and I worked hard to earn a dream home but the incorrect info made me feels disappointed because if I know the color is RED, I will not sign the purchase agreement no matter what. I hope the senior manager or someone who is in charge of this situation could contact with me.

My email is clarkli@lincolnheights.com

Attached is the email which Marg sent me:

Hi Clark,

 

My apologies for not getting back to you sooner, but I was waiting on replies from head office. 

 

The exterior brick colour on your home is the correct one.  Where the error occurred, and I take responsibility for this, is that I was unaware there are difference between the exterior package boards we have in the sales office for our single family home purchaser’s to choose from and the combination of materials used for the exterior packages for our townhomes….in other words, the exterior boards in the sales office are not what is used for the town homes….they are a combination of materials from the different exterior boards.

 

The exterior package installed on your home is as follows:  the Sutton brick (which is exterior board #28), the vinyl siding is Stratus (exterior board #23), garage door will be black, vinyl shingles (if applicable) 233-Anthractie (exterior board #28), the roof shingles will be Driftwood (exterior board #21/#24/#26/#29) and the front door colour will be Dark Secret.

 

My apologies for giving you incorrect information on what the exterior of your home would look like.  To see what your home will look like finished, you can go to the following addresses in Poole Creek on Warmstone Dr. to view. 

 

93-96 Warmstone Dr. ~ just at the end of your street

 

430-436 Warmstone Dr. just around the corner.

 

I know that you and Yue will still be happy in your new home and it will provide you with many happy memories!

 

Marg
We were satisfied overall but felt overwhelmed by all the decisions to be made.
Have it all in one place instead of going to the different retaillers. More standard options.

Maybe the hours they are closed on Friday (all day Friday) -
He could not answer this question(s) He did not meet Design I rated 7:During the design selections experience, the Design Consultant:

There needs to be a model of each type of home withouut upgrades so a potential buyer know what they get for the price listed. Also, more updates on the completing of the house process with possibly a second viewing of the home prior to the pre-delivery inspection.
I felt rushed during the design process.  An extra appointment would have helped.  More staff working at the design centre.

Less nickle and diming (very discouraging when everything has a price tag). 
 Receiving credit for items you are not receiving (eg. we omitted a kitchen backsplash, but received no credit)!
There should be no cost for minor structural changes (eg. we enlarged a bedroom by reducing the size of the laundry room, and in the process, the size of the laundry room window was reduced.  However, we were charged for the changes even though we lost a significant window size!).
More flexibility re. structural changes.  The deadlines are very stringent.
Need more knowledge at the welcome centre.
Buyers should have a chance to make some changes after the signing contract in the disign centre.

We purchased an urban townhome at Chaperal Way in Orleans.  Part of our upgrades selection process we visited other Tamarack projects to see first hand what the end-results of some available features.  Some sites were however not able to provide us with information regarding the upgrades installed in the model homes (e.g. type of hardware floor, ceramic, etc...) but we were told to ask the design centre.  The Design centre were able to answer most of our queries but sometimes we had to rely on pictures taken to pinpoint the upgrades.   Also, we were never provided with a clear pictures regarding when the unit would be transfer to the condo association (e.g. in terms of timelines or percent completion of the housing project).
Keep up the good work - The sales department of Tamarack is excellent.
more updates on the progress made on the house e.g. emails that say the foundation is in etc...
The information at the design centre with regards to tile options and installation was highly inaccurate.
Nothing. Fingers crossed ,everything has gone smoothly so far.

Nothing about the sales person.  Pleasant and professional.   The design centre, I was very frustrated and had trouble booking appointments.  I am a full time worker and so is my husband.  We tried to choose the best date for us and the workers at the design centre but that didn't work out for a long time.  The stuff at the design centre wasn't very nice.  When I came back from Europe I realize that I chose wrong colour in the tiles into the kitchen.  I only asked to change the colour of the tile and I was told no that that was not possible.  I asked to talk to someone from head office to see if I could change them.  The designer told me the head office said no.  I know that they do have trouble changing things once ordered and but I would have liked a chance to talk to someone about what happened. I would still like for someone to call me to speak about this from headquarters.

We found both the sales and design centre process to be well run and stress free.  However, we did not take part in a blue print meeting.

As first time home buyers and considering the number of entry level homes sold by Tamarack, we could have benefited from an information package detailing each step in the process including legal and tax requirements, what to expect and look for on during site visits, etc.
Better communication
no comment

If we could change anything about the design process, we would have preferred one Design Centre Representative to work with us throughout the entire process. At times, there seemed to be confusion between the representatives who worked with us. For example, we would make updates, choices, etc. with one rep that would not be communicated to the other.
ALL the staff at both the sales and design centre were outstanding professionals. Very impressive...especially Louise's team.

For the design centre I found that one of the ladies was not the most understanding when it came to my availability. I have a job where I can not take time off on that short notice. I  kept telling her my availabilites but she did not listen. She kept giving me times when I could not go to. It was very frustrating. I would have found it easier if the designers worked evenings past 5 pm as well.
The hours that you guys operate.  I had to take time off work and that wasn't fun.  Everything else was pretty good.
Nothing everyone was very helpful and treated us well.

I would not change anything about sales.
The design center experience was poor and overall didn't have a good experience. 
 I strongly recommend the following for the design center process
 - Designer need to be more proactive in terms of interior selection
 - Communicate in a timely manner with client, reply to every email  in a timely manner.  client should NOT have to send several emails and follow up messages to get clarification
- They need to communicate with the on site crew in a timely manner. When we went for our framing inspection on Tuesday we identified several issues and the site manager showed us they only received the design center document with our changes only the day before on Monday.
- framing inspection need to be scheduled ahead of time and should not be rushed. our was scheduled for the next day when we followed up
- The design center staff at the front desk are not proactive in helping client and never initiate a conversation or offer any help unless you chase them down.
Be a little more responsive.  Try to communicate the dates of delivery if there is a delay earlier.  If you expecting a delay inform them at least 2 months before.  1 month is not enough time.
no comment

- Provide better and more detailed explanation on the home buying process to buyers especially first time buyers.
- Water heater choice should be left to the prospective buyers. The builder should not force buyers into a long term deal that is purely exploitative. The water heater provided by the company you have chosen to partner with is overpriced by almost 2 fold. The same model and capacity can be purchased at a third of the price. Paying $42-45 every month for a service that may be required once or twice at the most over the lifetime of the heater is exorbitant. The price for buying out of the contract is prohibitively high. Claiming that you care for your customers when you force us into this kind of deal belies your claim to care for your customers.
- The design center should give home buyers more time to consider their selection of upgrades. The buyer should be given more time to go over their selection of upgrades and the associated additional costs. A fourth appointment would also be helpful since the cost of upgrades is significant.
It's fine.

Our only complaint was the time difference between when we were told the design process would begin and when we would have our framing walk-through inspection and the actual time frame when these two activities occured. In both instances, we received emails stating that we would be contacted to schedule our appointments in such a timeframe and the timeframe elapsed in both instances. I had to contact Tamarack and when I did, my appointments were booked. There just seemed to be a lack of follow-up in that area.

The experience was great, our design rep was very organized and answered all our upgrade questions quickly.
The frame check done by Steve was very helpful. He took the time to explain what we upgraded and were everything was. We upgraded a wall in the kitchen to be extended (wall against fridge) although it wasn't done at frame check, he make note of it made a call and it was fixed. I'm very impressed how well the Tamarack Sales, Design Center and other areas communicate.

Potentially, as a visualization tool, having all selected items from the design centre represented in a digital presentation format. We were also surprised to have been called to book a "slab viewing" with Urban Quarry - there was no mention of this appointment in the literature.

More time is required for the design selection. We felt extremely rushed.  As for the structural upgrades, Tamarack should allow you to meet with the designer/drafter to discuss these types of upgrades instead of going through Deb Durie in the sales office.  Other builders have this process such as Uniform and we find it's a better option as they are the ones that know best and in the end more timely.

I had a question/request to the Sales Rep, which was conveyed to the Sales Manager about the installation of the on-demand Tankless Water Heater. I am disappointed that Tamarack does not make this an option, that I can opt out of this Tankless Water Heater, at no additional cost. If this costs Tamarack more to have Tankless version versus the conventional water heater tank, why not? Tamarack must have a contract with the Tankless Water Heater provider to make everyone to pay for this service provider, Reliance, even though as a homeowner, I prefer the standard water heater tank, as it costs less in monthly rental (almost double the rate of a convential HWT). To me this does not make sense, as I was told by Tamrack that I can do this at my own cost. This was almost a deal breaker to me, if we can find a comparable builder in the area we want to live that offers HWT. I.e. if Tartan offers townhouses (which they don't in this area, only semi-detached), we may have just gone with Tartan!

The Framing inspection was a hiccup when the Site Supervisor was on vacation and another one took over, only to claim that it must have happened half an hour sooner. I came, according to Tamarack, half an hour later and waited for 45 minutes to realize no one came to the inspection at all. There was no email confirmation so that I can verify what I was promised on the exact timing of the inspection. The replacing Site Supervisor was not apologetic but essentially told me I missed it...To me that is not right!

Above are the two noticeable things I like to bring up to your attention. Other than those, during the inspection, the Site Super explained fairly clearly about the quality of the construction, which made me feel better.
Design center needs brochures. Items has to be presented vertically. Consider a customer in another city, how would you give him a good design center experience.

The sales center reps should be more upbeat when people come in to visit.  We paid many visits to the sales center/model homes when we were trying to decide which home suited us best and after approx. the 3rd visit, we began to get eyes rolling and the sales reps were continually tired and seemed bothered to see us on a repeated basis.  Some consideration knowing that buying a home is a big investment and time and thought and multiple (however many that may be) visits to the sales center/model homes should be expected and appreciated.  The design center process was a piece of cake and enjoyed it tremendously.  The design center reps were professional and new their stuff.  Very much appreciated.

Would have like to have had an explanation about how to read blue prints.  We would have like to have more details about the construction process, especially the fact that our house was a backsplit and that it required some changes for the door leading to the garage which impacted on the mudroom and initial plan of the house, this was presented in a big rush and told we had to make a decision right then-when fees are paid for a backsplit, the difference in plans should be presented early on in the design process. We had to make changes we didn't like because Tamarack was unprepared with plans and or options. We did not have option with regard to the choices available for the interlock pavement leading to the stairs of the main door-certainly would not have picked the layout and colour that has been installed.
 Muscoka mobile app was very helpful, but difficult to navigate. Would be nice to have some printed material to take home to make design decisions-we spent hours in the design center, having to leave our children with a sitter. (Ie pics of kitchens with each cupboard style, hardwood-the big decisions.) would like prices listed in the design centre, makes one feel cheap asking about prices all the time. Sad to see our construction site littered with garbage and cigarette butts, particularly since we face a conservation area-it reflects poorly on the subs and Tamarack.

That in the design center there were more appointments where colour suggestions could be made.  The process in the end felt very rushed and adequate time I don't think was allotted for the signoff as well. I had to take the form home and go over it to make sure that everything was there cause there was not enough time to do so in the office in my opinion.

When buying the home for first time home owners being more educated on what will be going up around our home, the home itself and not worried about learning things later on in which in some cases happen to us. Knowing what we can have our say on or change when it comes to the structure of the home etc. Overall good so far however for first time home owners somethings would have been good to know. Thanks

During sales there should be very clear examples of certain features that must be decided on almost immediately during the sales proces. For example, we were never shown an example of the fireplace or explained how the fireplace would look when we purchased, something that we only learned at our design appointment is structural and cannot be changed. This has resulted in us getting a fireplace that we are not satisfied with and could not changed after the fact because it was “too late”. The fireplace is not flush with the wall but rather juts out into the room at least a foot - something we were never informed of and never would have left had we been informed immediately during structural discussions.

Sales Process : We received excellent service from Noella Francoeur. 

Design Process : 1) Give more information to buyers for their independent visits to the Design Centre, so that they can make more decisions and understand the upgrade levels better. Colours are not consistent (in some items, blue is an upgrade, in others it is the standard). 2) Flexibility in the hours for appointments with the designer.

Other : Appointments for upgrades with Concept Homes, Alliance Security and others should be booked through Tamarack and be on the same days (and same location) as the Design Centre appointments.
Additional Examples of what previous clients have done in their homes and approximate costs.

clearly explain what  are the things to choose at design center and what are the things to consider before (like structural changes). I was not clearly informed about the hardwood stair case (i was thinking that it was design center selection but it turned out to be not)

Our experience with the first sales person did not go well. We did not find her knowledgeable or responsive, and found the process very frustrating. She had us to sign a conditional sale agreement too soon in the process, so that resulted in requiring many amendments, additional fundamental questions that had not been answered initially, and probably a lot more frustration on both sides. We came very close to walking away.

We eventually were handed off to another sales person while the other one was on vacation, and fortunately interacted with her only thereafter. At this stage we realized that we had missed critical steps it the process up to this point. Everything went smoothly from then on, and found her to have the knowledge and expertise that we had expected for such an important transaction.

Our interaction with the designer in the design center was very positive. The designer was very knowledgeable, understood our likes and dislikes, and was very personable. We did have several "the price is what!?" moments as we learned more details of the costs of various options that we think were outrageous. It is obvious why you don't do this, but it would be very useful for the buyer to know these costs up front BEFORE signing any agreements. It makes it a little impossible to budget without the full information from the design center. This can lead to a lot of little disappointments as you realize that your dream home will be less of a dream than you had imagined before you got the price list... and then had all the piling costs explained to you (for example, the cabinet door upgrades, PLUS the paint upgrade on top of it).

We were disappointed to learn of several things that Tamarack would NOT do for us. We had several inquiries on modern upgrades, like making the home Solar Ready and adding a high-voltage plug in the garage for a future electric car. Tamarack simply refused, which was very disappointing for a brand new home built in 2015. We were also turned down for a few other options that we thought would be straightforward, including pocket doors and skylights. All these features will be much more expensive to add in the future for us. We suggest that you look in to some of these options, particularly the Solar Read and electric car plugs, since this is the future and other developers already have some offerings in this direction. This is a very important influence on my recommendations to friends and family about whether they should choose a particular developer.

Regarding the frame check, it would be nice to receive a copy of the documentation so that we can confirm that everything was recorded properly and nothing was missed. It's not only good for us, but probably much cheaper for Tamarack if a missed mistake can be corrected sooner rather than later. We actually did think of a couple things afterwards that we forgot to check, but had no way of directly contacting the person who took us through the frame check. It seemed difficult and slow to pass that inquiry through our sales person, and I'm still not sure whether it was correct or not.

More help, design advice and support in choosing the various options. Design centre employees with more time to give to customers. Also, we were not able to obtain much information before the official referral to the Centre. Otherwise we could have started the planning process earlier thus alleviating much anxiety.

- didn't enjoy the reps at Emerald Tile
- i felt there could have been more 'options' presented for fireplaces as upgrades

The sales and design centre in Kingston was excellent.  We particularly liked that the model home contains few upgrades.  Other builders' model homes are significantly upgraded making it hard to visualize the starting point.
Quicker response to upgrade costs.
Nothing it was great

I would of found it really valuable to be able to see colours and designs of tile and flooring online prior to going to the design centre. I think if this was available it may make the selection process easier because then the purchaser would know what they like and dislike. If a software was created for this then the purchaser can save their 'likes' and the design centre consultant can quickly assist the purchaser in finalizing their items. It may also be nice to see a sample room online with the colour tile and paint colours etc - to help the purchaser better visualize the product they are looking at. The service was fabulous! The sales centre even assisted me with finding a doctor in the community, they went above and beyond in their job - they were fabulous!
Nothing

Make it more clear which items are to be selected at the design centre and which are to be selected at the sales centre (structural changes). This process was quite strange and resulted in a but if a mix up (which we believe was resolved) with our master ensuite.

We found that there were too many hands in the "pie" for the design process and there was a general lack of communication between all concerned. Especially, Concept Homes was difficult to get a hold of and make changes to their plans.  Things became confusing for us and the designer when we went to sign off on the upgrades, an incorrect version of the plans from Concept was being used.  We believe the issue lay with the administration of the file and again too many hands in the "pie". 

Despite these issues, our designer (Morgan) was amazing in her design skills and suggestions.
Nothing, it was such a smooth andpainless process. Jacquie was just amazing.

1. hardwood stain - When we purchased our home, a certain dark chocolate stain was available for hardwood floors, however when we had our selection appointment, that stain was no longer available. We ended up having to pay an 'upgraded' fee in order to get that stain. 
2. We had met with Concept Design to design on home theatre options etc. and submitted to design centre. After a 2nd meeting with concept we a number of changes. We then had to cross reference what was listed in our design centre sheets with the new decisions from concept, which ultimately resulted in something being missed. I feel it would have been better to 'delete' all of our initial concept decisions and 'replace' them with the new decisions. a 'cut and paste' from concept woud have eliminated something being in our manual cross referencing.
3. we purchased our home in release 1. when release 2 came out, tamarack was now offering other upgrades as standards ie soft drawer close. That should have been offereing and or included in all purchaser standards regardless of what phase they purchased in. It would seem to be a better sales pitch to offer more standards in the initial release, rather than offering more standards in subsequent releases. Makes one think they should have waited for further releases as more might be included in price.

Nothing I can think of now, however, I feel the need to mention that cost of some upgrade options struck me as being very overpriced.  

Kudos to your design centre staff, ie Carly, Kim and Ewa as they are very knowledgeable, patient and very helpful throughout a difficult process.
No change
The standard features should have more higher quality options.

The design centre should have a very clear and up to date catalog of all possible upgrades. We have spent hours deciding our upgrades to find out that some were not available or the price was completely different than the ones first showed to us.
The supply of homes.  All of Tamarack's bungalows have been sold out for ages.  We would of bought one two years ago.
More options for standard items and more appointments in design center
Have a computer at design center where by entering product number and house model number, upgrade prices are available.

At the beginning maybe give time frames , on when the design centre will call , when to expect the mechanical walkthrough and final inspection, none of this was told to me in the beginning so I was left in dark , as I have no sense when to expect things
Nothing so far!

We felt pressured for time as our file was due the same day as our final design center appointment which we were probably informed before hand but didn't fully understand the implications (I should note these are the dates that were provided to us for appointments we did not reschedule any). During the kitchen selection process we were told to make a wish list and that we could subsequently change but when we went back for final appointment the kitchen changes weren't made because the person wasn't in that day (e.g. we would have chosen a less expensive hood fan as this was not a need it was a wish list to see if we came under budget). This added stress to our process as after HST (b/c luxury home in CRA mind) it put us over what we were hoping to spend. My recommendation would be to not have the file due the same day as final appointment and if this is the case, don't tell client that they can make changes if it will risk their file being delayed, as we could have made more inexpensive choices. Otherwise it was a good experience.
Offer more standard options
Nothing.
Provide more options at the design centre or have a catalogue of the possible upgrades

We had a really good relationship with the Design expert and loved her expertise and knowledge. At the same time, it would be useful to have increased support and/or some online means or tools for role-playing ourselves with different scenarios on upgrades and for seeing right away the costs implications of those on our budget, rather than having to wait for a formal meeting to turn over the upgrades agreement and only to then see what the costs implications of our choices had done to our budget.
Nothing in particular
No comments as they were very friendly and very knowledgeable of their work.

We felt that during the sales process we were misinformed and often told things in order for the sale go through.  We really did not get a positive vibe and were disappointed with the service we recieved.

However,  it is important to note that the experience we had at the design centre was excellent.  Mandy was our designer and she could not have been more helpful.  Whenever we had questions she was always available through email or phone.  Mandy was even a big help in fixing some of the problems and clarifying some issues that occured during the sale maeetings.  When it came to picking our colors and upgrades in person she was very honest and helpful.  Even though the required meetings happen quickly and you need to be prepared, we never felt rushed during the selection process.

We have seen some of the beautiful homes that Tamarack has built and we are looking forward to our closing date to see the finished product!
The sales experience was fine,but I find that there were too many patterns of tiles and countertops to choose from.
Getting our selection to site office in a more timely fashion to avoid putting in the standard and then removing to do the upgrades. Seems unnecessary work is being done.

Nothing. My experience has been fantastic. Deborah at the Chaperal sales center is exceptional, kind, and very welcoming. Kim Knuth at the design center was fun, experienced, gave great advise and kept us within out budget. I am very happy with my purchase and I am very much looking forward to moving into my new home in Feb 2012.
Nothing that I could change
so far good

Keep the selection materials up to date in design certre. We're informed that our carpet selection was no longer available more than one week after the contract has been signed. It is quite frustrated.

Little things 1) In the Bristol-back bedrooms have closets that act as natural sound barrier between two rooms.  The is no sound /insulation between master & 4th BR.  We were told, we would have had to advise at time of purchase if we would have wanted insulation.  It wasn't until the frame inspection did we discover this & at that point it was too late.  Something to keep in mind for the future. 2) We never though we would have to shop for appliances before the design center.  Suggestion instead of saying fridge should be no more than 32', indicate what actual opening size is.  This would avoid a lot of confusion.
Thanks & can't wait to move in 13 days! We hope!

individuals not following through on their previous commitments
never willing to accommodate / the answer is always "NO"
There were also other issue with the pricing of the upgrades on this property that were not meet but I am not sure if this is the kind of thing you also want to hear about. If so please let me know I will share the concerns and issues and not to mention the frustration these issues has caused me.  I will provided you with just one little example, it’s really VERY DISSASPOINTING  when the owner of Tamarack  does not return your call.    

I had an inspector come with us during the rough in inspections and  whenever the inspector advised what items needed to be fixed there was always resistance.  As a matter of fact,  I sent an email on June 20/12 at 1:55pm to several Tamarack individuals advising them what needed to be fixed (two items in particular that are causing me much concern, the first one was an electrical wire what was cut in our master bathroom and the second were couple moldy wood studs (I think the sizes were 2x4's or 2x2's) located in our kitchen ceiling and in around of our fire place mantel.  
However, to this day no has responded to my email.  I know that this things were not done / fixed because during the inspection there was a lot of push back on them and indicating that this was not an issue. Ensure that prospective buyers are aware that bonus dollars advertised are tax included which means less value than expected at the deign centre. Perhaps a reduced bonus or a bonus that does not include tax would be more up front and therefore not a surprise disappointment when revealed.

The sales centre is fine but design centre  is a sales trap. The standard products offered are outdated to force you into upgrades that are priced at many times 
 over the real and fair market value.

Design centre process felt rushed to make decisions.  Also, it would have been nice to have running totals of projected costs for options selected.  The first time seeing total costs for upgrades is very close in time and date to signing off on things.  It would have been a lot better to have running totals at each visit, because to change one thing could have a cascading effect and could impact various other decisions.  It was made clear that there was limited design centre time, and more time would not be provided if you were going to start making  significant changes near the end.  We felt we had no idea what the total costs were, and then it was impractical to try to make changes that we would like and could be sure would not impact other choices.

It would be helpful if you could conduct a pre-selection of interior materials and upgrades virtually - either on-line or at a terminal in the design centre.  Via digital imagery, clients could experiment with different options in a simulated room.  In this manner, colours, textures and materials could be compared - giving the clients a better feel for what works.  The total price could also be tallied as they select options.  After selecting the various options, they could meet with a representative to discuss and confirm their choices.  This could serve to help clients make more informed decisions.  It would also reduce the amount of time a representative would need to spend with each client.
Ever since I first stepped into the Model Home Sale Centre, everything has gone fantastically smooth.  I would change absolutely nothing about the process.

Décor Center Receptionist was horrible and awful.  She rushed out and provided wrong information about upgrades.  I was fortunate to have a family member attend the appointment with me that was knowledgeable about the upgrades.    Sales consultant was great!

We had a terrible and stressful design centre experience. We were confined to very limited appointments and were rushed to make choices. The number of appointments and the availability of design consultant should be based on buyer's needs and budget. The pricing for custom choices should be available at the design centre without going back and forth to the head office.

Design Centre Issues - Our design consultant came least prepared during our first meeting, totally unaware of our structural upgrades. It seemed to us that she came with a pre-conceived notion that all our choices will be made during the first meeting itself. We were rushed and felt very overwhelmed after that appointment and yet we were told that we only have one final meeting left. Not all buyers stick to basic options or rely on design centre bonus to make upgrades. The process would be more effective and efficient if we had got additional time with the designer rather than having all the communications through email. We had to correct multiple times on the selections we made as she kept missing them in her email updates. During the frame walk-through we found out that the site crew did not even have the updated/final design selections.

Custom Pricing Issues - Many custom prices provided to us did not make sense. We had to go back multiple times to correct their mistakes and quotes. An online tool would be really helpful.

Building Issues - The site crew missed an additional window (upgrade) in the basement, even when it was clearly documented in the blueprint. They had to cut open the concrete to add the window after we reported this to them. The ultimate shock was when we came to know that they mixed up the Ensuite and Laundry room windows. Just 2 weeks before the closing, they had to rip open everything and replace the windows.

We are crossing fingers and hope that we will have very few issues to go through during PDI and stress-free closing.

There are no major changes to be made I was very pleased with the sales rep I had, Noella Francoeur, she was very informed on the Tamarak product and accepted to do the walk through on the property inspection when I could not be there (reason I did not respond to those questions).  At the design centre I had the great fortune of working with Christine Marsala who is a wiz when it comes to making color and material choices, and innovative choices, within a very short window of appointment time.  Sheri Sinclair, another efficient design centre worker quick turn around on resolving  admin issues.  Overall great job from everyone, maybe some extra staff at the design centre for peak periods and more experienced staff like Noella in sales.  Other than that.....
Bravo Zulu Tamarack!!
design centre could have an online portal to create a 3D virtual image of selections inside the specific housing floor plan

I believe this is actually happening as we speak, but in Kingston you have to drive around to different suppliers to pick out flooring, cabinets, countertops etc. It makes the process very time consuming and frustrating. They need to have their own design center like they have in Ottawa.

Found at times when we sitting going through things with the designer that people were coming and going --- distracting.
Room to dark.

EVERYTHING!!!!

Nothing is customer focused - not even this questionnaire (data gathering - period!). 
There is no attention to detail in the documentation process. Hopefully your building process pays more attention to detail than your administrative process.
There is no communication between Kingston and Ottawa - as witnessed by the random email we got from our representative Terry and the incorrect email address used in the letter we received from Christopher Taggart (attention to detail!). 
Documentation is abnormally slow to be received via the pony express once a week from Ottawa - email, scanners, faxes, 2011..... anyone?
Your staff are unable to clearly communicate 'standard' vs. 'upgrade' or to provide pricing on anything prior to purchase - ridiculous. 
The process, is bizarrely slow (for a company in the business of selling houses), laborious and has been a drain or our time, our realtor's time and our lawyer's time. 
Your 'design centre' staff are unhelpful, self important and unavailable to answer questions. 
Your staff are unable to react to anything (i.e. mistakes in documentation)without going via Ottawa - who take a week (at least) to respond to anything. 
Your documentation is out of date, but no one appears to be interested in updating it (HST was introduced a while back!). 
Everything is focused on Tamarack getting what it requires, but not on the customer having their needs met. (Taking two weeks to put TWO signatures on a 9 page agreement - not signing all the places it says Tamarack should sign and calling it 'standard business practice'). 
Whoever is advising you on customer service, marketing and sales is doing a VERY VERY poor job. I've been advising blue chip clients in this area for years and to even use the term 'customer service' here quite frankly is embarrassing.
We get much better (and more courteous) service from our car dealer and our cars cost a fraction of what this home costs. 
Your staff in Kingston, are uninformed, arrogant and seem to have no understanding that a purchase of this cost requires and in fact demands a high level of customer service, basic manners and etiquette. As I've already mentioned, I get better service for items that cost a fraction of what this home costs. 

You are in the fortunate position of owning a company that is able to make the buying and design process smooth, fun, easy and hassle free for your customers, yet you choose to make it hard, frustrating and mind-numbingly painful. I can only wonder at the number of customers you have lost by handling business this way. 

By the way, don't 'thank me' by offering me $500 so you can earn $350,000+ from the sale of a new home. That helps you more than it benefits me. If you really want to say thank you, then do something that only benefits the customer. That is what a true 'thank you' really is. If you want to introduce me to your referral programme that's fine, but don't hide it behind a 'thank you' - it's insulting to customers that have brains and actually are marketing savvy. 

We were led to believe that Tamarack homes had a high level of service and excellence - boy were we wrong. 

Quite frankly the whole process has been a huge disappointment and we are wondering if we just made a 400K big mistake. I guess we will only know when the house is complete. 
We were using this as a test market, because our main family home is in Ottawa and we were considering buying a Tamarack there too if this went well. I can assure you, we will not be buying another Tamarack home and we will not be recommending the company to anyone else. 

Please ensure these comments get passed to Christopher Taggart, he should know how frustrated and let down his customers feel.
More transparency and communication during the build process.

Having to wait and stand in lines to make the purchase when both we, and the sales staff, knew we had been waiting for the release for well over a year and were going to move forward doesn't seem to make a whole lot of sense??  I really don't understand the advantage to either Tamarack or us when a guaranteed sale is there!!

The sales part had an issue with our home being a "reverse" plan; it caused issues for both us and the sales agent in getting requirements properly assigned - it caused frustration on our side and required previous email traffic to be provided to prove our requirements!  Having a set of reverse plans for each home at the sales office should be standard practice as I am sure that all models are being built in both standard and reverse layouts.  The design centre personnel were professional and helpful; however, the design centre was in the throws of being moved and the presentation and availability of design parameters was limited or not fully functional for many of our visits.

Having more information given to prospect. I went to all of your Sale center the one that did an outstanding job was the one in Kanata. They make us feel like family. Because of that I put my offer in Kanata but my fiance like Barrhaven better so we settle there. Nothing really. We had a wonderful experience from start to finish. The ladies at the sales center/showhome in Orleans were always very friendly & knowledgeable. We are satisfied so far with our experience and hope to have the same service from start to finish!

Frame Check:  we were given 3 days notice for us to complete a frame check.   We were sent an email on a Monday, late afternoon and expected to drop our shifts or clear our schedule to complete by the Thursday.  we were departing for an out of country trip on the Wednesday morning.  When we advised we couldn't accommodate we were advised that unless we could do it Tuesday, we would not be able to do a frame check as the drywall would be completed before we came back the following week.   This was stressful and completely unnecessary.   A bit more planning and notice from Tamarack would have made the first experience in our new home much more pleasant, rather than the stressful schedule bending we had to do to fit it in before our trip.
