Sales center staff Valerie was not helpful at all after the initial sale.  When we approached her to point out some deficiencies with the house, we were repeatedly told 'oh it's better coming from you'.  We did not get the support to help us resolve some of these issues.  I have not been back to the sales centre since because I feel that it was a waste of time.  

Darryl is great to deal with and very accommodating.  The design centre process was great.  Kim Knuth was also very helpful with our selections and process.  Unlike Valerie, Kim went out of her way to see our complaints resolve.  

There is more to this business than taking my initial deposit to complete the sale.  There is a major lack of customer service from the sales office.  Therefore, I would not recommend this builder to friends and family in the future.

The only real issues we had with the purchase process were in the very beginning prior to deciding. It is misleading that the model home appears to be an open house, but entering forfeits the right to a real estate agent. There was no indication during the first visit that we would be denied representation, but we subsequently were. Also, when inquiring about what in the model home was upgraded or standard, the sales representative tried to draw from memory. Not surprisingly, several items were forgotten until a later time when we were far more committed to the purchase. We suggest a well-documented list of upgrades in the model home, and clear examples of samples that would be standard available in the model home for previewing. The only real issue we had since purchasing was that one of the interior selections we made was back-ordered and unavailable. We believe that if interior materials were ordered further ahead of time, the supplier could have met the demand before it was too late.

More flexible design centre apppintments
Better display of ceramic tiles
Have standard items available for display such as kitchen sink, basin, toilet...etc

Note:
Deb Durie was so knowledgable & responsive
Would not change a thing the designer I had by the name of Ms. Knuth was outstanding and Noella Francouer from the sales centre at Cardinal Creek has been outstanding and so has her team
I'm not sure.
A new design techniques may benefit customers before stepping into design center such as virtual design software with standard pricing.

Design centre was amazing.
Noella was also very professional and it was pleasant to work with both teams

Everything was great with the sales centre, I couldn't be more than happy. The design centre process was great as well, I just recommend they be more thorough when reviewing all the options during the final appointment, so that all of the areas in the house are covered, and gone over to make sure all the right options were chosen.
longer appointment times at the design centre. Since we bought an inventory home, the timelines were shorter than typical, and it was difficult to make choices with such little time.

The design process was amazing! The lady that helped us make our design decision was friendly, helpful, and knew the materials the center offered 'like the back of her hand'. I would recommend her to anyone. 

The sales center staff were friendly but a little extreme. Valerie made the process fun but skipped over material that she thought wasn't important. We read the material on our own and were able to ask questions and get further explanation where needed. 

We are to move into our new house on April 27th and we still haven't done the framing inspection. The drywall has been put on, taped, mudded, and painted. The ceramic tile has been put in along with the base board in atleast the front hall. I contacted the Tamarack design center in the middle of December to see when our framing inspection would take place. They said to call the site supervior. I called Jule at the site office and left a message. My call was never returned! I then stopped in at the design center and they said to email Julie and she would reply to my email and that they would send her an email as well. The older British lady took down my name and phone number. I emailed Jule and received no reply and their was no reply from the email that apparently was sent from the design center. I then called the design center again and asked if they could email her my name and phone number. I finally called in the middle of January and talked to Julie. She said I had to talk to Darrel. I spoke with Darrel on the phone and he said we could have the inspection whenever we wanted. I asked why we hadn't been call previously and he didn't have an answer. 

I am extremely frustrated with this company and hope the rest of the process is easier. I chose Tamarack because I heard they were a great builder, their standards and specifications are superior to the competition and the location was very desirable to me and my boyfriend. If I knew there would be so many problems I would have chose a builder like Urbandale or Tartan who's homes are significantly cheaper and building in the area.   

We are looking forward to moving into our new home but it has been a stressful process!
We believe the process (as is) is the best way to provide answers to your needed design informatiob
Booking appointments especially people from out of town, there should be a week or two notice in booking them.
More information about why certain upgrades cost more than what one would expect (additional plumbing costs for example)

The existing design centre is small - not all standard features are displayed which tends to promote perhaps more options purchases than necessary.  Pictures may be available but they don't convey reality.  I realize not all can be displayed but...  A picture of the fireplace doesn't inform the buyer that when you purchase the fireplace option, you will get the one that the lowest BTU output sold for that model.   I see this survey is coming to an end (94%) - I would have hoped to see space allocated to issues, of ex: the framed walk through took place but with a stand-in who didn't have the neck paperwork.  He was courteous and helpful but not the man.  And when questions are raised, we're told drywalling starts in two days, etc. And when questions are raised about why a 4 ft tall Rodgers box is place 11 ft from your main window (although assurances had been given on purchase that the company ensures side-entrance dwellings do not have obstructions or eyesores) all one gets is a generic reply "it can't be changed".  Someone failed to exercise proper coordination and supervision and nothing can be changed.
N/A

1. I’m an interior decorator myself. Although I recognize that the show homes have a number of ‘upgrades’ I think it should be posted the base price and price as is .. I’ve worked with clients that find it frustrating when they fall in love w a home then see the extra cost involved to get their home like the show home.
2. I would like to have had More walk throughs at different stages. I’ve questioned the colour of my banister already from viewing through door and asked to see it but I wasn’t given a opportunity until the week before we take possession

The design center needs to be more user friendly with regards to pricing and blue, green yellow dots etc..it is all very confusing right now.  A blue dot means different things in different areas. Standard in some , upgrade in others.
Also Tamarack needs to have plans drawn for the correct elevation of the house. At the moment we had to design our house using a mirror image plan. This was very confusing and resulted in errors. Surely it is not that difficult for the company to create the correct plan configuration!
Not so rushed....given clearer time frames of upgrades.
The walk through after framing should provide a report of issues reported.

1.  Our names were wrong on this survey, it was 'Oonagh Elliott and Li Wang'
2. Lists of standard vs optional items list available up front, i.e. what items are standard and which ones we have to select, and if they are a) design center or b) other (fireplace, security, lighting etc.)
3. Homeowner checklist to make it easier to go through the whole selection process

Note - Kim Knuth of the Design Center was awesome - very knowledgeable, professional, helpful, personable.    She made the process much easier and in fact fun.  She is a real asset to your organization.  Also, Uwe from Muskoka cabinets was great also, I know she`s not a Tamarack employee, but since we are doing this survey, I would like to express our appreciation for her work also.
I unfortunately did not have a design center experience as I purchased an inventory home. Maybe next time!
A guided not a self tour. More explanation of extras costs at the outset.
nothing really

The walk-through inspection during construction was not done with us.  We guessed this may be an oversight. As this is an important step in the building process, it should hence be given more attention.
Nothing I can think of at the moment, all in all a very good experience so far.
Nothing  they are extremely professionnel.
Knowing the products availability prior to show us
We would have the design centre appointments with Muskoka and Tamarack made into one - there's really no reason to go meet with Muskoka simply to discuss cabinets.
Happy with both the design and sales process.  Staff is very professional and friendly.   Very happy so far.
more people working at the design center
Let Mandy run the office - great personality and the girl who served us from the kitchen department - Eva super.

We are very satisfied up to now and we hope that it will continue to the end of the process.  We really appreciate the knowledge and the welcoming approach of all the people we have dealt with.  Thank you
no changes needed

The sales were helpful to a point. More suggestion from their part would be helpful. (changing layouts ) The buyer did not know the bottom line until the very very end. Does not help with budgeting.
Design centre was helpful but your standards, I am sorry SUCK . Ten years behind the times. I understand everybody has to made a dollar but the cost for the upgrades was a little to much to shallow. 
What i am saying is get with the times

The initial sales process and staff were incredible to deal with and offered plenty of suggestions and resources to make us feel right at home and like part of the family.  They were even able to delay our closing to accommodate the birth of our daughter!  Thanks Deb and Mike!!
Once the sale was complete, however, it seemed that the emails that were sent to notify us of any design centre or walk-through updates seemed to come late and made it appear as though we were always running late or behind schedule.
Our first design centre meeting with Angela was a complete waste of three hours and left us feeling even more confused than when we arrived.  All we got out of her was a series of yes answers when we asked about coloring, style or anything else and advised several times that we may be better off going to the supplier themselves.  We did.  And were then told by the railing construction company that they deal specifically with the builder and not the buyers and that we should not have been sent there.
I immediately called Carla and advised that we would not return if Angela was to be our permanent consultant.  Carla solved the issue and then some by pairing us with Kim, who was completely unbelievable.  She was knowledgeable, opinionated and extremely helpful in our design experience and did in two hours what we were not able to do in 3+ hours in our first visit.  We can't say enough great things about Kim and Tamarack is very lucky to have someone like her on staff.
Our frame check walk-through was next, if it could be called that.  We were advised that this would be a time to check the framing  with the on site supervisor and go over where the electrical and plumbing and other details would be installed.  We were advised quite late, in our opinion, as I had asked previous to our notification when our check would be, that the drywall had been put up to keep up with scheduling.  The walk-through still went ahead and Steve was great in showing us around and filling us in on all of the ins and outs of the house skeleton however we still feel we were mislead in being assured this would be a true frame check.  This frame check was actually mentioned several times during the sales process and was touted as quite an experience.  We were not impressed.
Overall, our experience with Tamarack has been good so far and we appreciate the opportunity to be able to provide our feedback.

During our Frame walk-through it was very good and the house was not clean.  There was dog poo in various places within the house, mostly in the bathroom and in the tub.  It was very disturbing to see and gross.
I loved it all, except the design centre. Having more employees and better availability times would be quite wonderful.

I would have liked to have more detailed information on redesign process, and pricing of kitchen options prior to signing agreement.  Upgrades are hard to price out before going through the process.  That being said- whenever we asked about pricing upgrades, we were informed within 2-4 business days.  Would be nice to know upfront more detailed costing options.

Sales process seems good. 
For design, 
As a high end builder, tamarack should include central air conditioner, basement framework and rough in as their standard.

Also, it has very  limited options for standard hardwood. There are no options for standard bathroom or kitchen sink and faucet. Also the standard kitchen cabinetry design is very basic. 

For upgrade prices, it should be more justifying. Every upgrade price seems higher than the retail prices in home improvement stores. It doesn't seem to be applying proper credits for standard items.
Have software that can help you see what the ideas/designs look like especially with the upgrades.

I had a problem when I visited a plumbing store and they did not have the list of items those are standard and we had to booked another appointment so they get the list. Make sure that all your partners must have to have this list s buyers could make th selecton either standard or upgrade.

Secondly, the list of price which was povided by design center dring first meeting, it contianed the wrong price for hardwood flooring for kitchen so I had a problem when I was mking my budget for house upgrade becuase I and my wife likes hardwood flooring.

Moreover, there is not enuogh choices available to select a color for standard carpet.

With all the decisions that had to be made; we feel that four visits to the design centre rather than three would reduce some of the worry and concern on making important decisions. First home or last home; these are very long term decisions and the stress level should be at a minimum.
Simplify the process of upgrades and make some prices available at sales centre to allow customers have ballpark ideas of what they want to upgrade based on budget.

I wish sales would have explained where bulkheads were placed when asked. This caused a few problems in the frame walk through. Decisions were based on this and I guess design center may be partially to blame. I wish there was more time between the 2 appointments for the design process. I also wish there was some time or window to change structural aspects considering I wasn’t informed about the bulkheads etc. I also inquired about a change after the fact to the pantry depth and as turned down.... the design center even explained that many people have commented on the same thing and I would have spent more money in the design process had they let me make this change! The timelines are just too short when you place a hold on the property

a much better website where you can see your house digitally with colors etc. I feel Tamarack is very behind in that respect. Would make design choices much faster and easier and less scary not knowing what the final product will give.
I really enjoyed the whole experience.

Information provided for costs and inclusions with upgrades. For repeat home-buyers, we were able to catch most items which could have been detrimental; however, less experienced buyers could have run into some costly and time-consuming issues.

"I was originally told in the sales center that the size of specific things in the model home would be the same as that of what I would be receiving (example the size of the island). Although, when I went to the design center i was told that the size would not be the same and that I had to pay extra money to get the same island size as that in the model home.

Also, i informed my designed center representative that I wanted all the inside doors to be the same as the main door (during my first visit to the house). My representative told me that she would contact head office to inform them of the changes of the doors. This occurred during April and she stated she would get in touch with me within a week. Unfortunately, i did not get a response from her until June (when I sent an email to her requesting an update). This was very inconvenient for me and my family for not hearing from my representative for such a long period of time."
nothing necessary.

Nothing. For context, I am in the military and we are being posted so we only had a couple of days to find a home. Our experience was excellent but was also very short and we simply did not discuss some things or have repeated meetings with staff that might be more normal due to our time constraints.

We are very pleased with our experience so far. Deb was wonderful and very helpful. She  made us feel very comfortable as we went to the purchasing process. Kim and the superintendent were great as well. 

The only thing we are disappointed about is in regards to the color of the brick and our main door. When we initially asked prior to signing the agreement, we were told that we would be getting a wooden main door and grey/white brick. During our inspection we realized that we will have a glass door and red brick.
Another meeting with the design specialist
Lining up outside the Sales office in March, and having to camp out overnight in zero degree temperatures was unreasonable. Otherwise, the experience was overall very positive.

THE DESIGN CENTRE LAYOUT SHOULD CLEARLY INDICATE WHAT PRODUCTS CAN BE CHOSEN FOR THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH HOUSE IS BEING BUILT.
AFTER CHOOSING HARDWOOD FLOORING AND PLANNING OTHER CHOICES AROUND THIS, WE LEARNED THAT OUR CHOSEN FLOORING WAS NOT AVAILABLE IN FINDLAY CREEK WHERE WE WERE BUILDING... VERY FRUSTRATING AND WASTED VALUABLE TIME AT THE DESIGN CENTRE.

HOWEVER, KIM KNUTH WAS A PLEASURE TO WORK WITH, PROFESSIONAL AND HELPFUL

The kitchens on display are outdated. Also the upgrades for hardwood and faucets always seem to change so the sales people from the flooring and faucets weren't updated on what was availble for the upgrades from Tamarack. It took longer than it should have.
Everything was great.

The only thing would be the accuracy when relaying the information concerning the upgrades of the house.  For example we were under the impression that central air came with our choice, only to be told later at the design centre thatcit was an upgrade.
Overall, the experience has been great thus far.
Make a model houses looking more than a standard houses. It's help people to make a better decision, what they want to upgrade.
Nothing - the people that work for Tamarack are great and very helpful.
I wanted a particular feature the time selection for it (it was not offered) and it was too late to get it -- regarding frosted windows.
as an investor , i prefere that you give us the possibility to have two painting  colours included .
Would be so grateful for a quicker move in date ...have waited 14 months for my move in date [needed to rent]

client has to very careful with all the documents and all the items (mistakes can be made in many places). more time for design center from your first appt. i was not aware that we are supposed to check for defeciencies in frame walk so more information would be good.

Have better examples of outside finishes... pictures of homes rather then a small sample board.
Add another visit to the design center selection process.

1) I found it unsettling that the sales centre would not negotiate even a small discount on the price of the house with me but is willing to pay agents 1%. Tamarack refused to even take $1,000 off the price for me but is willing to pay agents over $5,000. This costs both of us...

2) I think it would be worthwhile for Tamarack to invest in some computer programs at the design centre to allow customers to better visualize what there house will look like with different selections. It would make decision making easier and might even encourage people to do additional upgrades.

I would make the design centre process bit more seamless.  We felt we were given a run around with different suppliers for cabinetry, electrical (pot lights etc.) and bathroom vanity's.  Too many appointments, too many people to meet at different place/time. The experience was not the same at all places in fact it was below expectations.  We also felt that the prices of items selected at your suppliers were hiked up at OUR COST! 

Not the best experience but could use some improvements.
A little less pushy with the home sales.

One thing I would recommend Tamarack is that the customer should be explained in details about the cost of an upgrade. Since the upgrades are very expensive, a clear explanation Ex: Rate/price per sq ft etc or whichever units are applicable to the Upgrade should be provided to the customer rather than just quoting a price which is like a shocker for the client. Overall Great experience. Would highly recommend to others.

Provide more time for option selections - upgrades. Time allocated was clearly not enough and we felt a bit rushed - clearly the most stressful throughout the whole process. Our design centre rep could have been more helpful. E.g, we did not know whether 'moving' the fireplace around in the basement was an option. We thought it was a fixed location. We were only advised about this by our site manager during our visit. Also, we ended up wasting time during our last design centre meeting on location of phone jacks and cable connections, when this could have been done during our first site visit - which is much easier given that we are on the location - rather than having to look at the blue prints. Our design centre rep should have advised us of the latter.
it was adequate and I appreciated that the sales people did not hover over you when you came to the site.

Design center: upgrade added only to find out we could not have it as the Design Center/merchant  could not provide. We were credited for this upgrade. Addendum produced. Also, we received an email stating they forgot to charge an item. We advised we already had it in the list of items. Addendum is produced only to be advised by the Design center that we were right and that they made an error. A further addendum was produced.

Both the sales center and the design center we had to go in 3 times to sign official papers as there was always something missing. In the end everything got signed but should not have taken 3 times. 

Also, it would be a good idea when anyone from Tamarack sends an email to please put their telephone number under 
their name in case we must reach them. Several times I needed to do the Google search to find the numbers.

Tamarack as you wanted feedback I have provided the above which is very minor and please know that all parties involved have been more than welcoming us in our Tamarack journey.

Finally, I just want to say that I am looking so very much forward to moving into this dream home and giving my parents the well deserved years they have left into this new home. Thank you Tamarack for caring .

Sales process:
-more knowledge about the standards vs. upgrades prior to getting to design centre stage.  
-better understanding of walk through process and what to expect
-more knowledge of the closing process and what to expect

Design centre:
-clients would benefit from going through the check list of upgrades with design consultant to ensure that nothing is missed or considered.
-should have improved design centre standards such as: shut-off valves, dark colour cabinet as standard (standard colour selection is very poor), dark hard wood as standard - only light to medium selections available.  
-Cabinet colour selection was confusing and should have been explained that only certain types of colours are available for certain types of cabinet styles
-Poor standard paint colour selection, and extremely disappointed in finding out that more standard paint colour upgrades were available after sign off.  Also disappointed that there was an additional cost to paint base boards white.
-Maxi vents not a standard or offered as an upgrade. (This is standard with most builders in Ottawa) and no explanation as to why this was not offered as an upgrade.

After we committed to buying the house, there was some dicfficulty gettng us into the Design Centre before we went back home. (NL) It seems to me that the Design Centre needs to have a greater and perhaps stream-lined process for out of towners. We are retired military so we have been through this process a number of times. We recognize there are people that take months to select their options but we have also done it in a few hours. We did get in before we left and then worked with our consutant  through email and to date are very satisified but the idea of leaving and having to come back just to choose options was almost a show stopper for us.

I would provide more detail at the design centre process on which supplier would be responsible for which items and how it would be coordinated (ie. would I have to coordinate responses to my design centre consultant or would it be their responsibility to provide their information to them.)

The appliance package offered through the Brick. My experience with the Brick thus far has been beyond frustrating and the worst part of the process. Would have preferred a signing bonus to cover appliances that allowed me to shop where I would have preferred. Though it is not a short coming on Tamaracks end, it has tainted an otherwise excellent experience.

I am satisfied with what the current process is. I bought Tamarack home because your company has very good reputation which divide your Tamarack with other builders. I love my new home, although it hasn't finished yet. I hope the new home will be closed on time since the closing date has been postponded once.
N/A

We were not notified about the referral bonus prior to the signing of our sales agreement. We were referred by a Tamarack home owner but did not obtain the referral bonus because we were unaware of it. If Tamarack is going to have the bonus, it should not be hidden from your clients or restricted to the box they checked (or didn't check) on the paper they filled out when browsing model homes. Otherwise, the sales team and entire process to date has been amazing compared to our last experience buying a new home.

Décor Center quoting process is to receive quote is too long.  2 weeks to receive pricing.    Every item should have a quote upfront and also available on-line. We received a lot of paper with upgrade option but no pricing.  This is not efficient.

Staff Sales and Décor are great!

Tamarack site customer service reps and trades  are not helpful.  They just keep telling us to write issues on our PDI instead of helping us. 

Not happy with the paint job.   

We asked for our fireplace to have not tile surrounding.  Before our PDI the ripped the  tile off the fireplace instead of properly removing the tile. 
The drywall and paint looks horrible.  It still has not been fixed,  I was referred to write it on our next PDI.

Appliances:  Lowes Service installer  advised that our dishwasher machine could not be installed as they are only contracted to install domestic appliances.  We were not advised of this and purchased Samsung.   We have to pay a different installer to install the dishwasher as the pipes need to be customized.  This is an out of pocket expense.

We had wanted to speak with the sales director about making a minor change to the closing date so we could qualify for a considerably better mortgage rate. After several phone calls, messages and emails, she (Debra Champagne) never returned our call.  We were very disappointed since we are repeatedly being reminded of how tamarack really cares about its customers. This experience really made us question how true this is.  Other than this experience, so far, all the other Tamarack employees have been considerate and helpful.

If you upgrade a feature i.e. floors, counters etc. you should get a credit for
the standard and pay the difference on the upgrade. After signing off you 
should still be able to make a change on your decision as long as the product
has not been delivered to the house. Buyer should be told ahead of time at the design centre of the 19%  HST. on upgrades. I assumed the HST was 
13% on everything. Quite a SHOCK!
We would have done more research before choosing our interior design. We changed our minds quite often.

As a second time home buyer with Tamarack, I was once again very disappointed with the options for paint and for the alarm system.  I believe you could avoid many conflicts with customers by having more choices here.  

I also believe that the colour scheme in the design center leads to nothing but confusion since it varies from product to product.  ie:  green, red, blue, yellow, green-yellow, green-blue, yellow-red...  even the employees have to make reference on occasion to be sure they're giving the correct upgrade scale.

We felt somewhat rushed through the design process, mostly because of staff going on holidays.

Would have been a bit easier for my wife if the staff of the design centre had been bilingual.

Very impressed with the sales centre.

1. Have pictures or sample pictures on the design centre notebooks or price list
2. More selections

I think it is important to have a VERY clear understanding of what are upgrades outside of the list provided. Having options to upgrade without getting the response: It's too expensive would have helped on making some other changes.

I WAS DISAPPOINTED TO HEAR THAT I COULD NOT HAVE THE STANDARD OPTIONS THAT I PAID FOR BUT DECIDED TO UPGRADE. I COULD SELL THESE ITEMS OR USE THEM ELSEWHERE IN THE HOME IE: MIRRORS, SHOWER INSERT (SINCE I'M GETTING HTE TILED OPTION), PAPER TOILET RACK AND LIGHTING ETC

IF THIS POLICY CHANGES, PLEASE LET ME KNOW. I WAS TOLD YOU USED TO LEAVE IT BEHIND BUT WAS AFRAID TRADESMEN WOULD STEEL THEM. TO ME, YOU HAVE CAMERAS WHICH SHOULD HELP CURB BUT WOULD BE WILLING TO TAKE THE CHANCE AND HAVE THEM LEFT BEHIND. THANKS, 
VICKY 
905 BUNCHBERRY -

The design process could be more streamlines and the team could communicate more effectively with each other. This would avoid awkward and non-value add time spent during the design process. Also, there shouldn't be an assumption that the buyer knows and understands all the standard vs. upgrades.
Design centre- Have second appt be split into two appt's (The selections appt; it is very stressful trying to make all interior selections in one appt)
Have more time for upgrades...In case we want to make changes....Felt a little rushed.

more guidance or clearer direction on outside suppliers (anyone you need to see outside of the Tamarack design centre). This is confusing and even more confusing is who is responsible to replay information between these outside suppliers and your design centre rep.
Nothing very good experience so far thank you
Unsure.
Pre inspection delivery book should have been handed out and  read by the client before the survey.
Nothing everyone was very professional from Darlene and Sal in sales to Mandy in design
I did not receive any blue prints and no one spoke to me about the construction of my house (this is why I rated that section of the survey poorly).

I think they should reply earlier to the emails.  I had to remind them and push to get a reply to m emails.  I go to the model home to see what is standard and what was upgrade by looking at the home.  I thought what I saw in the model home was standard in my home but that was wrong.  The home was built 3 years ago and they don't use the same products anymore and they didn't tell me.  I feel that the design centre are not friendly enough and they don't treat everyone the same.  My first appt. was supposed to be 1 hour and mine was 45 minutes.  I stopped by on another day to pick paint colours I overheard another presentation and I feel that they were getting a lot more information than we did.  She had a poker face and never smiled at us.  I saw her smile at a lot of other people.  I think that is because I am not Canadian.  My face doesn't look like a regular Canadian and my English isn't that good so I think I was treated differently.
one or two more meetings with rep to choose upgrades ... before the final signature....

We would build a bigger design centre that encompasses all products and upgrades available, similar to what Richcraft Homes offers. It is inconvenient, for a working couple with young children, to book appointments with several suppliers in addition to the design centre appointments.

Note that we left the blueprint meeting questions blank, as we did not have one. If it is no longer offered, we believe it should be reinstated.

We were never informed in writing that the construction had started. We would send a letter to confirm it.

We would streamline the process to get a plumbing upgrade quote. It took several weeks to get a quote for a shower door and faucet.
A little more time for the selection process to select the most suitable items as in my case, there was no model house for me to visit and base my choices on.
Nothing
Not a big deal as Kim's was amazing, but we did feel that the appointments were a bit close together at the time (design center)

Sales staff was not very clear on the process(that we had to make decisions about kitchen through muskoka not Tamarack)put all standard options for homes in an area and then have other areas  for color upgrades. buyers will then see what is standard and go with those options or upgrade finishes

I had to wait outside over night to purchase my lot. I didn't like the lack of understanding or support that we received at this time. The way it was organized had potential neighbours really competing against one another. A simple number hand out for position would have been more appropriate rather than us sleeping in a certain order. 
As well, we found the exterior design options quite limited. 
It appeared that there were non standard cabinetry as well. Everything had a markup price.
We made some deletions from the standard (I.e. backsplash) and were given no credit in return, which we found quite surprising as well. 
Having said all of the above, we overall had a very good experience with tamarack.  We were especially happy with our Muskoka kitchens rep (Ewa). She was e exemplary, and had incredible customer service. We found she went above and beyond for us.
Pretty good all positive.
the whole experience was amazing :)

Our experience at the design center was fantastic.  Kim knows her business was able to guide us patiently throughout the process.  The framing inspection was also very reassuring.  Richard had picked up on a few issues that we would have never noticed.  His attention to detail spoke not only to his professionalism, but also Tamarack's commitment to providing a quality product.

Our experience at the sales center was slightly less positive.  On the few occasions that we needed to deal with them, we felt a little rushed by the staff.  We also felt that they were very unaccommodating to our children.  Finally, as customers who was about to spend over half a million on your products, we certainly did not feel like we were in control and that every effort would be made to address our specific needs.  As an example, the mere presence of our extremely well behaved kids clearly caused an issue with a staff member when we presented ourselves to sign our initial contract.  Furthermore, when came time to book our framing inspection, we were told that we essentially needed to go during the 4 hour window provided by them, or simply not have the opportunity to conduct the inspection at all.  We need to work big jobs to pay for your homes, and I would suspect that your company as a whole would want to adapt to our availability as customers. 

Overall, we are satisfied with how the process has progressed up to this point and are extremely excited to move into our new home.

Best regards,

Christine & Tim
All good
More details in options re- framing design
It was a wonderful experience, very personal.  My only concern is the selling of my present home to meet the closure of my purchasing home.

Sales - Nothing
Design Centre - More time to make interior selections and more information on upgrade costs, quality etc. Although I did a lot of research ahead of time and had a general idea of what options and upgrades I wanted, I found the interior selection process to be too quick and was expecting the design consultant to propose ideas and options I hadn't thought of. It was quite a messy process.

1. Show cross-sectional diagrams of the rooms to customers at the same time as blueprints. The heights of windows were not shown to us at the time of purchase/structural changes, and as a result, our plans for two rooms cannot be fulfilled.

2. Some structural choices are contingent on design center options. We made several changes to the foyer of our home in order to accommodate a foyer bench by the window. We were told during structural selections that this bench would be a design center option and we would deal with it later. However, when the time came in the design center to purchase the bench, we were told that the window in the foyer was too tall to accommodate the bench. This problem should have been identified to us at the structural phase, before we invested in structural changes that would not be compatible with our desired design changes. Had we known this problem at the structural phase, we could have also paid to have a shorter window placed in the foyer in order to accommodate our bench. Furthermore, the bench was actually drawn in our blueprints at the structural stage, and nevertheless, Muskoka refused to install the bench and Tamarack refused to modify the window in order to comply with the blueprints.

3. The exact same problem as described above in point #2 occurred with bedroom3/office. The desks that we wanted to have Muskoka install against the window could not be accommodated because the window was too low, and again, the position of the window was not identified to us at the time of purchase/structural.

4. Tamarack refused to fix the above issues even though we were willing to be flexible (i.e. we were willing to delay closing or even have Tamarack or another contractor of their choice fix the issues after closing). Tamarack credited us the cost of our structural changes to the foyer and bedroom3 window (for design center options), but we were willing to spend even more money to have our plans realized. Tamarack was not willing to make any changes and only provided the credit at face value. We are still in a position where we only have half of what we wanted and now need to spend more money to have an independent contractor come in after closing to fix the problems.

In summary, the above problems are why we have selected 5/10 for recommending Tamarack to friends. The design center portion of our process was extremely well organized, enjoyable, and efficient. However, the difficulties resulting from structural cost us many months of time and frustration. Based on Tamarack's reputation in the city, we trusted that Tamarack would build us the home of our dreams, however, our overall experience has been underwhelming.
I had an excellent experience and was really served by experts.

I would have wanted more options available to negotiate upgrades.  I don't see the benefit to Tamarack to have a 'take it or leave it' position on all upgrade choices.  An incentive program (eg. spend 100,000 and receive 10% rebate, etc.) would also have made the process more attractive.

It's frustrating and disrespectful when you are spending over half a million dollars on a product to be treated like your dollar has no value to the vendor outside their rigid, non-negotiable terms.

I would also like to have seen better coordination between the Design Centre and various dealers (including Muskoka).  We discovered at times that changes we made with one were not necessarily communicated or documented with the other.

During the walkthrough, the on-site rep was helpful and knowledgeable but we had no idea if our concerns were documented and would liked to have received follow-up summarizing the meeting and their commitment to the required changes.

- improved documentation and responsiveness for design upgrades from Muskoka Kitchens, more integrated discussion of pulls and knobs
- more realistic pricing on upgrades for exterior frontage (eg.  stone masonry pricing was comical)
Need to modernize so
More time, better explanation of events and timelines
More communication through email. Detailing the dates to which selections must be done to avoid any stops in construction.

Better & timely understanding  of what structural upgrades are possible before paper work is final (from the sales center).
Working patiently with the clients to manage the upgrade details (especially with the kitchen redesign) .

You need at least one more scheduled appointment with your designer.  You also need to re-vamp your kitchen backsplash selection as it is either very costly or not much of a selection in standard or one or two levels up.  We opted out of selecting a standard or upgrading because of this.
Have a digital view of design choices once they have been made
I will recommend Tamarack to respect the closing date and to advise the Household for any changes about the closing date

I would change all the advertising for the Cambridge model home or any other model home that uses a LOW HEAT venting solution to distribute warm air throughout the basement. All advertising materials to date show a flush wall in basements that use a LOW HEAT vent (no protrusions out of the wall), but actually this solution results in a column jutting out of the wall by about a foot. This is misleading advertising or at least advertising that hasn't been updated yet. No one pointed this out to us at the Sales Centre, at the Design Centre, at Concept Homes, and it wasn't even pointed out to us during our Frame walkthrough. It was only acknowledged after we noticed it and shared our frame walk photos. This could be seen as deceptive. Why is this a big issue? When we talked to Mandy and to Concept Homes about placing our entertainment system against this wall, there was no mention of a column protruding out of the wall. No mention when we put a conduit and our network outlets in this area either. We bought the entertainment system (thousands of dollars), as well as all the furniture oriented to the entertainment system (tens of thousands of dollars). And now the entertainment system doesn't fit. We had to personally complain to Head Office to sort this out. We think it's important to be transparent and to communicate building solutions that physically change the space your customers will be living in.
During our design process and before we had signed our final papers, we had asked for an additional outlet to be put into our ensuite bathroom near our toilet. Mandy said she would ask Head Office whether this was allowed and at a later date. After we had signed our design documents, Head Office said it wasn't possible citing bylaws. We asked again about different configurations on how it could be included. Flat out no, not even an attempt to work with us to make it happen. Later we find out additional outlets at counter height have been placed into other Tamarack ensuite bathroom units (with photos to prove it). After learning about the inequality in customer service being provided to us, we tried to push for this additional outlet some more. Flat out rejections citing no additional electrical work would be tolerated. We'd recommend checking your customer service practices to ensure you treat all customers fairly and that consistent customer service practices are provided to all.

We are quite happy with our experience so far.  We love the design of the home and the community layout.

A few things - during our scheduled appointment to sign the purchase agreement, the salesperson excused herself to serve another client.  It was a little frustrating since we were spending alot of money, and it didn't feel like our time and purchase were being valued.  Also, without having a good understanding of what was deemed as a structural change versus something at the upgrade centre, we later found out that a certain change we were hoping to include (stone fireplace) was in fact a structural change.  It's hard to know what is structural at the time of signing when you are just starting to think about different upgrades, and it is unfortunate when you are told that something you would like cannot be done at a certain stage (increased ceiling height in basement, central vac toe plates).  A list of example structural upgrades would have been very helpful.  

We experienced a delayed closing notification - we received a letter that incorrectly referred to our closing being 'tentative' when in fact we signed a firm agreement.  This delay was a little frustrating, considering how far in advance we purchased and how the salesperson told us that Tamarack was known for being on time, in contrast to another builder in the area without the same reputation.  It was a big reason why we decided to buy with Tamarack.  I think that we would have expected a delay with a shorter completion period, but with such a lead time, we were disappointed.  

As for the design centre, there were some standard selections that seemed quite dated.  It was great to have such a wide standard selection, however, it would have been better to have more current styling.  We were disappointed that our community featured a different type of hardwood flooring, since the standard options were not comparable to the other communities, forcing us to upgrade to achieve the colour we wanted (and had seen as standard in various Tamarack models).  We rated our design centre consultant as not telling us about the value-add of upgrades, because that didn't seem applicable and the survey didn't present an opportunity to indicate that.  It was tough to pick all the options in 3 appointments, so outside visits should be strongly suggested!

Overall, we are happy with our sales and design centre experience.  

Finally, the survey asked us to rate the inspection - we close in nearly 2 months, and we still haven't yet had our inspection.  Considering we purchased our home nearly 15 months in advance of closing, it would have been great to receive status reports since we don't know how far in advance certain stages are to take place.
I wish Tamarack would keep us informed more often as to what is happening in our home since this is an exciting time for all home owners! Also, we found the options to be very pricey!
More time, lots of meeting during the week. We both still work and time away from work wasn't easy.

Deb Dennison was fantastic - very warm, welcoming, knowledgeable.  She really connected with us and provided us with outstanding customer service.

Ewa from Muskoka was also excellent - we really appreciated her prompt responses to enquiries, her professional advice but also her warm, welcoming interaction.  Even though we were on a schedule, we never felt rushed or dismissed.  Fantastic customer service.

I will suggest better guidance for the design centre process.  Knowing we would have a short timeframe to make our selections and limited appointment time, we really strived to be prepared for those scheduled meetings by spending time at the design centre in advance.  We really tried to have most of our selections ready to go.  Our first interaction at the design centre was really discouraging.  The part-time receptionist was really unwelcoming, unapproachable and impatient.  The upgrade list wasn't well explained and we would have appreciated if someone could have spent even ten minutes with us to explain how to start and proceed.  I would also suggest that the tile be better organized, by upgrade selection.  It was difficult to come back and try and find a particular tile.  Choosing finishings for your home is not comparable to purchasing a new shirt, I understand that deadlines must be met however we would have appreciated a more welcoming approach.  That being said, once we met with Kim Knuth, everything was back on track.  She was accessible and very helpful.  Overall, we were extremely pleased with our Tamarack experience and look forward to seeing our finished home!
It is a detailed process so I don't think there is anything to improve.
Can't think of any. All the staff were so pleasant.
NA

Very unhappy with lack of communication and commitment with Head Office and the builder.  Our initial closing date was scheduled for  July,  we booked our family vacation to Europe to accommodate our vacation to be notified that our closing date was moved the Aug 19th.   The builder promised no more delays will occur an we cancelled our vacation and rescheduled the date, yet we received another notice of delay for Sept 16th.  We are extremely disappointed with the delay and having to cancel our vacation which the builder was made aware of. We also haven't received any communication regarding our walk through we have emailed Head Office and no one has responded.   Our friend who have purchased within the same community and builder have received their dates for the walk through.   We are very disappointed.

Maybe have a bit more time to choose stuff, or at least not be so far in advance of the house being ready.  I would like to comment on Jacqui & Carolyn...these girls are jewels, and I hope you're paying them well because they do a fantastic job!
Everything was very satisfactory
I would not change anything. We had a great experience and have already recommended Tamarack to friends

For sales centre: while we were initially visiting different model homes throughout the Tamarack Community, we wish the people in the sales offices in all the locations were equally friendly and welcoming.

For design centre: might be a good idea to add few more choices in the standard options (carpets, faucets, sinks and light fixtures).

As a home buyer, I should be proud to have a Tamarack Home. If that's the reputation, Tamarack will stand out high above the other builders for times to come.
More frequent visits to the construction site to review progress.
I would be honest with clients and not coerce them to buy something they did not want.

I think that there are some things that they could do to help people with limited experience. If I was not in the industry, I would not have understood what was going on. They should work on keeping you up to date between each process, you kind have to assume what is happening. Maybe on a 2-3 week basis so I know where things stand. If I had not called, I don't think I would have had an opportunity to do the frame stage walk through. They should also make it clear what is an upgrade and what is not. Make it clear how it will affect the overall cost.  They should encourage the homeowner to go to the design center outside of their appointments so they can decide what they want before or between appointments. The rest of the process has been pretty straightforward. Tamarack has really improved their process, but I think there is still room for improvement in terms of keeping people informed. Encourage open communication with clients.
I can't think of anything right now.

Notify the client at the beginning of the process that when you receive a signing bonus well it's actually tax deductable. We chose all our upgrades at the design centre thinking of having 10 000$ free upgrades and by surprise at the end of the process we found out that that amount was taxed therefore we received 8 000$. That was not part of our budget. Please tell the client at the beginning of the process.
did not enjoy the Kitchen Design experience
Have the selection of upgrades made easier
Can’t think of it

"Will like to get accurate information on time. Also please explain and provide valid reason with example while changing the closing date. 
Do not send emails well in advance advising the customer to look forward to receive call for home inspection  at different stages during construction,  when you are not intending to follow it up (calling the customer for inspection) for months."

Have a local kitchen firm.  It is extremely inconvenient to deal with a showroom and staff in Ottawa for kitchen.  Also encountered some frustration with the staff at Muskoka.  It would also be helpful to have greater flexibility on things with Tamarack.  No seems to be a fairly common response after a certain date and that's not a good response when you are spending this kind of money.
Having access to the timing of what has been completed and what was left to do. We were very excited about every step.
Don't have discontinued items on the floor. Prices could have been more reasonable.
Nothing, it great.

1. Structural Design - Bradbury Model:  Our Sale rep, Deb, was excellent, caring, attentive, supportive, knowledgeable, and took pride in her job/responsibility.  Unfortunately, this process felt very rushed given the timelines from head office. Ultimately, this led to us missing out on a structural upgrade that we had not considered as part of our discussion at the early stage of planning (i.e. 9' basement ceiling to accompany our finished basement selection). Also, the process of pricing structural items were disconnected with the design center, thus it proved challenging to devise an all encompassing "upgrade plan" with rough order pricing to align with our desired budget/plan.  Moreover, without meeting with kitchen cabinet design consultant, it was near impossible to garner an estimate for a custom kitchen, thus impacting on budgeting/planning when considering early stage structural design and selections. Overall, I posit that the normal structural process is  relatively simple for buyers; however, when customizing a large home, including finished basement design, interior structural changes, and trying to balance overall budget/plan for later stage design upgrades proved difficult and disconnected.
2. Design Centre: It became apparent that the "allocated time" for the design centre appointment with our consultant was highly insufficient. The initial meeting was clear, but overly generic and not tailored, nor capable to provide the buyer with answers to questions relating to samples, standard vs. upgrades, etc.  Although it was recommended to visit the design center on our own time, it becomes difficult to commence this process when we can't ask specific questions to guide pre-selections/coordination in advance of the formal design meeting with our assigned consultant.  Although I scored this area lower in the previous survey question, it is not reflective of our actual design consultant, Kim, who was excellent, knowledgeable, and supportive of our desires and needs, as she went well beyond the allocated time given to her.  I strongly suggest that there should be consideration for the scale/size of model selection, coupled by level of complexity and volume for intended design upgrades, customization when allocating the design center meeting with the consultant.   This consideration should be extended to both a separate cabinet session as well as interior design session.  15 minutes to design a kitchen is not acceptable, nor fair for your suppliers and/or staffs.  We were fortunate that our consultants (Kim and Ewa) extended their sessions, albeit it rushed to cover everything in person and required greater discussion after to finalize.   This particular build was our third new home construction process, hence we were already quite familiar with the general process and had a relatively clear understanding of what options/features we sought, thus reducing decision-making, but the combination of long delays for unpublished pricing through head-office, coupled by poor drafting considerations at head office (i.e. mud-room configuration for laundry tub plumbing. door locations/swing and HVAC) impacted the process and inhibited our ability to perform a weighted analysis of cost/benefit for our selections against our budget, never mind the frustration of additional meetings and required amendments with our sales rep to correct the structural design for our mud room more than 5 months from initial contract.   
3. Hidden Costs: There were a number of "hidden costs" within the design center process not listed or identified in the pricing package that became apparent when we received the pricing sheets from Concept and Head Office (i.e. low voltage pot light surcharges for dedicated/separate wiring that was not compatible with standard 120v, including surcharge for switch's/dimmers for the low voltage power). Given the volume of selected pot lighting, this additional cost was considerable and not planned, yet were left with little option as we already completed our design appointment.  From a perspective of transparency and buyer satisfaction, this is one critical element that would deter me from recommending Tamarack to family, friends, or colleagues. It truly felt that we were being "nickel and dimed" without even being advised in advance of the costs or given an alternate solution as that is the only product offered by your sub-contractor. This item was specifically brought forward to my sale rep, as she was not even aware of the added costs, thus unable to guide and advise her clients or prospective clients, thus signaling and confirming an issue. No response was provided to me from head office or senior management, nor were any cost options proposed to make it right.  
Further, there were multiple variations of model pricing lists, which had conflicting upgrade descriptions and actual price discrepancies, and in some cases were not relevant to the model design/structure (i.e. master bath shower tile/custom glass). On numerous occasions I had to prompt the our design rep to point out such details to pricing section at head office to correct the pricing. Attention to this detail is important for the buyer and reflects lack of administration and customer service to ensure a smooth and transparent process for the buyer. It was only I who was attentive who sought to correct these pricing issues, otherwise, Tamarack would have continued to over-charge the customer. 
4. Framing/Electrical walk-through inspection:  The site supervisor, Gary, was very knowledgeable, professional and supportive - very happy with his service and care for the buyer.  However, it was unfortunate Tamarack booked my inspection immediately following his 2 week vacation period, thus it not only prevented him from being able to review the site in advance against the plans, upgrades, to ensure the home was "ready" by his site workers.  Consequently, despite all best efforts, the home was not ready or at an expected standard for the inspection, including a number of items that did not comply with the purchase agreement, structural upgrades, and design center/electrical upgrades (i.e. wiring locations for Concept installed entertainment/speakers, garage door location, missing plumbing in mud room, incorrect location of HVAC ducts in mud room and basement bedroom, incorrect height of fireplace placement, location of water line for kitchen fridge, water puddles in second floor vapour barrier ceilings, etc.). Although these items are relatively minor in nature and can be easily rectified, it does create added delays that could have been prevented by the builder through better communication.  Unfortunately, when a buyer becomes responsible to point out errors wrt specs, it creates hesitation and concern from a project management perspective and final output to be received.  I would like to reiterate that it was explicitly noted during the inspection that the incorrect placement of Concept speaker wires/hook-up juncture in the family room required movement as per the design plan, and for the wires NOT to be spliced and extended, but rather re-run without breaks to negate any sound deterioration.  
5. Overall, the staff of Tamarack have been great and I couldn't ask for more, which has made this process go more fairly smooth and made us happy with our Tamarack selection; however, the points noted above do raise concern from my perspective, thus I'd strongly recommend executive management apply consideration to improve the process, output, relationships, to enhance customer experience.  We very much look forward to the final product and taking possession of our Bradbury, Lot6B, as our long-term family home in Poole Creek.

Sincerely,
Andre Savard

Nothings.sales person was excellent. Design center (mandy) was great and very helpful picking finishings.
Keep up the good work.
Nothing I don't think.

We found the selection of finishings a bit confusing.  The process of selecting things, getting quotes and making decisions was challenging.  When you are in the design room or out at the flooring or tile store, it would be nice to have a ball park idea of how much things may cost instead of wasting a lot of time on expensive quotes.  We felt that we should be able to understand what the Tamarack credit for the standard finishing was so that we could estimate the difference in cost... but this seemed to be something we were not privy to.  Additionally, we found the cost for upgrading hardwood to be very unreasonable (particularly the charge to upgrade from carpet to regular hardwood and then again an upgrade to our selected hardwood).  We felt there was no credit for the savings on the carpet cost.  Additionally, on our initial review of the appendix with our upgrades, the initial charge to go from carpet to hardwood was not included, so the price we agreed to pay actually went up by several thousand dollars upon head office review.  This lead to disappointment as we had to make cuts in other areas such as crown mouldings and omit hardwood in the bedrooms to compensate for the oversight and to keep the house within our budget.  

To solve these issues, could there be a guide of some sort given to the purchaser (similar to the way the cabinets are coded and you can look up the cost of it right away - much more transparent)? 

The women who work in the design centre are lovely and helpful, this is not a criticism of their abilities or customer service but rather it is more about the process. 

Lastly, we would change the timing of signing the commitment to purchase document.  You are required to sign off on purchasing the house before you have an understanding of what the upgrades will cost to have the home built the way that you want it.  In our case the discrepancy was almost $100,000 which we were not anticipating at all. Many people ball parked upgrades to be in the range of 30-50,000 when we asked.  Of course you can't know a persons taste when asking that question and we wanted to make our home unique and to our taste.  Informed decision making at the outset would be a more ethical process. You should be able to price out all of your upgrades before committing to the purchase. 

Overall, we are excited about moving into our new home and have had good experiences otherwise.

We had an excellent experience at the sales centre. The staff was very welcoming, informative, and helpful. 

However, the design centre experience was quite disappointing. Scheduling wasn't accommodating our schedules and our work schedules didn't allow meetings during weekedays. I felt the meetings were rushed due to time contraints. Some items had a wide variety of selections, but then many items weren't. Standard items weren't even displayed but showed in photos, which made us feel that the close to half million house doesn't come with adequate standard features. Though quite frustrating and stressful experience at the design centre, the desgin centre consultant was knowlegeable and very straightforward. I liked it how the consultant had a good sense of matching items - countertops, tiles and cabinet and also patience. I was under the impression that the design centre was under staffed. 

We just had our first walk though, very exciting. Our concerns were all received and addressed.

Hope our feedback helps improving the process.
Nothing

My sales representative was excellent, however there is a large disconnect between the sales centre and the design centre. For example, my sales representative informed me that I could ask the design centre to put in the rough ins for an air conditioner and then I could purchase the actual air conditioner unit after closing. The design centre no longer offers this option and therefore I had to purchase the air conditioner from the design centre. I don't believe my sales representative purposely mislead me; rather better communication between the sales office and the design centre is needed.

To explain all the information a bit more slowly, especially for first-time new home buyers, so as not to rush the customer There's a lot if info to digest and it's very easy to overlook an item or a vital piece of info.  To explain thoroughly and with precision this info - customers can often misunderstand what's being said.  To please charge more reasonable prices for upgrades, many of which seemed extravagant, so that it's a win-win situation for both customers and company.

I am very disappointed at some of the standard features offered by the company. For example, the standard carpets are so old fashioned that I am ashamed that this was offered for a house that was over 500k. We designed the kitchen through Muskoka and there was a design fee althouhg it was exactly the same as the model home. I simply can't understand the design fee (roghly 20K). Things like that makes me feel that the whole design process is a rip off. I have gone through this process before in Toronto and it was a totally different experience; albeit a pleasant one.
n/a

Completed the process for two Tamarack homes, and both times were great. If I could think of anything for the design centre, maybe having a few more photos of several of the popular options that are actually in homes, or a sticker indicating that a particular option is found in a specific model home ex: as seen in Eton model home in Chaperal.

The kitchen design took weeks to come back with pricing. It greatly inhibited our ability to make other decisions on upgrades and design features. It also put us over our 45 time allotment for selections, through no fault of our own.
no comment

It came off in her attitude. I am in sales and it was not hard to pick up on. I did upgraded the cupboards in the other area, and Kim was very helpful with working with me to find the proper finishing for the home.

Sales and design centre were perfect. The inability of choosing a water heater but going for a pre-defined water heater company was a BIG disappointment. That should be changed !
